jobTitle: Assistant General Counsel, Litigation
jobDescription: Overview Come join our amazing team of leaders, learners and world-class litigation professionals. Intuit's dispute resolution and government investigations team is responsible for overseeing litigation, investigation matters involving government entities and regulators, responses to third-party requests for information and a wide range of other matters. We champion Intuit's mission, role-model its values, and protect our Company, employees and customers. We're a small but high-performing team with a great culture and a passion for delivering big-impact results. We're seeking a litigation attorney to join our team. This role will report to the Director, Deputy General Counsel, who oversees global litigation and government investigations for Intuit. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring What You Will Bring JD in good standing with California Bar 8-13 combined years of experience in litigation and investigations with a top-tier law firm, in-house legal department, and/or government office A good litigator's mindset: goes the extra mile to get the job done right and sees opportunities in everything to deliver awesome results; understands that the details are critical and the stakes can be high; takes lots of pride in the work; identifies issues proactively and develops solutions; loves to win A good business partner's mindset: comfort and skill at balancing risk and opportunity; thinks creatively and enables the business to make smart decisions Curious and continuous learner: enjoys jumping into new problems and learning new things; asks "why" and "how can we improve;" quickly masters the facts; develops long-term knowledge and deep expertise Team-player: thrives in a team environment and setting up teammates for success; good at building relationships across the company; shows empathy for our customers, colleagues and other stakeholders; open to feedback and collaboration; comfortable in the driver's seat or working as a contributor on a larger team Subject matter expertise in litigation, including motions, pleadings, and discovery (including eDiscovery) Ability to independently and successfully manage significant case load and big cross-company projects for multiple internal stakeholders with competing deadlines Very organized; an ability and interest in prioritizing the most critical work and finding ways to scale; understands the importance of process and rigor; innovates where appropriate to improve processes High level of enthusiasm and a positive attitude Good communication skills and proven ability to interact with business professionals at different levels Good judgment Integrity without compromise; accountable for and committed to their work; and a drive to build and maintain good connections with their teammates and colleagues across the business How You Will Lead How You Will Lead Managing and resolving a wide range of lawsuits and pre-litigation disputes Driving responses to investigation matters and inquiries involving regulators and other government entities Developing all aspects of strategy for managing and resolving cases and investigations Conducting internal investigations and fact development, including working with witnesses Working in close partnership with colleagues in the Legal Department and business partners across the company, to achieve good business and legal results and facilitate smart risk-taking Helping manage Intuit's responses to third-party requests for information, complying with the law and passionately protecting the data of our Company, employees and customers Supervising outside counsel and litigation consultants, managing budgets and supporting litigation and investigations reporting Drafting policies and internal procedures, and conducting training to educate business partners; adding rigor to all aspects of internal processes and champion data-driven decisions

jobTitle: Assistant General Counsel, Platform
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit as Platform Product Counsel. Working as a member of the Products Legal Team, you will be responsible for partnering with multiple innovative product teams around the world to ensure that Intuit’s platform experiences, and developer / partner programs are structured to achieve our business strategy while complying with applicable regulations in multiple jurisdictions. You will partner closely with product management, business development, engineering, design, marketing, compliance and operations teams. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring 8+ years of experience primarily advising technology companies. Significant breadth of knowledge and experience in as many of the following areas as possible: data privacy and protection, IP, mobile and cloud computing, competition law, consumer protection, and developer/ partner platforms and programs. Familiarity with mapping data flows and optimizing data use rights in both product and contract. Demonstrated ability to perform with minimal supervision. Experience providing legal support on a global scale. Ability to communicate with business partners about regulatory obligations and risk management processes. Excellent drafting and negotiation skills. Ability to produce clear and succinct written legal analysis and business communications, and counsel and manage clients, including senior management. Ability to interact with and lead change with senior executive leaders. Ability to effectively frame issues to drive strategic thinking and execution. Comfortable and adept at balancing risk and opportunity, and thinking creatively to enable the business to make smart decisions. JD and membership in good standing with at least one US State Bar required How You Will Lead You will provide legal advice and counseling on a wide variety of matters, including data privacy and protection, mobile, product liability, IP and regulatory compliance. Many of these matters will relate to delivering delightful customer experiences across our platform, and programs that enable developers and partners to build awesome products.

jobTitle: Associate Marketing Manager - Web and HTML Developer
jobDescription: Overview Come join the Digital Marketing Team in a hybrid role to support our e-mail (HTML) and web production in the Intuit ProConnect Group. Show off your extensive experience coding emails using best practices, as well as experience using marketing automation platforms and content management systems to develop email and web assets. The ideal candidate is able to work in a fast-paced and date-driven environment managing multiple projects and deadlines. The candidate is also able to prioritize their own workload to meet changing priorities. What You'll Bring Expert in HTML, CSS - Javascript a plus. Experience in Marketing Automation Platform (Eloqua preferred) and/or using content management systems such as WordPress. Working knowledge of Figma with proven ability to deliver finished experiences based on design specifications. Knowledge of methods and best practices to employ in order to get emails to render consistently across all email clients. A strong sense of web design and user experience fundamentals Experience working in large matrix organization Be a self-starter with the ability to multi-task, juggle multiple projects, and prioritize work. Detail and process oriented 2+ years coding experience in an agency or production environment. How You Will Lead Work directly in our Marketing Automation platform (Eloqua) as well as developing landing pages using our content management system (WordPress). Create reusable email components in Litmus using best practices and techniques such as responsive design. Use testing platforms such as Email on Acid to ensure code is rendering correctly across all email clients and troubleshoot code as needed. Work with internal and external visual designers, copywriters, marketing managers, and marketing operations managers to bring the email and landing pages to life. Manage deliverability platform, make suggestions to improve and implement new technologies. Be familiar with delivery services vendors like Return Path to manage the health of our overall email communications. Support testing initiatives in both e-mail and web platforms to ensure measurement and trackability metrics are in place. Own the component library for our email systems and update based on learnings from customer feedback and test results.

jobTitle: Audio / Visual Engineer
jobDescription: Overview The Event Technology team empowers all employees to get the most out of their meeting, presentation, and remote collaboration tools, and supports them in their endeavors. The team is a part of Intuit’s IT organization and is responsible for the technical aspects of Intuit Mailchimp’s in-house events in Atlanta. We assist with resources and setup for video conferencing and other event technology throughout the office. We handle live-streaming large events internally to employees and externally as needed. We are also responsible for keeping Intuit Mailchimp up to date with the latest tools and trends as it relates to audio-visual technology. The ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about event production while also serving their colleagues. They strive to add production value and creativity to make the broadcast experience better. They love working on a team and collaborating with others throughout the company. They should be self-sufficient and able to analyze situations and make decisions on their own. Flexibility is essential - the demand for Event Tech services is growing so things will be changing often and rapidly - they must be open to learning new things and frequently changing environments. This role is based in the Atlanta office, with some remote flexibility. Occasional travel will be necessary. What You'll Bring 2+ years of broadcast experience in a live production environment Advanced knowledge of video and audio equipment, signal flows and software Advanced troubleshooting skills with the ability to make quick decisions Knowledge of audio and video networking (Dante or similar) Experience with developing event system designs and executing on those plans Experience with Zoom and A/V control systems (Crestron, Q-SYS or similar) Experience with Adobe Creative Suite Experience with related IT systems Experience working in a fast paced live production environment Ability to collaborate effectively with team members onsite and remote Ability to work a flexible schedule and adapt to rapidly changing plans How You Will Lead Technical contributor with the ability to support complex event setups. Be a subject matter expert in multiple audio visual broadcast technologies. Prepare technical documentation for designs, proposals and event support plans. Design, build and test event setups (hardware and software). Operate broadcast production equipment during events as needed, both onsite and off. Oversee equipment upgrades and testing of new solutions. Provide hands-on support for large meetings. Maintain conference room A/V systems.

jobTitle: Backend Software Engineer 2
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is the global leader in financial management software where we have pioneered the shift to Virtual Platforms, cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. Intuit acts as a 35 year old startup, and we are constantly disrupting ourselves as we identify major new technology and design trends that are needed to deliver our mission to power prosperity around the world. Our groups are fast-paced teams focused on delivering innovative capabilities, and having fun while doing it. Note: By applying to this position, your application will be automatically submitted for the following locations: Mountain View, San Diego and the following teams at Intuit. Core Skills What you'll bring BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience 2+ years of experience developing systems/software for large business environments (Java/J2EE, Python, Go preferred) 2+ years of experience designing complex distributed systems, management products or business applications Strong experience with Software Engineering/CS fundamentals, including data structures and algorithms Knowledge of OOD and SOA principles, with ability to implement them in a language of choice Skilled in software development lifecycle processes and experience with scrum, agile and iterative approaches Ability to demonstrate unit testing & Test Driven Development (TDD) Desired Skills Experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos, etc. Experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics Experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments (AWS highly desired) How You Will Lead Code and implement software solutions that will solve critical customer problems, are scalable, secure, easy to maintain, and interact with numerous other services Capture requirements and use cases Partner with other groups both inside and outside of Intuit for cross-functional design, solution integration and on-boarding of mobile/SaaS/PaaS/web/desktop offerings Actively stay abreast of mobile/SaaS/PaaS trends and standards, recommend best practices, share learning, and experiment and apply cutting edge technologies/software paradigms (prototypes, patent proposals and engineering process improvements) Your Attributes Team player possessing strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills Ability to influence and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical people Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, complex technical environment with high adaptability and flexibility "Self-starter" attitude and the ability to make decisions independently

jobTitle: Compliance Manager - Licensing and Exam Management
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit as a Compliance Manager for Licensing and Exam Management. Intuit is seeking a Licensing and Examinations Manager to join its Licensed Offerings team. You will support many of the licenses as well as the entity governance activities and regulatory examinations related to those licenses. This role will report to the Head of Entity Governance, Licensing and Exam Management on the Compliance team. We are looking for a proactive Compliance member to provide strong support for the licensing and examination program. The ideal candidate should have experience in managing Company and individual licenses, including compiling applications; submitting renewals; scheduling and running meetings; preparing materials and taking meeting minutes; and interacting with agencies and examiners. Intuit’s products must continuously delight our customers, conform to Intuit policy and practices, and meet the regulatory requirements imposed upon its regulated activities by state and federal agencies. If you are passionate about innovation, solving tough customer challenges, and compliance as a strategic advantage, then come join our team! We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring Bachelor’s Degree preferred with 5+ years professional experience required 3-5 years’ experience in licensing and/or an in-house legal, risk, or compliance department required 3-5 years’ experience with Company-level licensing in NMLS preferred Experience with money transmittal, lending, brokering and insurance licensing preferred Experience with scheduling and leading meetings required Experience with state and/or federal regulatory examinations and interaction with regulators Proven success working with cross-functional teams Desire to thrive in a fast-paced and multifaceted business Strong organizational skills and attention to detail required Excellent critical thinking, communication, interpersonal and writing skills are a must How You Will Lead Licensing – file licensing documents such as applications, renewals, and required reporting Solve actions items in NMLS related to licenses Coordinate with internal teams to provide required documentation for license renewals and reporting Facilitate payment of necessary licensing fees Organize and maintain licensing documentation Interact with regulators, including asking and answering regulatory inquiries Manage state entity filings, including those relating to DBAs Manage Director/Officer changes, including fingerprinting and attestations Monitor the relevant regulation landscape for changes relating to licenses Exam Management – manage regulatory examinations Lead examinations related to certain licenses, including preparation and delivery of responses Compile requested documentation from internal stakeholders and escalate requests as necessary to meet deadlines Review documents prior to delivery to regulators to ensure proper formatting and content Organize and manage examination documentation Update internal examination reporting and track issues Work cross-functionally across compliance and the business to drive change based on examination findings and recommendations Help drive the mindset that Compliance is a strategic advantage, enabling growth and customer delight

jobTitle: Contracts & Marketing Manager
jobDescription: Overview Come join our amazing team of leaders, learners and world-class legal and compliance professionals. We’re part of an amazing team bringing financial services offerings to market to power prosperity for our customers all over the world! We’re seeking a Contracts & Marketing Manager to assist in the review of our contracts and marketing collateral. The ideal candidate will have experience in both transactions and marketing, and a strong process orientation -- a desire to “never answer the same question twice” by developing tools and processes for self-help and to expedite reviews. In addition, the candidate should have the ability to collaborate with a diversity of stakeholders, have a strong team mentality and be driven to grow professionally and personally. Knowledge of international marketing requirements would also be very desirable. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring Excellent communication, interpersonal and writing skills. Strong organizational skills, time management skills, and attention to detail. 5-10 years’ professional work experience reviewing marketing materials and negotiating domestic and foreign transactions. Experience mentoring / training personnel in various positions (compliance, legal, marketing, business) to enable such personnel to better understand regulatory and contract requirements so they can handle reviews with less complex issues. How You Will Lead Review marketing and sales content for all types of media - establish relationships with marketing and product teams in campaign development and claims substantiation; diplomatically and succinctly communicate content concerns and required edits; explain the applicable advertising standard and regulatory basis for the changes; and recommend creative alternatives to ensure content is compliant. Review, draft, negotiate and finalize transactions, both spend agreements and non-spend partnership agreements. This work will be performed using Intuit’s existing library of forms and transactions playbooks. Develop strong relationships with sourcing and business teams to ensure terms and conditions align with Intuit requirements and business objectives. Be tech-savvy and process oriented, help further workflow processes and efficiencies to scale review of marketing content, and negotiation and management of transactions.

jobTitle: Credit Collections Representative 3
jobDescription: Overview Recruiter to write overview What You'll Bring Strong knowledge of the principals of accounting and reconciliation within a large national retail environment. Minimum 2 years relevant experience in accounting, purchasing, accounts receivable, and/or accounts payable. Previous experience managing all aspects of reconciliation for a major and complex retail chain account. Previous experience with validating and reconciling high volume DFI/charge backs with major retailers (i.e. retailer rebate claims, returns and invoice shipment claims). Capability to multitask and prioritize workload. Strong organizational skills and proven ability to prioritize. Working knowledge of Oracle, QlikSense, Outlook, Word, Google Workspace products. Strong Excel skills, experience with pivot tables and v-lookups. Knowledge of accounting fundamentals. Excellent listening, written and verbal communication skills; communicate effectively across all levels of an organization. Self- motivating and able to work with minimal supervision. Understand responsibilities and prioritize assigned work to ensure performance metrics are met on a timely basis. Ability to work well in a team environment. Work well under occasional pressure (e.g. month and quarter-end) and has track record of flexibilities they may encounter and how to adapt to the change. How You Will Lead Manage assigned customer accounts and resolution of issues associated with this process. Perform customer account reconciliations; gather, prepare, and maintain adequate documentation to support validation of retailer rebate claims. Work closely with Corporate Accounting and Sales Marketing teams to research and resolve claims discrepancies. Maintain an understanding of the business and channel to assess risk and reasonability of the claimed amounts. Initiate disputes of invalid claims and work with internal and external partners for timely resolution to avoid bad debt. Reconcile customer remittance advice and submit to A/R for processing in a timely manner; Provide account status updates to the department supervisor/manager on assigned accounts and escalate issues when needed. Alert department supervisor/manager and Credit Risk Manager of any customer payment behavioral changes. Provide excellent customer service when working with internal and external customers throughout all levels of the collections and reconciliation process. Assist with monthly review and analysis of retail accounts receivable aging to identify trends and/or specific exposures. Prepare month-end reconciliations to ensure accuracy of claims processed in GL, and work with Corporate Accounting team to resolve variances. Assist with preparation of certain quarterly and annual A/R- related schedules for Corporate Finance and external auditors, as needed. Ensure operational and financial integrity within established corporate policies, procedure and controls. Continually assess and design desktop procedures and process flows. Ensure that these workflows are designed to maximize internal controls and efficiency; Effectively leverage resources to perform job duties efficiently; Use analytical skills to continually review established procedures and make recommendations for process improvements, as needed, to ensure department operates efficiently and effectively.

jobTitle: Developer Advocate - Cloud Native, Open Source
jobDescription: Overview Are you passionate about being at the forefront of cloud-native technologies, APIs, and do you thrive on sharing that passion with others in helping them build world-class products? As a Developer Advocate at Intuit, you will be a core contributor to our community outreach and spread the word, both internal and external communities, with a focus on Intuit’s open-source projects alongside Intuit platform capabilities, APIs, and our application and service development platforms to help developers and operators create awesome products. You will be an excellent storyteller using various media including blogs, webinars, demos, and documentation. This role is at the cutting edge of cloud-native, open-source technologies, developer experiences, and API platforms (REST and GraphQL) and you will work closely with product management, developer marketing, technical learning, and engineering teams to evangelize technologies such as Kubernetes, Argo, Istio, public cloud, observability, scalable distributed systems, and AI/MLOps. The ideal candidate will have technical marketing or evangelism experience with hands-on technology skills, coupled with deep customer empathy and a track record of producing and communicating engaging content. What You'll Bring 3+ years of experience in delivering technical content to developer and DevOps teams Hand-on experience with and a solid understanding of the cloud-native ecosystem, developer tools, and APIs Excellent written and oral communication skills; comfortable presenting to large audiences Confident in articulating value propositions, yet able to seamlessly drop into technical details when needed Able to write sample code in Python or Go; ability to write sample code in React and understanding of web applications Good understanding of defining and building SaaS services, products, and infrastructure at scale Previous experiences working with open source products and engaging with the community, either internally or externally Undergraduate degree required; computer science, electrical engineering, math, science, or a related technical discipline preferred, equivalent professional experience will be considered How You Will Lead Create engaging content around Intuit’s open source engagements and products Engage with developers and participate in developer forums; create samples, guides, tutorials, and blogs to ensure an excellent experience, both for internal and external developers Work closely with partners and open source communities, such as CNCF, GraphQL Foundation, to coordinate marketing collateral and initiatives Contribute to documentation working with the engineering organization Be an evangelist for the Intuit development platform, Development Portal, and open source projects both internally and externally by speaking at conferences, meetups, community meetings. Be customer-obsessed, acting as the voice of developers and Intuit’s customers in creating and operationalizing world-class SaaS platforms Help improve our products by providing feedback on API design, platform usability, and functionality Participate in and grow the communities around Intuit’s involvement in open source.

jobTitle: Developer Advocate - Cloud Native, Open Source
jobDescription: Overview Are you passionate about being at the forefront of cloud-native technologies, APIs, and do you thrive on sharing that passion with others in helping them build world-class products? As a Developer Advocate at Intuit, you will be a core contributor to our community outreach and spread the word, both internal and external communities, with a focus on Intuit’s open-source projects alongside Intuit platform capabilities, APIs, and our application and service development platforms to help developers and operators create awesome products. You will be an excellent storyteller using various media including blogs, webinars, demos, and documentation. This role is at the cutting edge of cloud-native, open-source technologies, developer experiences, and API platforms (REST and GraphQL) and you will work closely with product management, developer marketing, technical learning, and engineering teams to evangelize technologies such as Kubernetes, Argo, Istio, public cloud, observability, scalable distributed systems, and AI/MLOps. The ideal candidate will have technical marketing or evangelism experience with hands-on technology skills, coupled with deep customer empathy and a track record of producing and communicating engaging content. What You'll Bring 3+ years of experience in delivering technical content to developer and DevOps teams Hand-on experience with and a solid understanding of the cloud-native ecosystem, developer tools, and APIs Excellent written and oral communication skills; comfortable presenting to large audiences Confident in articulating value propositions, yet able to seamlessly drop into technical details when needed Able to write sample code in Python or Go; ability to write sample code in React and understanding of web applications Good understanding of defining and building SaaS services, products, and infrastructure at scale Previous experiences working with open source products and engaging with the community, either internally or externally Undergraduate degree required; computer science, electrical engineering, math, science, or a related technical discipline preferred, equivalent professional experience will be considered How You Will Lead Create engaging content around Intuit’s open source engagements and products Engage with developers and participate in developer forums; create samples, guides, tutorials, and blogs to ensure an excellent experience, both for internal and external developers Work closely with partners and open source communities, such as CNCF, GraphQL Foundation, to coordinate marketing collateral and initiatives Contribute to documentation working with the engineering organization Be an evangelist for the Intuit development platform, Development Portal, and open source projects both internally and externally by speaking at conferences, meetups, community meetings. Be customer-obsessed, acting as the voice of developers and Intuit’s customers in creating and operationalizing world-class SaaS platforms Help improve our products by providing feedback on API design, platform usability, and functionality Participate in and grow the communities around Intuit’s involvement in open source.

jobTitle: Developer Advocate, Team Lead - Open Source, Cloud Native
jobDescription: Overview Are you passionate about being at the forefront of cloud-native technologies, APIs, and do you thrive on sharing that passion with others in helping them build world-class products? As a Team Lead Developer Advocate at Intuit, you will help build a world class advocacy team and be a core contributor to our community outreach. The team will spread the word, both internal and external communities, with a focus on Intuit’s open-source projects alongside Intuit platform capabilities, APIs, and our application and service development platforms to help developers and operators create awesome products. You are a strategic thinker who understands how advocacy activities impact product adoption and community growth. This role is at the cutting edge of cloud-native, open-source technologies, developer experiences, and API platforms (REST and GraphQL) and you will work closely with product management, developer marketing, technical learning, and engineering teams to evangelize technologies such as Kubernetes, Argo, Istio, public cloud, observability, scalable distributed systems, and AI/MLOps. The ideal candidate will have direct developer advocacy and evangelism experience with hands-on technology skills, coupled with deep customer empathy and a track record of producing and communicating engaging content. They will have experience leading a team and/or cross-functionally dotted line leadership. What You'll Bring 5+ years of experience in developer advocacy and evangelism, 1-2 years in team leadership experience Experience creating, marketing, and editing various forms of technical content that resonates with developers Hand-on experience with and a solid understanding of the cloud-native ecosystem, developer tools, and APIs Excellent written and oral communication skills; comfortable presenting to large audiences Confident in articulating value propositions, yet able to seamlessly drop into technical details when needed Able to write sample code in Python or Go; ability to write sample code in React and understanding of web applications Good understanding of defining and building SaaS services, products, and infrastructure at scale Previous experiences working with open source products and engaging with the community, either internally or externally Undergraduate degree required; computer science, electrical engineering, math, science, or a related technical discipline preferred, equivalent professional experience will be considered How You Will Lead Mentor and coach team on Advocacy best practices and skills Help define how a world class Developer Advocacy team operates and drives business impact Drive the editorial calendar and support the team’s creation of engaging content around Intuit’s open source engagements and products Engage with developers and participate in developer forums; create samples, guides, tutorials, and blogs to ensure an excellent experience, both for internal and external developers Work closely with partners and open source communities, such as CNCF, GraphQL Foundation, to coordinate marketing collateral and initiatives Be an evangelist for the Intuit development platform, Development Portal, and open source projects both internally and externally by speaking at conferences, meetups, community meetings. Be customer-obsessed, acting as the voice of developers and Intuit’s customers in creating and operationalizing world-class SaaS platforms Help improve our products by providing feedback on API design, platform usability, and functionality Participate in and grow the communities around Intuit’s involvement in open source

jobTitle: Digital Sales Consultant, Inbound (Remote)
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is a mission-driven, global financial platform company that gives everyone the opportunity to prosper. With products like TurboTax, QuickBooks and Mint, we’re using technology to build solutions to challenging financial problems for millions of people around the world. Overview Come join one of the fastest-growing business units at Intuit. We are not your typical sales organization. Nothing is more important to us than the success of our customers, which is why we are investing in the growth of this vital piece of our ecosystem. We are problem solvers, strategic thinkers, solution seekers, and consultative experts who use the latest tools and technology to solve our customers’ most important problems. The solutions we present to each client are backed by collaborative cross-functional teams. We serve customers by finding more ways to put more money in their pockets, eliminating work and drudgery so they can focus on their lives and what matters to them, and ensuring that every financial decision that they make, they make it with confidence. That means we won’t simply sell products — we consult and listen deeply to understand our customers’ business needs. As part of Intuit’s Sales organization, every day presents an opportunity to evolve, grow your careers, and unlock your potential. When you win, win as a sales team. What You'll Bring "What You'll bring" Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 0-3+ years of successful track record in SaaS or Cloud sales roles preferred Ability to understand and communicate technical solutions and business value Self-motivated with a high attention to detail and ability to multitask A track record of being driven and achieving goals Make complex problems and solutions simple for people to understand Highly curious about customers and the problems they incur in their small business Seek out feedback/coaching, apply and integrate it quickly in an effort to improve results "How You'll Bring Value" Fluent in the differences between on and off premise software/tech and articulates value proposition through analogies and storytelling Skilled in preparing and delivering tailored solution demonstrations in real time Effortlessly speak to the importance of modernizing / automating most critical business processes. Skilled in managing short cycle sales pipeline in SalesForce.com Understand and articulate how SaaS and hosted solutions improve small business effectiveness Helps to coach, mentor, and onboard new hires Role Summary How you will lead You’ll speak to small businesses from around the country, helping them with the three jobs Intuit solves better than anyone else… managing finances, getting paid, and managing employees. This will require you to ask questions to get to know their business, how they work, and make a recommendation that will solve those jobs better than they thought possible. Your ability to solve problems with connected solutions will not only fuel their success but yours. Your key responsibilities will include taking or making contacts with prospects, converting them to users of our connected solutions, getting them to the right offering for their business, and creating lifelong customers for Intuit. "How You'll Measure Success" Spend 70+% of your time interacting with customers measured by productive time Turn shoppers into buyers measured thru conversion rates Get them onto the strategic right fit platform for their business measured thru online mix rates Sell connected services solving more than the core problem they asked about measured by attach rates Ultimately, drive revenue to exceed your goal

jobTitle: Director, Continuous Improvement, Expert Network of Choice
jobDescription: Overview At the center of any great services organization is an operations strategy that can drive sustainable growth with speed, certainty and security. Amazon, FedEx, and even UPS come to mind as large-scale companies that fuel operational excellence to power amazing customer experiences. And that’s our aspiration. To achieve this same level of scale and growth, we must revolutionize our Customer Success operations function; investing in data and tech-led capabilities to realize our full potential as a platform company. The Customer Success team is executing on key company-wide initiatives to help deliver against our vision and strategy. Customer success is no longer downstream care operations but is a critical component of Intuit’s growth through the delivery of services. This role is focused on services as a product, connecting our customers with financial professionals in our mission of “Powering Prosperity Around the World”. This leadership role, Director, Network Expert of Choice will report into the VP, Continuous Improvement within the Customer Success Organization and be an embedded leader coach focused on accelerating the "Expert Network of Choice" strategic pillar. Also, as the head of the team’s COE, you will focus on developing and maintaining Lean methods/tools/process standards, Lean L&D to enable scaling, developing/maintaining robust change management, process quality/adherence practice, Manager/Leader Standard Work, Building Lean Craft, Leadership Gemba Series, and also Communications (Air War). As we scale our workforce to continue delivering awesome experiences to Intuit customers in new and different ways; you will be responsible for enabling the quality, execution and profitable operating margin for a distributed workforce of experts as we continue our transformation from customer care to professional services. A key deliverable of this role will be to create a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence through LEAN frameworks and efficient tech-led processes to enable long term profitability against our services operating models. This role will also encompass product engagement and leadership, technology knowledge and application, high availability service, business acumen and go-to-market strategies. Your innovative leadership will help us think differently and shape the product’s trajectory by working with senior leadership to define strategy, success metrics and the supporting details of our long-term growth plans. Your focus will be to define what can be versus expanding or replicating what is already in play. This position within Intuit’s Customer Success Services Operations organization will build the nervous system that intelligently and securely connects people to experts at scale. Customer Success at Intuit has entered a new stage of growth, and over the next 3 years we will introduce multiple new services offerings and expand globally. As we grow, the scale and speed in how we leverage data driven innovation and technology will be paramount to our source of competitive advantage…our flexible and AI driven operations. It is critical to ensure our highly complex system operates as efficiently and free from waste as possible to enable the experiences we desire for experts, customers, and our employees. What You'll Bring A seasoned leader with at least 10 years of experience in Lean Implementation who has led a successful cultural transformation. Also has deep Six Sigma and Business Process Reengineering experience driving significant technology and process innovation. Must exhibit strong people leadership, with the ability to inspire an organization to deliver Awesome experiences and a passion for employees’ growth and development. Has a proven track record of building a Lean support system that provides Lean coaching, and education across the enterprise. Has a deep understanding of a Lean supportive management structure across team leads, supervisors, managers, executives, and has experience in implementing these structures enterprise-wide. Must have strong executive presence and be a compelling communicator across all levels of the organization to win hearts and minds. Good listener and problem solver; solutions oriented and great at simplifying complex topics. Knows when to dive deep, and when to stay at a higher level. Must have a very strong pulse on the metrics driving the business. Clearly exhibits a systems thinking mindset, and can apply the appropriate framework at the right time, or create a new one as needed. Not dogmatic about structure, but pragmatic on knowing when to apply. Ability to navigate complex problems & issues, ask questions, and get to the root of what’s driving the specific issue, and develop a structure for resolution so others can make a decision. Organizationally savvy, with good interpersonal effectiveness, influence, and ability to get things done through both formal and informal means. Exceptional ability to collaborate, influence, mobilize and energize key stakeholders and complex cross-org and cross-functional teams to implement creative, innovative, best in class solutions. Manages conflict constructively; Ability to push back, debate, and disagree in a constructive, respectful fashion. Creates an environment where the outcomes win, where all voices are heard, where impact to Intuit is recognized, and conflict is managed in a way that fosters trust and candor. Is curious about what makes up Intuit’s DNA and leverages our organization’s strengths to build Intuit’s future state Lean Operating System. How You Will Lead Develop and maintain Lean methods, tools, and process standards for Intuit’s Customer Success organization and work across business units to maintain consistency in Lean methods. Build, recruit and hire a world class team of practitioners Lean and Six Sigma expertise to coach and teach organizations across Intuit Customer Success, building proficiency and application of new frameworks to drive operational excellence and process transformation. Lead and inspire the team with a compelling vision, and provide the right environment, feedback, coaching and growth opportunities to enable them to do the best work of their lives. Understanding core strategic customer and expert needs, build and implement Lean Transformation to increase expert productivity, build expert proficiency, increase expert utilization, reduce expert overhead, automate quality and drive efficient operations, all with a continuous improvement culture and mindset. Cultivate and scale a world-class operations organization through the development, implementation and on-going iteration of capabilities built around operational efficiency, customer satisfaction, customer retention, and team member retention. This includes Implementing an enterprise-wide Lean Operating System on a rapid timeline. Create an environment of innovation and continual improvement to re-imagine how we define and deliver customer experiences. Build a lean culture of continuous improvement across the Intuit Customer Success Ecosystem, implementing scalable best practices and ongoing programs to enable teams to maximize their efficiency and simplify how they work. Build an innovative and inspiring “coaching culture” where diverse team members can thrive in an inclusive environment. Work with direct team and cross-functional partners to find learnings from real-life situations to set and improve metric-based goals; consistently drive teams towards higher performance and quality expectations. Support cross-functional teams across Intuit on their continuous improvement journey by guiding them through an understanding of Lean /Six-Sigma concepts, Kaizen events and other process improvements methods to drive key KPIs in cost, delivery, and quality. This includes a “gemba first” approach to their work that can be measured by specific metrics and outcomes. Drive adoption of Lean Continuous Improvement and Six Sigma including KPI definition and standardization principles on ensuring quality of service, anomaly detection and

jobTitle: Director Customer Success Ops, Expert Planning
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit we believe everyone has the right to prosper, which is why our mission is Powering Prosperity Around the World. Being a mission-driven company includes living our values every day. That means integrity is at the foundation of everything we do, including the products we design, the role we play in the communities we are part of, and the way we treat every person that is a part of the Intuit family. Our products, including TurboTax, QuickBooks, Mint, Credit Karma and the newly acquired Mailchimp, help solve our customers’ most important problems to help them make more money, save time, and make financial decisions with confidence. Intuit was founded in 1983 by Scott Cook and Tom Proulx and went public in 1993. Today, with a customer base of over 100 million and over 14,000 employees, Intuit serves customers worldwide in 20 locations and 9 countries by using our AI-driven expert platform to deliver powerful solutions for our customers’ most important financial problems. And as much as we have re-invented our products and services, we have always stayed true to our core values. Delivering on our mission on behalf of customers also means going beyond the products and services. We are committed to leaving the world a better place than when we found it by delivering job readiness and creation through our Prosperity Hub Program, making a positive impact on climate with our focus on becoming twenty times carbon positive by 2030 and our unrelenting commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We’re proud to have a culture that attracts top talent and empowers them to do the best work of their lives. When employees know they can bring their whole selves to work – that translates into an environment that has been recognized as one of the world’s best and most innovative places to work year upon year. Description The Intuit Customer Success Operations organization is looking to hire a world class leader as Director, Expert Planning reporting into the VP, Customer Success Operations. This leader will drive planning as a platform approach leveraging data and technology for our customer to expert match making. This leader must have skills to influence at an executive level, the ability to articulate end-to-end platform planning strategy while navigating continuous business changes and priorities. The leader must have experience leading planning in a fast past, growing and service oriented organization. This leader is expected to transform the way we plan across all of our lines of businesses and staffing models to enable scale and business growth, by making planning significantly simpler and more granular for our team, leveraging data and technology. You'll be accountable for establishing demand and capacity models, and processes that support business units and leaders’ efforts to achieve consistent service performance, accommodate new initiatives, deliver budget goals, and make operational decisions based on timely relevant information. In addition, be a strategic thought partner when it comes to identifying continuous improvement opportunities to drive efficiency and effectiveness. This leader will have accountability for growing a high-performing team across demand and capacity planning for our expert population. Customer Success at Intuit has entered a new stage of growth, and over the next 3 years we will introduce multiple new services offerings and expand globally. As we grow, the scale and speed in how we leverage data driven innovation and technology will be paramount to our source of competitive advantage…our flexible and AI driven operations. It is critical to ensure we accurately and efficiently connect our customers with our experts in our growing live business services. What You'll Bring A seasoned leader with at least 10 years of experience with a proven record of transforming workforce planning processes to a data and tech led organization. Track record of setting clear and actionable strategy on leveraging technology and AI at scale and an end-to-end system thinker in a service industry. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with deep customer success and live services oriented organization experience. Strong data analytics experience, strong leadership skills, and the ability to lead across multiple stakeholders. Additionally, strong analytical skills are required to perform real-time analysis as well as optimization and predictive analytics that helps drive business decisions and planning. Proven track record of driving new technology development and adoption for the team to plan as a platform. Experience in predictive modeling and forecast model development using multiple business intelligence inputs. Expected to operate with a continual improvement mindset, focused on inquiry forecasting, delivering reporting and metrics to frontline leadership, and driving a workforce scheduling process that drives efficiency and improves effectiveness across all business units. Team Leadership: Build and lead strong teams. Ability to evaluate teams, develop, and reshape them as necessary while mentoring and inspiring them to drive continually improving results through strong leadership. Cross functional and executive influence: Working cross-functionally with Finance, Business Units, Product, Technology and Operations to ensure customer success. Accountability: Quantifying business needs and developing metrics. Proven track record of delivering performance against goals consistently and predictably. Ability to distill complex issues into structured frameworks and concrete action plan. Organizationally savvy, with good interpersonal effectiveness, influence, and ability to get things done through both formal and informal means. Exceptional ability to collaborate, influence, mobilize and energize key stakeholders and complex cross-org and cross-functional teams to implement creative, innovative, best in class solutions. How You Will Lead Design and implement a winning strategy on how we plan as a platform. Own designing an optimized forecasting & scheduling model for all business areas, leveraging AI -Data driven approach. Lead the team that supports demand forecasting and capacity planning, including scheduling to cover short, medium, and long-term strategy to meet service level and saturation goals supporting various levels of leadership and stakeholders. Facilitate and lead functional and cross-functional, end-to-end process mapping and analysis sessions to identify areas for process improvement, simplification, and automation. Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the employee, internal/external customer experience. Drive resolution and/or mitigation of current and anticipated capacity planning and workforce challenges, analyzing and identifying critical workforce requirements vital to execute strategic business plans. Manage a process with internal stakeholders to ensure current forecasts and supporting reports are meeting business needs. Help business leaders identify volume trends and proactively plan for resource needs; collaborate to project future volume expectations for all upcoming monthly and annual call patterns (Monthly Updates, Marketing Information, New Hire Classes, Shrinkage Calculations, AHT and ADH patterns, Day of Week patterns, Seasonality trends). Operate at multiple altitudes with a focus on execution and the day-to-day tactics to drive velocity, balancing pace of delivery with the long term needs of an expanding business, all the while bringing a people first leadership style to a flexible and collaborative environment.

jobTitle: Director, Employee Relations
jobDescription: Overview Intuit’s new People Experience team shapes experiences that maximize the potential of our people. The Employee Relations partner group is one pillar of the team and focuses on fostering a high-trust, high-performance culture across the company. We’re navigating the challenges of a work-from-home environment with the weight of a global pandemic, conversations about systemic racism and a polarized political world resting on everyone’s shoulders. We are re-imagining Employee Relations for this new world including how we handle workplace conflicts and how we lean into a more proactive, data-driven approach to organizational health issues and teaching employees what it means to share diverse points of review with respect. We are taking today’s and tomorrow’s challenges head on because, at Intuit, we believe that we are stronger together. What You'll Bring BS/BA and JD degree preferred and 10 plus years of relevant work experience; deep domain experience in the areas of employee relations, workplace conflict and performance management on a global scale; minimum 5-7 years of experience managing people, or equivalent experience Experienced people leader with a track record of building high performing teams and leading teams through transformational changes Talent steward who is able to successfully attract, grow and inspire top talent Demonstrated success in applying fresh, innovative thinking, data-driven and a growth mindset to long-standing, complex challenges/problems resulting in high impact outcomes Strong business and people acumen, as well as consulting, conflict resolution and facilitation skills In depth understanding of diversity, equity and inclusion issues and how they apply to employee relations In depth understanding of all aspects of US employment and human resources related laws, regulations, policies, principles, concepts and practices, including ADA, ADEA and FMLA. Knowledge of and experience with international labor practices in countries where we do business strongly preferred (Canada, UK, India, Israel, Australia) Ability to work collaboratively, lead and influence at all levels within the organization, and make decisions while keeping all partners and leaders informed Demonstrated operational and process rigor and familiarity and comfort with HR related technology and tools/case management, preferable Salesforce, ServiceNow and Smartsheets How You Will Lead Lead a team going through a transformation journey into Employee Relations for the new world, with high-engagement and high-performance Support the team as they build new skill sets (for example, conflict resolution, mediation, restorative justice) and grow expertise in understanding how bias impacts decisions and how we build processes to ensure equity Re-imagine and define how we address performance concerns and terminations across the company and around the world, by looking at principles, people, processes and technology Drive accountability and operational excellence in everything we do from case management to delivering on priorities and projects Define and lead the team in strategy and execution of organizational changes and performance-based exits (org changes, job eliminations and involuntary exits) Define and own how we consult on and address and build broadening capability across our People organization on organizational health issues and specific employee workplace conflicts and concerns, including conflicts with managers, organizations that have gaps in belonging and trust and social media posts and comments that do not align to Intuit’s values or commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion Work closely with the other People Experience teams on coordinated case management, protocols and metrics Partner closely with Talent Development, Total Rewards and other Centers of Excellence and HR Business Partners on the People Experience team to bring an employee experience lens to the product, services and processes we deliver Ensure oversight and governance of policies and practices globally, including interpreting and apply understanding of corporate policies and practices, employment laws, and other regulations to provide advice, guidance, or clarification for Employee Relations inquiries

jobTitle: Director of Business Development, QuickBooks
jobDescription: Overview Intuit has identified omnichannel commerce as one of its top declared “Big Bets” for the next few years, with the objective of becoming the center of growth for SMBs. A new organization has been created within Intuit’s Small Business and Self-Employed Group (SBSEG), to lead the charge in this space. Intuit has also announced the acquisition of TradeGecko, a leading omnichannel Order and Inventory Management platform as a first step in the aggressive pursuit of this objective. The Head of Business Development for Quickbooks will be responsible for defining and executing on all aspects of the partnership strategy from inception to delivery as part of a new business within Intuit. This executive will build and lead the partnerships organization for eCommerce, responsible for developing partnerships strategy, partnering with key internal stakeholders across product, engineering, marketing, sales and support, and managing the partnership lifecycle. They will partner closely with the senior leadership team to ensure alignment with other aspects of the Small Business & Self-employed platform, product and partnerships ecosystem. The right candidate will be a strategic and ambitious visionary with the proven ability to deliver impactful partnerships that deliver exceptional value to the end customers, partners and Intuit. Furthermore, this leader should be highly motivated to succeed, and empower his/her team to do so, in an approachable manner, that engenders trust and confidence at all levels across the organization. What You'll Bring The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success and significant experience in complex, fast-paced digital environments. This individual will be a self-starter who can work in a rapidly changing industry and can scale a high growth business. They will have demonstrated success in delivering products to market that are cutting edge and have proven business value, creating synergies across multiple product and services lines, and successfully developing and mentoring talent. Seasoned strategic partnerships / business development executive with 15+ years-experience in the eCommerce space Deep familiarity of the eCommerce ecosystem, core players and both seller and buyer dynamics in the B2B and B2C spaces, across both online marketplaces, ecommerce platforms, POS solutions and point software capability providers for SMB sellers Proven success in delivering SMB / seller commerce partnerships based on deep empathy and understanding of both seller and buyer needs Successful track record in developing and bringing to life partnership strategies through a lens of build / buy / partner and in partnership with product and GTM leaders Strong communication skills and executive presence in engaging with senior internal and partner executives Deep experience in negotiating partnership deals spanning product, GTM, commercial and legal aspects Experience defining and executing strategic growth initiatives in large, distributed organizations with quantified results for customers and the business through constant learning and experimentation Creative, strategic, and innovative, with a strong ability to execute and deliver bottom line results. Outstanding analytical skills and the ability to assess disparate data streams and distill them into meaningful, actionable strategic insights and recommendations Demonstrated blend of strategic thought leadership, analytical skills, creativity, and effective communication to consistently motivate and influence key stakeholders Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. An accomplished presenter who can successfully articulate the vision, product and strategy, as well as the critical issues and priorities Confidence and agility to succeed in an entrepreneurial, ever-changing environment. Ability to think creatively and strategically to capitalize on new business opportunities Experience defining and executing strategic growth initiatives in large, distributed organizations with quantified results for customers and the business through constant learning and experimentation Experience building strong teams and setting the tone for a high-trust environment. Proven ability to build, motivate, and mentor an exceptional product team to support growth Strategic thinker who can create and develop the long-term vision and is also a strong personal contributor with a desire to “roll-up their sleeves" Bachelor’s degree in combination with MBA preferred How You Will Lead Thought Leadership: Be an expert in either FMS or the Commerce space, acting as a consultative strategic advisor for Product Leaders in how partnerships can accelerate strategies to win. Be a deep expert in mid-market, and SMB and how partnerships play an enormous role in their success. Support BB4 & BB5 in partnership strategy Revenue: Revenue accountability across the portfolio of business. Manage a team who will create new revenue opportunities (new & existing partners) M&A: Working closely with the Segment teams to provide financial and business analysis that will form the foundation for M&A and partnership strategic rationale, target selection and deal justification Strategy: Developing short, medium, and long-term plans based on our partnership objectives and work cross functionally with marketing, product, engineering, sales and customer success teams to achieve our goals Leadership: Significant experience of clearing roadblocks, mediating disputes, celebrating successes, and using operating mechanisms to continually assess progress and improve

jobTitle: Director of Engineering, Machine Learning (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview The Data Engineering and Services team build systems that bridge the gap between raw business data and consumable data products that customers can trust and take action on. We accomplish this by providing our data science partners with AI/ML development, experimentation, and production environments with access to an elastic, distributed model training and inference infrastructure. What that actually looks like is working with folks from across the Product, Marketing, and Customer departments to understand their needs and then surface data, predictions, or AI/ML model in the most useful format. We make data science workflows repeatable, scalable, and observable while reducing toil and increasing release velocity. What You'll Bring You have several years of experience managing high-performing ML engineering teams You are an outstanding written communicator You have a track record of delivering for your customers successfully You are an empathetic leader who values bringing diverse perspectives to the table You drive clarity when things are ambiguous and operate calmly under pressure You are patient, resilient, collaborative, persuasive and able to lead a team without resorting to authority even when it’s challenging, ambiguous, or intense You have experience delivering simple solutions to complex problems via consistent, iterative releases You have a commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously reviewing and adjusting processes, org structure, tools, etc. You are able to effectively coach and manage the performance of people managers and engineers ranging from highly experienced to entry level How You Will Lead Foster an inclusive environment within your teams and peers in Data Engineering Lead and equip a distributed engineering team to develop and improve our processes for Data Scientists to convert models into optimal representations for inference, define our evolution and migration to cloud data science development and deployment, productionize ML models, and advance our Responsible AI policies and practices Collaborate with engineers, product and project managers, privacy legal team, and other peers to develop and maintain ML engineering solutions in support of predictive analytics and other data products as required to support Product, Marketing, and Customer teams Promote and educate your peers and senior leadership on the systems your team builds and maintains through thorough documentation and diagrams of the systems and data flows Coach and mentor decision making and problem solving and identify and sponsor growth opportunities for your team Partner with teammates to prioritize work, triage issues and eliminate obstacles in the team’s path Work with Data team leaders to ensure your team has appropriate numbers and skills to accomplish its goals

jobTitle: Director of UX Research (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit, our mission is powering prosperity around the world. We build intuitive web, mobile, and cloud solutions that generate more money, more time, and more confidence for 46+ million people. Leveraging big data insights, machine learning, and powerful automation, we help consumers, small business owners, and the self-employed achieve their dreams of prosperity. The design research team at Mailchimp leverages qualitative and quantitative research methods to help teams gain a deep understanding of business’s attitudes, needs, and motivations to guide the development of innovative marketing capabilities for small and medium sized businesses. We pride ourselves on our collaborative and customer-obsessed culture where designers and researchers feel supported and inspired. We are looking for a curious and collaborative research leader to join our team who is passionate about solving tough business problems. At Intuit, we put our employees first, and this role requires a servant-leader who can coach, grow, and inspire team members to do the best work of their lives delivering amazing end-to-end customer-driven innovation & experiences. What You'll Bring 10+ years of UX/design research experience, working cross functionally with product, design, marketing, and other stakeholders 5+ years directly managing a team of design researchers or similar people management experience Advanced degree in Design, HCI, Human Factors, or a related field/equivalent preferred but open to candidates with various backgrounds Experience managing teams in a complex product ecosystem with many sets of stakeholders T-shaped design leader well-versed in research, technology, and design thinking Deep understanding of product-building functions such as data, design, and product management Experience working in a large matrixed organization with multiple stakeholders Proven history shipping consumer-facing products (web, mobile apps, platforms) to the market Understanding how to complement qualitative findings with quantitative data Experience conducting remote-only research Along with your resume, we’d love to see work samples - especially examples of leading strategic research teams with significant business outcomes! How You Will Lead Establish clear and actionable foundational understanding of our current and future customers (small and medium sized businesses and marketers) that informs design decisions, catalyze product direction, influence roadmaps and helps deliver towards product goals Lead and manage a team of design researchers ensuring delivery of the highest quality, coach and grow team members, manage resourcing and budgets Empower product teams with frameworks, best practices, tools, education and other means of unlocking insights for themselves through clear learning plans, testable hypotheses, and experimental methods (in and out of product) Balance process and rigor but understand how to make an impact in a fast-paced agile environment Must manage a myriad of stakeholders and partnerships across product, marketing, customer, and other teams Partner with the data team to develop a holistic data-backed perspective (qual + quant) Provoke the organization with what is possible and clearly show how we might get there Serve as a senior member of the Design leadership team, discussing overall design strategy helping to lead cross-vertical initiatives and projects, and advocating for the customer Be a thought partner and craft leader who contributes to a community of design research practice across Intuit and beyond How You Will Lead Exemplify Intuit’s values and apply them to how you operate day-to-day as a leader Bring a positive, solution-centric and growth mindset Be gritty and create clarity for your teams in the face of ambiguity Lead by example and raise the bar for the craft of research Be an expert in the product that we’re building for our customers Build durable and strategic partnerships with stakeholders across the organization with an adaptive, empathetic, collaborative leadership mindset Develop and refine equitable practices and cultivate a diverse and effective team
