jobTitle: Group Product Manager - QuickBooks Time
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is a global technology platform that helps our customers and communities overcome their most important financial challenges. We help give over 50 million consumers, small businesses, and self-employed customers around the world the opportunity to prosper. Intuit believes in the power of the individual. The power to do more. To make more. To be more. We believe in the people who do things – the hat jugglers, the to-do list junkies, the masters of getting it done faster, better and more efficiently than ever before. Whether that's balancing the household budget, running a business or paying taxes. We believe in these people because we are these people. We thrive on action – and results. And by making things simpler, we all get more out of doing what we love. We're innovators and have been at it for more than three decades. And we don't stand still. As the world evolves, so do we – inventing new solutions to solve important problems, perfecting those solutions and delighting our customers. In short: We’re on a mission to power prosperity around the world. We started small in 1983 with Quicken personal finance software, simplifying a common household dilemma: balancing the family cheque book. Today, we serve 42 million customers in North America, Europe, Australia, Mexico, and Brazil, with products available from the desktop to the cloud. Supporting Our Mission, Our Strategy Is To Apply a Laser-like Focus To Help Our Customers Prosper Through One Intuit Ecosystem That Puts more money in their pockets through data-driven services Eliminates work through innovative technology Provides complete confidence that they can do it right – by themselves – with complete confidence Just as we transformed before, from DOS to the web, and to the cloud and mobile, we are evolving again to deliver personalized experiences on a trusted, open platform and help create indispensable connections. As the way we live and work evolves, we adapt our strategy to meet and lead these changes. No matter where you find us – and whether you use our products on your PC, mobile phone or tablet – we remain committed to creating new and easier ways for consumers and businesses to tackle life's financial chores, giving them more time to live their lives and run their businesses. As our business and product lines grow beyond accounting and into new areas, we will build on our heritage of innovation. That's not just our history. It's our future. What You'll Bring Proven track record in product management roles designing and delivering world class solutions that have delighted customers and driven business growth Proven track record of attracting and growing top talent and building high performing teams Track record of working effectively in a matrix environment Passion for solving problems, and unearthing customer insights to guide product solutions Must have deep customer empathy and curiosity Hands-on, hardworking, scrappy. Energized by the challenge of creating competitive “moats” by delivering complex ecosystem experiences that are hard to match. Must have a 'can do' attitude with an entrepreneurial mindset and be comfortable working in a fast paced, unstructured environment 8+ years designing and delivering world-class products in a Product Management role 3+ years of experience working on consumer products and with small businesses, with a portfolio of product and feature releases that demonstrate well-crafted customer experiences 3+ years of experience managing a team of Product Managers Experience driving growth of product from launch phase to scaled adoption, including demonstrated ability to set a broad vision and translate to a roadmap with end-to-end execution Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate at all organizational levels Develops and defends strong points of view with data and analytics; not afraid to be wrong - but adjusts rapidly to new data Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage tradeoffs and evaluate opportunistic new ideas with internal and external partners High level of professionalism, passion and a sense of urgency to “make things happen” Bachelor's degree or equivalent required Please note that this role can be based out of Mountain View, CA or Boise, ID. If you are based out of Mountain View then travel to Boise would be 25% to 50% travel during initial ramp up time in the role. How You Will Lead Collaborate with senior leadership to form a product strategy and vision that align with our key strategic goals as an organization Serve as a key leader on the Time Product Management leadership team and work closely with cross-functional leaders Lead product prioritization processes across organizations, ensuring we deliver products that solve the biggest customer problem, deliver strong market position and generate durable business benefits (revenue, adoption, retention, etc.) Take ownership of the product strategy and roadmap for ecosystem Time experiences, driving positive customer and business outcomes Build relationships with partners, build high performing teams Motivate, empower, and grow a team of talented product managers to deliver solutions that delight our customers and challenge the status quo Create a team culture that fosters learning and executional excellence Inspire and develop product managers to define innovative solutions using design thinking methodologies Coach teams to make data-backed decisions and set a high bar on measurable goals Encourage a culture of experimentation, learning, and a growth-mindset - never settling for the status quo and innovating on the bleeding edge of what’s possible Know our competitors, their offerings and how our offerings compare Collaborate with other QuickBooks ecosystem partners (e.g., Payroll, Capital, Payroll, Sales tax, and Accounting, etc.) to build end-to-end delightful experiences for the consumer

jobTitle: Group Product Manager - Virtual Expert Platform
jobDescription: Overview Come join the Virtual Expert Platform as a Group Product Manager, where you will foster anenvironment of technology innovation and customer obsession. In this role, you will be a partof a team of technically minded Product Managers, co-creating to build technologies thatenable AI-powered connections between customers and experts across all Intuit product lines. You’ll be a part of the Intuit Virtual Expert Platform, which delivers core common capabilitiesfor all Intuit customers and products around the world, and plays a key role in drivingcustomer benefit, growth, and long-term differentiation for the company. In joining the IntuitPlatform team, you will lead the product strategy for information gathering and exchange forIntuit and partner closely with product managers, architects, and designers across Intuitbusinesses to enable awesome platform capabilities. What You'll Bring 8+ years of experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver best-in-class virtualcollaboration services for customers with experience in information and datagathering Is data-driven with a proven track record identifying product experience successmeasures while working with analytics teams/tools to track KPIs Excellent communication skills – both oral and written and a track record of gainingthe confidence executive management An exceptional drive - applying the nuances of influencing based on the situation,knowing when to push and when to ease, driving through designs, ideas, androadmaps Has a 'can do' attitude with an entrepreneurial mindset and be comfortable working ina fast-paced, ambiguous environments A demonstrated passion for delivering superb customer experiences Learning mindset, curious, bold, self-aware and humble Experience developing and coaching high-performance teams Technical Product Management DNA and subject matter expertise in virtualcollaboration; you have spent 8+ years building world-class SaaS-based products Strong background and experience in people management of product managers Bachelor's degree required, equivalent experience will be considered How You Will Lead Build and drive a bold vision for collaboration experiences with customers with aplatform mindset Identify new opportunities based on customer and competitive research, industrytrends and best practices Translate vision into strategy and an execution roadmap to deliver measurableoutcomes aligned to objectives Understand how to deliver platform capabilities and experiences that will be sharedacross multiple personas and customer archetypes Build strong working relationships with senior end executive leaders across Intuitteams to collaborate and co-create roadmaps Consistently work to optimize the broader organization operating model (process,people, structure, partnerships) and drive change to improve Create and maintain momentum, helping teams move forward swiftly and with rigor, Have a learning mindset and a bias toward action Have experience in leveraging AI to enable personalized experiences which arecontextually relevant Collaborate well with product management and design leaders in creating a visionand deliverables for Intuit ecosystem experiences

jobTitle: High Value Sales Development Representative (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small businesses. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaigns, CRM, and analytics tools. Mailchimp is looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with current and potential customers in the U.S. and International markets. To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. You will use your communication skills to cultivate relationships with customers, from first contact through the close of the sale. If you are motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we would like to meet you. Ultimately, you will boost sales and contribute to our long-term business growth. What You'll Bring Proven work experience as a Sales Development Representative (SDR), Sales Account Executive, or similar role Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calling) Track record of achieving sales quotas Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) Familiarity with Google Workspace Understanding of sales performance metrics Excellent communication skills Experience working in International markets Bilingual highly preferred High School Diploma or equivalent How You Will Lead Qualifying leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities Contacting potential mid-market customers through cold calls and emails Presenting our company to potential customers Identify customer needs and suggest appropriate products/services Build long-term relationships with customers Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market Setup meetings or calls between customers and Account Executives Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing plans

jobTitle: Income Tax Preparer - 3+Yrs Paid Tax Experience Required
jobDescription: Overview Are you a credentialed CPA, EA, or practicing attorney? And do you have a minimum 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year? If you’re one of tax professionals, we need you to help our customers complete their taxes using TurboTax. You’ll advance our goal of “Powering Prosperity Around the World” by providing expert guidance and explanations of tax and technical terms to our customers. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by delighting our customers and empowering them to prepare their taxes. What You'll Bring Must possess active unrestricted credential: EA (Enrolled Agent), CPA (Certified Public Accountant), or Practicing Attorney with strong tax preparation experience and extensive knowledge of tax laws Must possess or be able to obtain any related State licenses, certificates, permits or bonds Must possess active PTIN (Preparer Tax Identification Number) 3 or more years of recent experience preparing federal and state individual 1040 tax returns for clients/customers, using commercial tax preparation software Working knowledge of Circular 230 Audit experience a plus (IRS and state tax authorities) Proficient with technology; solid knowledge of computer operations and software Must have (or be willing to obtain) a dedicated hardwired internet connection Strong customer service skills - ability to interact with customers through video and audio tools in a way that is professional, friendly and reassuring Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision Critical thinking, problem solving, research skills and determination Bilingual (English/Spanish) communication skills (written & spoken) a plus For internal use: tst How You Will Lead This is a seasonal, virtual, customer-facing role; you will be using our state of the art video communication software (SmartLook) to interact with customers Help TurboTax customers who are working on their tax return with 1) Tax advice, including return preparation and signature when required; 2) Product/software inquiries, and 3) Tax calculations Create high quality customer interactions and experiences that instill confidence using deep customer empathy, and your deep knowledge and expertise in the field of tax preparation Utilize and leverage government websites, professional resources, and team expertise to seek out and deliver the right answer to the customer using everyday language Apply defined practices, procedures, and company policies to troubleshoot and resolve tax advice and preparation customer inquiries Document customer interactions If you are a Colorado resident, visit intuit.com/careers/colorado-job-postings-information/

jobTitle: Intuit Business Operations - Senior Manager
jobDescription: Overview We are a small, focused team with a learning and experimentation mindset working to make Intuit the best-run platform company in the world. The improvements we drive as a team touch every aspect of Intuit’s structure, processes and business model and will fuel investment in Intuit’s growth priorities. What You'll Bring We are looking for an individual who can establish rapport, credibility, trust and respect throughout Intuit and is viewed as a team player. Intuit Business Operations acts as a source of future leaders within the company and we expect exceptional leadership skills and potential. To be successful in this role, the candidate must have the following: Strong academic record required. MBA or equivalent from a nationally recognized institution preferred 2-6 years of work experience in roles that were delivering impact across an organization. Examples include experience in a top tier consulting firm focused on strategy and implementation, being part of a strategy or business operations team in a technology company, and/or helping improve efficiency or effectiveness in a business function of a technology company Demonstrated ability to understand end-to-end processes and come up to speed quickly on new business domains Passion for excellence and the desire to have a significant impact on the business Highly self-motivated and willing to proactively take on issues within teams and the company at large Well-rounded interpersonal skill set with the capacity to build strong relationships with senior executives Excellent quantitative analytical skills, creativity in problem solving and a keen business sense Strong communications (written/verbal), presentation and facilitation skills Strong process and project management skills How You Will Lead This role will have CEO Staff visibility, allowing you to forge relationships with senior leaders from every group in the company. The role is the perfect platform to learn about virtually every aspect of Intuit’s businesses and a great foundation for a high-impact career. In This Role, You Will Have The Opportunity To Shape and manage the company’s operating rhythm Partner with Intuit’s most senior leaders to jointly problem solve and develop solutions to complex business problems Provide focused analytical support to leaders responsible for operational improvements, ensuring execution is set up for success and managed rigorously Learn from internal and external best practices and work with business leaders to implement and scale them across the company Recent Efforts Supported By The Team Include Developing and launching a company-wide goal-setting framework that creates alignment, transparency and accountability on the most important work Partnering with our CTO and Chief Customer Success Officer to understand and implement customer experience measurement best practices across the company Reimagining and executing the 3&1-year planning process across financial planning, defining annual goals and tech resource planning Specific Responsibilities Include Drive Intuit’s operating rhythm with a focus on the operating mechanisms (meetings/reviews) where the progress of goals and outcomes are reviewed Manage and improve the company-level goal process and thought partner across the business to define high-quality goals and ensure regular updates Build and maintain the infrastructure that supports annual goal planning as part of 3&1-year planning and in-year goal planning and execution

jobTitle: Lead Accountant
jobDescription: Overview The QuickBooks Capital team is on a mission to transform small business (“SMB”) lending. Imagine empowering QuickBooks customers to access funding in hours whenever they need it. Imagine giving SMBs the clarity to make the right decision about when to take funding, how much to take, and what type. We’re working to make this a reality. QuickBooks Capital is adding new products at record setting speed to support our customers. We are helping our small businesses access the capital they need using technology and data to simplify the process. If you are passionate about innovating for small businesses, solving customer problems, tapping the power of big data, and working in an incredibly fast-paced and fun environment, we invite you to come join our team. We are looking for a Lead Accountant to support our growing portfolio and handle the daily operational accounting of our business. We are focused on accelerating our growth and scaling the business and this role is critical to our success. There is a tremendous amount of innovation ahead to achieve this scale with institutional quality servicing systems, data, reporting and operational processes. What You'll Bring 7+ years of technical accounting experience with accruals, journal entries, and account reconciliations Ability to interpret and present technical accounting details in lay terms to non-accounting business partners Strong technical (GAAP) and financial accounting skills and ability to document accounting conclusions in a technical white paper Public accounting or large public company experience strongly preferred Software industry experiences a plus Analytical thinker who can identify and implement effective processes improvements Large accounting software package expertise (Oracle financials, etc). Strong attention to detail, excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills, strong written and oral communication skills Outstanding Excel skills CPA preferred BS or BA Degree preferred or equivalent work experience How You Will Lead Gather, prepare, test and maintain journal entries for a broad range of accounting areas consistent with GAAP and corporate accounting policies to ensure close timelines are met. Effectively assess risk over accounts and areas of responsibility. Apply judgment to ensure that financial integrity of accounting entries, accruals, and account reconciliations are intact and operating effectively. Assist in research of technical accounting issues as needed. Apply proper accounting treatment required as a basis for booking journal entries and gathering audit evidence. Technical accounting preferences in credit losses, allowance for loan losses, ASC 606, ASC 860. Participate in the month and quarter end close process and related responsibilities for the accounting department. Prepare and maintain reports / schedules for management, prepare schedules requested by internal and external auditors. Research and document company position on technical accounting issues with the ability to effectively communicate and present to business partners. Support compliance and improve processes and internal controls in area of responsibility. Understands business unit and functional group strategy, priorities and offerings, developing deep knowledge of core and adjacent markets. Prepare financial statements including Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Statement of Cash Flows, and Statement of Shareholders’ Equity in accordance with GAAP. Work directly with external auditors to support financial statement audits and control environment testing.

jobTitle: Lead Financial Analyst
jobDescription: Overview The Small Business & Self Employed Group (“SBSEG”) is Intuit’s largest business unit with $6B+ in revenue, serving 8M+ customers with the QuickBooks line of products including accounting, payments, payroll and financing solutions. Specifically, the SBSEG Strategic Planning Team leads the SBSEG Finance team processes and partners with senior leaders to deliver growth. About The Strategic Planning FP&A Team We are responsible for the overall financial processes and consolidation of key business results across SBSEG. In addition, we develop strategic data driven insights and partner with key senior leaders to execute our vision of being the “champion of those who dare to dream”. We also work across the company with senior leaders as the focal point for SBSEG financial goals and results. We are looking for a creative problem solver with a passion for innovation to join our team and revolutionize the way the world does business. What You'll Bring 5 - 7 years FP&A experience or equivalent tenure from related positions in corporate finance, accounting, investment banking, private equity, or analytics Advanced understanding of translating business results into an insightful & consumable story for leadership teams, ideally in high-growth software / SaaS environments Excellent verbal and written communication skills with proven ability to partner with all levels of the organization, influence stakeholders using data and collaborate in an inclusive culture Ability to distill storylines from large data sets and create executive level presentations Detail-oriented with strong analytical, problem solving, and financial modeling skills Grace under pressure with a good sense of humor and dose of humility Ability to work independently, deal with ambiguity, operate in a cross-functional matrixed organization, and meet deadlines in a high-growth environment focused on driving business results Self-starter with a desire to quickly learn and excel; willing and able to initiate, manage, and execute projects with minimal supervision Degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Management, or equivalent experience; MBA preferred How You Will Lead Consolidate SBSEG results for customers, revenue, and expenses to deliver data driven insights on business performance and future implications for senior finance and business leaders Create executive presentations to deliver cohesive storylines for SBSEG to Board of Directors, Sr. Intuit Staff, and Sr. SBSEG Staff Lead 1 and 3-year strategic planning and forecast processes across SBSEG Finance Thoughtfully lay out dashboards and reporting to drive executive insights and decision making in support of our strategic and financial plans Drive various analyses that deliver data driven insights in a structured manner to promote business outcomes that accelerate our growth trajectory Collaborate cross-functionally on strategic initiatives to deliver awesome results to the senior leaders and broader finance teams

jobTitle: Lead Financial Analyst - Consumer Group
jobDescription: Overview Intuit’s mission is powering prosperity around the world. We do it by attracting the world’s top talent, bringing vital partners into our global platform, and leaving the world a better place through exceptional corporate citizenship. For our customers, we deliver more money, more time, and more confidence. Every day we innovate with our flagship products: TurboTax, QuickBooks, Credit Karma, Mailchimp, and Mint. The Finance Team within the Consumer Group is responsible for the financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis of the TurboTax suite of products that are used by millions of taxpayers every year. We play a unique and critical role in driving business decisions and optimizing financial outcomes for the Consumer Group. The Consumer Group Finance team is seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to lead financial planning and analysis for TurboTax monetization products and initiatives. This role will also be responsible for monitoring and providing financial insights from key TurboTax funnel and market share performance metrics. This person will partner very closely with our Marketing, Strategy and Analytics teams and will play a critical role helping the Consumer Group plan for and deliver against key targets and outcomes for the upcoming tax season. What You'll Bring To be successful in this role, the candidate must be/have: A customer-first mindset and understanding of customer behavior Detail-oriented individual who can quickly and accurately comprehend, manipulate, and prepare complex financial models and analyses from large and complex datasets High degree of organization, individual initiative, intellectual curiosity, personal accountability, and a commitment to driving results. A proactive can-do attitude, a self-starter who is comfortable working independently and with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities simultaneously Strong financial acumen and understanding of portfolio dynamics and drivers. Excellent problem-solving skills and end-to-end quantitative thinking Well-rounded interpersonal skills with the capacity to build strong relationships and collaborate across multiple stakeholders at varying levels Ability to effectively communicate, telling stories with data, instilling confidence, educating, and motivating stakeholders to act on recommendations Strong proficiency in MS Excel required. Working knowledge of SQL and experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools is strongly preferred 8+ years of FP&A experience or equivalent tenure from related positions (experience in high growth companies preferred) Degree in a field such as business, finance, economics, statistics or mathematics, or equivalent work experience; MBA preferred How You Will Lead Finance leader accountable for end-to-end financial management of TurboTax attach products such as state returns, bundles and Audit Defense Ongoing financial support of TurboTax’s online business including key funnel & market share metrics Key partner for Marketing and Strategy teams to manage monetization and revenue management initiatives across multiple TurboTax offerings Drive various analyses that deliver data-driven insights in a coherent and structured manner to promote decision making and business outcomes that accelerate our growth trajectory Partner effectively with cross-functional teams, including Marketing, Strategy, Analytics and Finance to translate business strategies and objectives into financial outcomes Communicate effectively in both verbal and written form with TurboTax business partners

jobTitle: Lead Generation Marketing Manager (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview We are seeking a Lead Generation Marketing Manager to join our growing Lifecycle Marketing and Operations team. In this role you will develop new customer acquisition programs and end-to-end prospect journeys across a variety of marketing channels inclusive of owned andindustry partner events. We are looking for an energetic, insightful marketer who has an interest in both understanding audiences and designing tailored strategies and tactics to help convert these prospective audiences into Mailchimp customers. About You You are skilled at developing demand generation and lead nurturing programs that drive results, while also building a successful pipeline to support sales in ongoing business development efforts. You seek to find the best solutions to capture web data and automate and push the boundaries of owned channel marketing (i.e., email, SMS, push notifications) with an in-depth understanding of the complexities that come with cross-channel B2B marketing. You are looking for your next challenge - one in which you can put your expertise into practice and see from the very beginning to future iterations how your contributions helped drive meaningful growth for an amazing company and organization. What You'll Bring You have 5+ years hands-on experience in Lead Generation and/or demand generation,developing winning data driven strategies. You are highly collaborative in your approach with partnering effectively with manydifferent internal and external stakeholders, including Web, Paid Media, and Salesteams. You possess some knowledge of best practices in B2B marketing automation, demandgeneration, and rules-based lead nurturing. You have experience with managing pipeline generation, lead scoring, and managingintegrated campaigns from concept to ROI analysis. You are relentlessly data driven; focus on funnel optimization and optimization of thesales and marketing process. You have a competitive spirit with a strong bias for action for constant rapid testing,learning and iterating and have proven examples of how you have used this to delivermeaningful results. You are a self-starter and thrive when building something new, including initiating andleading efforts, projects and programs. You are extremely organized, dependable and a stickler for the details. You are flexible and adaptive to change with the ability to multitask in a fast-pacedenvironment. You have prior software industry experience with B2B marketing; experience with SaaSbased marketing solutions a plus How You Will Lead Build a deep understanding of our prospective customers and the Mailchimp platform, soyou are able to craft compelling reasons for why they should choose us. Plan, execute and evaluate lead gen lifecycle marketing programs (in partnership withSales, Brand, SEO, and Web teams) to generate awareness and demand for Mailchimpproducts to increase lead generation and build the sales pipeline. Develop nurture campaigns across email, push, sms and in product communications toimplement a holistic, omni-channel nurture approach by audience type. Partner with Marketing Operations to plan and manage the end to end process ofmulti-channel campaigns, using the right technology and data to amplify the strategy Work with data analytics to improve the quality of the MQLs generated. Analyze and understand key market segments to develop compelling messaging andmarketing offers. Leverage positioning, messaging, buyer personas and other information to targetsegments and generate highly qualified leads. Rigorously manage, measure, and analyze all marketing campaigns and tactics drivingto conversion rate increases and funnel optimization. Analyze outcomes, provide insights and present results to facilitate sounddecision-making.

jobTitle: Manager 2 Data and Analytics
jobDescription: Overview This role will build out the cross-sell and cross-product activation analytics function within Intuit’s consumer group. This role will be focused on optimizing every Intuit customer’s journey to adopting the right next product for them in service to the customer benefit. This role will drive critical cross-functional strategies and will partner closely with senior product and marketing leadership, data engineering, data analytics, and data science. The insights and strategies generated by this analyst will be instrumental in boosting customer retention, driving product conversion, and increasing customer lifetime value. You’ll be joining the growing Customer Analytics team, which powers the largest retention initiative within Intuit’s Consumer Group (TurboTax, Mint, CreditKarma). We leverage behavioral and transactional data to surface customer insights, build models to personalize customer experiences, and deliver awesome outcomes for the business and our customers. What You'll Bring 3-5 years of experience managing data analysts with a proven track record of developing successful analysts 7-10 years of experience working in web, product, marketing, or other related analytics fields, including 3+ years working with customer data in product, lifecycle marketing, or related field/function Excellent problem-solving skills and end to end quantitative thinking Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines Outstanding communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues Experience building strong relationships with stakeholders Proactive and inquisitive learner... seeks out and capitalizes on opportunities for change that enhance the business, rather than reacting to circumstances Demonstrated ability to deeply analyze customer data to inform marketing and product decisions. Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating stakeholders to act on recommendations Understanding of complex web ecosystems, best practices and ability to put this knowledge into action Experience with customer segmentation, data enrichment tools and technologies, and personalization at scale (preferably in a B2C context) Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Analytics or related field. Master’s Degree preferred How You Will Lead Lead and nurtures a team of talented analysts with a focus on cross-product activation and customer LTV Drive strategic thinking and cross-functional alignment around data-driven approaches to optimize product and marketing efforts (inclusive of experimentation) based on customer segments, lifecycle stages, and other critical customer attributes Lead deep exploration of customer data and spearhead customer segmentation, LTV modeling, and other actionable analysis/modeling Develop (alongside product and marketing counterparts) experimentation plans to measure and optimize execution of data-driven strategies across execution, targeting, and personalization Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to better understand our users and create a single, accurate view of a customer across businesses to make decisions about how best to acquire/retain them, segment, identify high potential value, and proactively interact with them Partner with business leaders (e.g. product, business development and finance) to define business strategies, areas of investment, and critical priorities

Master’s Degree preferred How You Will Lead Lead and nurtures a team of talented analysts with a focus on cross-product activation and customer LTV Drive strategic thinking and cross-functional alignment around data-driven approaches to optimize product and marketing efforts (inclusive of experimentation) based on customer segments, lifecycle stages, and other critical customer attributes Lead deep exploration of customer data and spearhead customer segmentation, LTV modeling, and other actionable analysis/modeling Develop (alongside product and marketing counterparts) experimentation plans to measure and optimize execution of data-driven strategies across execution, targeting, and personalization Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to better understand our users and create a single, accurate view of a customer across businesses to make decisions about how best to acquire/retain them, segment, identify high potential value, and proactively interact with them Partner with business leaders (e.g. product, business development and finance) to define business strategies, areas of investment, and critical priorities

jobTitle: Manager 2 Data and Analytics
jobDescription: Overview We are looking for world class analytics talent to join our team of analysts to drive actionable insights across TurboTax’s CRM marketing program. We have an exciting opportunity to help shape how we use data and technology to retain and re-engage our customers through targeted experiences across multiple marketing touch points. This role will partner closely with marketers, data scientists, and our digital activation team leveraging customer data to deliver real-time, personalized communications and derive insights to improve customer experience and maximize ROI. What You'll Bring 7-10 years of experience working in marketing, web, product, or other related analytics fields Experience working with CRM (Email, Direct Mail, Push notifications, etc.) data, marketers, and technology (e.g. Braze, Adobe Campaign, Marketo, etc.) Experience building experimentation plans and analyzing AB test results Ability to tell stories with data; educate and motivate stakeholders to act on recommendations Experience in modeling or business application/evaluation of machine learning Comfort working with large data sets to generate insights Excellent problem-solving skills and end to end quantitative thinking Outstanding communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues. Must be a proactive thinker, intellectually curious, and have a bias for action Strong organizational skills, time management, and portfolio prioritization experience Highly proficient in SQL, Tableau or Qlik, and Excel Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent experience; Master’s Degree preferred How You Will Lead Lead a team of 3 analysts responsible for data enablement, reporting, and optimization within the CRM marketing channel (i.e. email, push notifications, SMS alerts, direct mail, etc.) for TurboTax Partner with marketers to identify and size new opportunities to drive re-acquisition and retention Strengthen existing CRM data architecture and pipelines to enable more seamless reporting across the organization Identify key customer attributes to onboard for use in targeted, real-time customer communications Continue efforts to enable and automate customer outreach across all TT product lines Build and maintain a strategy for self-serve reporting and dashboards across all areas of CRM Guide approaches to measure success and incrementality, e.g. holdout groups, multi-touch attribution, media mix modeling, and annual forecasts Deliver insights and data stories that capture weekly performance, key learnings, and recommended actions Build plan for ab testing and optimization within CRM channel Partner with data science teams to evaluate new tools and models that can help scale and automate personalized communications

jobTitle: Manager 3 Customer Experience
jobDescription: Overview Join the Intuit Customer Success team as a Group Manager CX professional to help us build products and services that delight customers. We support small businesses, accountants, and self-employed individuals in the USA. We’re looking to grow our team of talented individuals to help optimize our product experience combined with our support experience and help us ensure that we do this in the best way possible. As a Group Manager CX professional, you will be responsible for leading a team of customer experience professionals and building a ‘practice’ to drive innovation in the way that we work, serve our customers, and build our offerings. All aspects of help and support experience delivery for customers using QuickBooks products & services are in scope. The role will play a pivotal part in helping us stand out from the crowd for the services that we provide. This team will need to be ‘in the game’ staying close to our customers and teams to understand what matters to them, how well we deliver on this, and how we empower our people to excel in everything that they do. You will also provide operational and thought leadership by setting strategy, developing priorities, and managing programs that drive a highly effective and efficient organization, through the removal of waste, eliminating customer friction, and driving customer advocacy. What You'll Bring Boundaryless Leader: Cross-functional leadership experience, partnering to influence different functions at all levels. Experience working with a US-based, multi-national company would be an asset Analytical: Have a keen eye on trends and a hunger for data. Ability to prove or disprove hypotheses by bringing the right data to the table Product Management & Experience Design Expert: Customer champion with a design mindset and demonstrated strengths in product management or experience design (ideally with SaaS, Self-Help, or CRM environment). Have led the creation of online experiences (from concept through production) Business Leader: Business acumen with a proven ability to deliver programs that accelerate organizational growth objectives. Must possess experience in developing clear compelling business cases that support prioritization of work Customer Service & Support Expert: Demonstrated strength managing or working with customer support organizations and operations (direct or via BPO) Change Leader: Experience in a dynamic work environment, managing and executing complex systems and organizational change initiatives Communicator: Excellent written and verbal communication skills including an ability to communicate complex issues simply. Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint How You Will Lead Drive and execute the vision for Customer Experience excellence that is aligned to our strategic customer segments’ expectations and goals, for seamless, transparent, and frictionless experiences that sustain mutual growth Leverage best practices to guide customer strategy and future growth by cultivating customer affinity with Intuit programs/solutions that drive impact for the customer and establishing Intuit as a leader Serve as Point of Contact to business leaders for all things related to Customer Success. Act as the customer champion to highlight friction points and gaps to senior leaders within CS and product organization Partner with peers across CS organization and maintain a wide range of operational processes governing data, reporting, technology infrastructure, and more Part of a team who is accountable for our Voice of Customer (VOC) Feedback Loop: Leading the elimination of pain points/friction and optimizing our customer experiences. This includes aggregating quantitative and qualitative insights and collaborating with marketing, product development, and product management to build, fix, and enhance our products, policies, and communication Support customer-facing teams to identify, synthesize and prioritize VOC and VOE data, building business cases for change. These will be data-backed and show clear employee, customer, and shareholder impacts Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and UX teams to embed customer and employee data to remove root cause issues that drive poor experiences and low advocacy. Lead and partner in programs and sprints to conceptualize, design and operationalize exceptional employee and customer experiences that deliver our True North Goals Stay on top of industry-leading trends Collaborate with all markets to understand localization challenges and facilitate a truly global approach to systemic change that drives up customer measures of success and shareholder value. This strategy will also support our mission to be the team that drives customer advocacy and growth in all our markets; globally Own and lead the application of customer measurement dashboards that weave into the global CX planning process to ensure data-backed decisions are made. Customer Success data is what drives our strategic decisions in brand, price, product, and service Partner with Intuit Customer Success Teams to build an end-to-end customer journeys and data sets to drive systemic and customer level improvements

jobTitle: Manager - Local Impact and Strategic Alliances
jobDescription: Overview Intuit Inc. is committed to powering prosperity around the world for consumers, small businesses and the self-employed through its ecosystem of innovative financial management solutions. We are seeking a strategic and creative thinker to develop and support philanthropic initiatives that are aligned with Intuit’s corporate responsibility goals and policy priorities to support our mission of powering prosperity for all, focused on supporting underserved populations and organizations which support them. As part of the Global Corporate Affairs team, you will report directly to Intuit’s Director of Global Public Affairs and work closely with stakeholders across Intuit’s business, policy, communications, and corporate responsibility teams. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring Candidates must have a minimum of 5-10 combined years of experience at a philanthropic/non-profit organization, with a major corporation or trade association, in government work, and/or experience in third party relationship building. Storyteller with ability to distill key messages and present them in a compelling and visually interesting way, both internally and externally. Experience with grant requests and budget management is highly preferred. Bachelor’s degree required, or equivalent work experience. Project and program management skills with a focus on organization and attention to detail a must. Event management experience, including creativity in building experiential learning preferred. Track record of success leading multiple assignments in their craft. Operates & makes an impact across organizational boundaries and at the industry & policy level. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills, effectively analyzing and assessing opportunities, prioritization of focus, and analyzing developments. Capacity and drive to understand fully the business and operational elements of Intuit; including understanding what is mission critical from the trivial. Reputation for having the highest ethical standards and integrity. How You Will Lead Develop and support philanthropic programs and organizations that are aligned with Intuit’s mission, strategies, and public policy objectives – including finding new partnerships on the local level. Work within Intuit’s Global Corporate Affairs team set clear goals and outcomes to drive measurable impact supporting communities and populations in need. Plan and manage events with Intuit team, philanthropic partners and others in the space to learn best practices and determine how best to support their organizations and those they serve, while educating external stakeholders on the impact of their work. Manage the Intuit Financial Freedom Foundation (IFFF), a taxable not-for-profit organization whose purpose is to make a meaningful impact on the financial lives of lower income and underserved taxpayers, individuals, small businesses and the nonprofits that serve them. Work closely with Intuit Corporate Responsibility team to, where applicable, align IFFF programs and activities with the company’s broader CR goals.

jobTitle: Manager of Engineering, Customer Data Platform (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview We're looking for an Engineering Manager who will lead and support a team that works on unifying customer data (from multiple channels) into a single comprehensive customer view to enable customer engagement and personalization at scale. You will mentor and grow individual contributors and collaborate with cross-functional team members such as product managers, designers, and test engineers. Mailchimp has a flexible approach to work. We have offices in Atlanta, Brooklyn, and Oakland. This role would provide you with both in office and work from home opportunities. What You'll Bring You have a passion for creating great products, delivering results, and developing engineers. You have 3+ years of experience as an established technical leader of software engineering teams that have successfully delivered customer-driven software products. You have 8+ years of hands-on software development experience. You collaborate consistently with the product and design teams. You are patient, resilient, and willing to take on work even when it's challenging, ambiguous, or intense. You have a desire to pursue collaboration even when it introduces dissent. Values bringing diverse perspectives to the table. Able to balance efforts between planning and acting. You understand how to augment humility with the courage to propose, develop, and defend ideas you feel passionately about. You have a commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously reviewing and adjusting processes, org structure, tools, etc. Pluses, But Not Requirements, Include Experience building either segmentation or classification networks. Experience with a Change Data Capture stack. How You Will Lead Coach engineers to help define their career path through challenging growth opportunities. Collaborate with cross-functional squad leads to prioritize work, ensure the team has appropriate skills and size to accomplish goals, and ensure any roadblocks are removed from the team’s path. Recognize the value of transparent, honest communication and the necessity of sharing information. Participate with peers and directors to ensure the organizational structure is a help, and not a hindrance, to getting work done. Explore innovative product engineering practices that will help us improve our workflows.

jobTitle: Manager of Engineering, Data Products (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview The Data Products team at Mailchimp is a new forming team within our Data Engineering organization responsible for creating and managing data pipelines and products for our Product, Marketing, and Customer teams to enable peeps to make better decisions with data. What that actually looks like is working with folks from across the Product, Marketing, and Customer departments to understand their needs and then surface data in a meaningful way within self-service data and analytics tools to help them drive the business forward. Day to day you’ll lead a team to build ETL pipelines, to model data that feed analytical reports and data science models, and to maintain production data flows and data sets. We have a lot of tools in our toolbelt, all with the main goal of helping Mailchimp to continue to use data more effectively. What You'll Bring You have some years of experience managing high-performing data engineering teams to build data pipelines to and from enterprise Lifecycle Marketing and Customer Success team tech stacks You are an outstanding written communicator You have a track record of delivering for your customers successfully You are an empathetic leader who values bringing diverse perspectives to the table You drive clarity when things are ambiguous and operate calmly under pressure You are patient, resilient, collaborative, persuasive and able to lead a team without resorting to authority even when it’s challenging, ambiguous, or intense You have experience delivering simple solutions to complex problems via consistent, iterative releases You have a commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously reviewing and adjusting processes, org structure, tools, etc. You are able to effectively coach and manage the performance of engineers ranging from highly experienced to entry level How You Will Lead Foster an inclusive environment within your teams and peers in Data Engineering Lead and equip a distributed engineering team to develop and improve data products, pipelines, and data models, focusing on the direct support to Lifecycle Marketing or Customer Success business functions Collaborate with engineers, product and project managers, privacy legal team, and other peers to develop and maintain data engineering solutions in support of predictive analytics and other data products Promote and educate your peers and senior leadership on the systems and data flows your team builds and maintains through thorough documentation and diagrams of the systems and data flows Coach and mentor decision making and problem solving and identify and sponsor growth opportunities for your team Partner with teammates to prioritize work, triage issues and eliminate obstacles in the team’s path Work with Data Engineering team leaders to ensure your team has appropriate numbers and skills to accomplish its goals

jobTitle: Manager of Engineering, Website Initiative (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview The engineering teams help Mailchimp deliver a cohesive, differentiated customer experience on mailchimp.com and our microsites. We design and build the infrastructure to support Marketing’s go-to-market campaign efforts globally, maintain the site's performance, and identify site-wide opportunities to optimize journeys that help prospects & users accomplish their core tasks on the website. We are looking for an Engineering Manager to help us lead and empower our engineering team. You'll mentor and grow individual contributors and collaborate with other leaders responsible for the Website Initiative. Our ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, comfortable managing a distributed team and leading with influence instead of relying on managerial authority. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and refine opportunities for solving partner needs. We’re looking for someone who has a desire to constantly improve things (processes and technology), and be willing to challenge the status quo when appropriate. What You'll Bring You are passionate about the career growth and self-development of our Engineers. You have prior experience leading engineering teams across different geo locations and within a cross-functional environment. You have a consistent record of running successful high-capacity, large-scale projects/architectures. You are patient, resilient, and willing to take on work even when it's challenging, ambiguous, or intense. You have a desire to pursue collaboration even when it introduces dissent. Values bringing diverse perspectives to the table. Able to balance efforts between planning and acting. You understand how to augment humility with the courage to propose, develop, and defend ideas you feel passionately about. You have a commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously reviewing and adjusting processes, org structure, tools, etc. You are able to hold a technical conversation with your engineers and provide direction as and when required. Plus If You Have Experience With Content Management Systems (CMS), Contentful would be A+ Leading a team of full stack engineers Implementing international solutions for your website, not limited to localization and personalization How You Will Lead Have solid experience managing an inclusive team of high-performing engineers in multiple office locations. Collaborate with Engineers to help define their career path through challenging growth opportunities. Collaborate with cross-functional squad leads to prioritize work, ensure the team has appropriate skills and size to accomplish goals, and ensure any roadblocks are removed from the team’s path. Recognize the value of transparent, honest communication and the necessity of sharing information. Participate with peers and Directors to ensure the organizational structure is a help, and not a hindrance, to getting work done. Continually explore innovative business practices and determine fit for team and company. Help the team evolve into the chosen agile methodology.

jobTitle: Manager, Public Affairs Media and Creative Strategist
jobDescription: Overview Intuit Inc. is committed to powering prosperity around the world for consumers, small businesses and the self-employed through its ecosystem of innovative financial management solutions. As part of the Global Corporate Affairs team, you will report directly to Intuit’s Director of Global Public Affairs and work closely with stakeholders across Intuit to help support the company’s public policy objectives in global, federal, and state markets. We are seeking a creative thinker who is passionate about the public policy outcomes that can help us improve the financial goals of our customers. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring Candidates must have a minimum of 10-15 combined years of experience at a creative agency, on political campaigns, in government work, or in public affairs and/or public relations with a major corporation or trade association. Ability to distill key messages and present them in a compelling and visually interesting way. Proficiency with design, digital content production and digital ad buying highly preferred. Bachelor’s degree required. Project and program management skills with a focus on organization and attention to detail. Third party relationship building and campaign management experience highly preferred. Event management experience, including creativity in building experiential learning preferred. Track record of success leading multiple assignments in their craft. Operates & makes an impact across organizational boundaries and at the industry & policy level. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills, effectively analyzing and assessing opportunities and threats, prioritization of focus, analyzing developments. Capacity and drive to understand fully the business and operational elements of Intuit; including understanding what is mission critical from the trivial. Reputation for having the highest ethical standards and integrity. How You Will Lead Create and strengthen an optimal paid media strategy and approach by market that builds Intuit brand awareness, highlights public policy priorities of the company’s customers, engages key audiences, and effectively reaches key opinion leaders. Partner closely with Intuit Brand, Marketing, Corporate Communications and similar teams within Intuit business units to leverage best practices and ensure alignment with other paid campaigns, brand identity, creative executions, and messaging. Manage creative agency and media buyer for Intuit Public Affairs to establish research-driven goals and actionable insights to drive measurable impact by market Maintain and refresh content for Intuit Global Corporate Affairs web properties to help feed into paid media campaigns, and vice-versa. Infuse creative thinking to help drive greater integration and long-term planning across the Global Corporate Affairs function.

jobTitle: Marketing and Transactions Counsel
jobDescription: Overview Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide. Intuit is a global technology platform that helps consumers and small businesses overcome their most important financial challenges. Serving more than 100 million customers worldwide with TurboTax, QuickBooks, Mint, Credit Karma, and Mailchimp, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to prosper. We never stop working to find new, innovative ways to make that possible. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring Must have a J.D. degree from an ABA accredited law school or meet the requirements for legal education in a foreign country Have 5+ years’ experience focusing on marketing and transactions, preferably in the tech field Ability to think strategically and leverage strong analytical skills Working knowledge of intellectual property rights (copyright, trademark, and right of publicity) and consumer protection laws and regulations applicable to marketing collateral and initiatives across regulated industries and channels (e.g., online, broadcast, retail, telephone, and social media, etc.) Experience servicing as a primary point-of-contact and strong ability to collaborate cross-functionally & build enduring partnerships Outstanding verbal & written communication skills High energy, positive mindset and "can do" attitude How You Will Lead Working with the legal department’s transactions and marketing group, the Contracts and Marketing Counsel will primarily support activities such as reviewing marketing, sales and promotional materials for advertising, intellectual property, and company policy compliance for international and domestic markets. The ideal candidate will have a working knowledge of advertising and consumer protection laws, regulations, including compliance with FTC and other e-commerce laws, and marketing principles and the desire to learn specific areas of marketing law (such as CAN-SPAM and TCPA compliance, as needed). The Contracts and Marketing Counsel will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to help drive timely resolution to matters including online social marketing, review promotional campaigns and offers, assess advertising claims substantiation, comparative claims, clear creative content for intellectual property, right of publicity and privacy, draft disclosures, disclaimers, structure and interpret survey results, among other duties. Experience with managing international marketing and promotional initiatives for non-U.S. geographies, including the E.U., Canada, Australia, and Latin America is also desirable. The Contracts and Marketing Counsel will also perform drafting, negotiating and advising upon various U.S. and global commercial transactions, including in-bound and out-bound data licenses, SaaS, marketing, sales and other commercial contracts. An ideal candidate will have a strong desire to learn, a “can do” attitude, the willingness to work on a very large variety of tasks across business units, as well as manage and prioritize multiple concurrent activities. The successful candidate will understand the technical and business ramifications of the matters the individual handles and also how to help the business intelligently manage both legal and business risks. Central to our group’s support model is constant effort to increase scalability / efficiency. The ideal candidate will be process-oriented and possess an ongoing desire to “never answer the same question twice” -- to ensure through training, guidelines and general processes that the right resource is doing the right work -- so they can focus on the most strategic, highest-valued work. The ideal candidate will have the ability to provide concise, contextually nuanced, and actionable feedback and collaborate with stakeholders across the company where needed or based on guidelines and principles. The candidate will have experience with maintaining and developing knowledge resources, best practices, process improvements, and conduct related compliance training.

The candidate will have experience with maintaining and developing knowledge resources, best practices, process improvements, and conduct related compliance training.

jobTitle: Marketing Manager 2 - Web Operations
jobDescription: Overview Join a world-class marketing team as a Marketing Manager, 2 in Web Operations for the Go-To-Market Operations & Technology team in the Consumer Group business unit. TurboTax products are loved by millions of customers and drive over $3B in revenue. In this role, you will be a key leader overseeing the web operational arm, and partner with many stakeholders across Intuit. We look forward to how you deliver exceptional web and in-product experiences for our customers in a fun and high-performing environment. This critical role advises the business on web production best practices and is a strong leader to increase our speed to market delighting our customers even faster! You must have a proven track record of managing a team, influencing cross-functional teams and a hunger for growth. Intuit is ranked #11 on Fortune 100 Best Places to Work for 2021 and by joining the team, you will also help customers and communities overcome their most important financial challenges. What You'll Bring 7+ years of experience in Content Management, Web Marketing and/or Marketing Operations 5+ years in web production team management with an improvement mindset driving team adoption of tools, strong time management, and operational excellence (cycle time/quality) Experience leading web production both pre-auth (.com) and post-auth (in-product) including upsells new product experiences, personalization to customers, and quality assurance testing Strong technical expertise with content management systems including a deep understanding of templates, components, workflow, and underlying functionality, ideally WordPress/Gutenberg Understands and produces technical requirements for technology enhancements to scale Intimate knowledge of experimentation, UX and SEO best practices Experience scaling teams through workflow and technical process design JIRA admin experience is a must along with deep knowledge of Adobe Analytics How You Will Lead Execute and drive yearly planning for your team and contribute to the 3-year vision Accelerate outcomes and drive significant change at scale across a large organization with operational rigor and process Foster a growth mindset to grow your team’s careers Have a win together attitude working with global engineering teams, product managers and cross-functional partnerships for exceptional end-to-end results Communicate clearly (oral and written) to evangelize and champion areas of improvement Effectively and proactively manage priorities in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment Flexible and agile with the ability to pivot quickly in order to meet business and customer needs

jobTitle: MBA Finance Intern (FP&A)
jobDescription: Overview The Intuit Finance FP&A team is critical in driving business growth and profitability through strategic, financial and operational leadership. Our interns have opportunities to apply their knowledge into real-world problems such as financial modeling, analysis, system database management and multiple other areas. The primary objective of our summer internship program is to bring highly talented people into the organization. Summer internships are a direct pipeline to full time positions in strategic positions with frequent exposure to company leaders, core businesses, and technologies – where you can quickly make meaningful contributions. What You'll Bring Currently enrolled in an MBA program with an emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience within FP&A function or equivalent tenure from related positions in corporate finance, accounting, investment banking, consulting or strategy Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Excel to analyze complex business scenarios by building/improving financial models. Tableau and Hyperion EssBase experience a plus. Highly motivated, self-starter with ability to work independently in a fast paced environment, simultaneously manage several priorities, and challenge the status quo to lead change and operational improvements. Attention to details and ability to synthesize large volumes of data into insightful recommendations to the executive leadership team. Ability to influence all levels of leadership to drive actions, behaviors, decisions and business outcomes Strong written and oral communication skills with experience in presenting to business partners with confidence, conviction, and credibility Grace under pressure with a good sense of humor and dose of humility SQL experience a plus. How You Will Lead While each summer internship is unique, all roles offer the experience of a project which challenges you to apply your knowledge and expertise to real business problems. As this role involves constant interaction with senior non-finance stakeholders across the business, you need the confidence and emotional intelligence to effectively communicate at all levels. The ideal candidate has worked in the high-tech industry and enjoys operating in an extremely fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.

jobTitle: MBA Finance Strategy Intern
jobDescription: Overview We are responsible for identifying new growth opportunities, developing strategies that accelerate the growth of our QuickBooks ecosystem, and for partnering with country/segment leaders to drive successful execution. While our business has been successful in our core markets and segments, our total addressable market worldwide is still largely untapped, and we are excited about the numerous greenfield opportunities. Our scope includes: Identification and evaluation of organic and inorganic growth opportunities, as well as disruption risks Development of growth strategies for new offerings, customer segments, geographic markets, and business models Optimization of investment allocation to balance short and long-term growth objectives Ongoing partnership and guidance as teams test and operationalize the strategies to refine our execution approach Development of our 3-year and 1-year strategic and financial plan Articulation of our strategy & business trajectory for Intuit’s Board of Directors and external stakeholders (e.g., investor community) Our projects often mirror the work at top strategy consulting firms and investment banks, but with an emphasis on driving tangible impact in close collaboration with product and business leaders. Our team has significant exposure to senior leaders across Intuit, and takes pride in and ownership of both strategy and guiding successful business execution. This mix of strategic and operational components and our ability to directly drive long-term value offers a greater sense of achievement, career growth opportunities, and momentum than is often found in professional services. What You'll Bring Be currently enrolled in an MBA program 3+ years prior work experience; prior consulting, investment banking, bizops, or go-to-market strategy background preferred Have a strong analytical orientation, creativity in problem solving, and keen business judgment Be intellectually curious and have a deep desire to learn Be self-motivated, driven, and able to drive projects with limited guidance Be able to quickly synthesize qualitative and quantitative information, structure a concise and clear presentation of findings, and articulate recommendations to an executive audience Have well-rounded interpersonal skills with the capacity to build relationships with senior stakeholders and collaborate across with team members across varying levels How You Will Lead We are looking for creative problem solvers with a bias for action, passion for innovation, and strong desire to drive tangible business impact. The ideal candidate is ready and able to exercise a range of classical strategy disciplines: analytical thinking, competitive / market intelligence, external benchmarking, business case development, storyboarding / narrative creation, framing, influencing, change management, and more. Part thought-partner, part influencer, and part-doer, to be successful.

jobTitle: MBA Marketing Manager Intern
jobDescription: Overview Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies To Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide. Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market – from QuickBooks®, and TurboTax®, Mint.com, MailChimp, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit. Check Out All Of Our Career Opportunities At Discover what it’s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It’s time to love what you do. Named one of the Best Companies to work for year after year, Intuit attracts the world’s top talent to help power prosperity for over 50 million customers globally. Our interns, co-ops, and new grads bring diverse perspectives and bold new ideas. Apply your academic learnings to real world problems and work alongside professionals that will help take your career to the next level. What You'll Bring Must be enrolled in a MBA degree-seeking program during the time of the internship Demonstrated leadership and track record of delivering results Ability to think strategically and leverage strong analytical skills Passion for delighting customers with technology solutions grounded in customer insights Strong ability to collaborate cross-functionally & builds enduring partnerships Outstanding verbal & written communication skills Be a self-directed and self-motivated individual who takes complete ownership of the product and its outcome. High energy, positive mindset and innovative How You Will Lead Develop rapid test plans and experiments for new concepts and marketing programs Conduct customer interviews with Intuit existing customers Work with Data Analytics team to understand and lead customer insights research including ethnographic (qualitative) and quantitative Define and prioritize customer requirements, user stories and validations Partnering with a cross-functional team to create new offerings including Product Management, Development, Finance and Care. Pull together recommendation on actionable next steps for incorporating learnings into upcoming commercialization work Make big changes in our acquisition, conversion and retention approaches across multiple channels including .com, phone, in-product, and online. Set success metrics and monitor against milestones. Present regular updates to senior Business Unit leadership on pricing, migration and research

jobTitle: Platform Engineering Leader, Development Services and Experiences
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is transforming into an open, trusted, and easy-to-build-on platform where we and other partners solve the most pressing customer problems and deliver awesome experiences. Our AI-driven expert platform strategy is driving strong momentum and accelerating innovation. As part of this strategy, Intuit is building platform capabilities to accelerate development velocity for both internal and external consumption. The Development Services and Experiences (DevX) team at Intuit builds capabilities that developers use for building and running Intuit’s flagship applications and ecosystems. We are on a journey to enable hyper-scale growth on both our systems and our development processes and are making fundamental shifts that will enable this journey. We’re looking for an experienced engineering leader who loves setting and delivering on bold vision and building and growing teams. This leader will instill a sense of urgency and accountability and will also have the ability to create and persuasively articulate a strategic vision and plan to deliver common platform capabilities across all of Intuit’s businesses and products. What You'll Bring 10+ years of industry experience in the software product industry with senior architecture/software development roles Proficient in front-end and mobile architecture & design that serve millions of users Expertise in developing & designing client-side applications using the latest front end technologies using one or more of the following React/Vue Node Swift/Kotlin Experience in leveraging Amazon Web Services for building scalable client-side applications CloudFront Lamba Experience in building a component library and contribute to design systems is preferred Experience in micro-frontend architecture is preferred Understanding of industry-leading technology/solutions in big data and machine learning Experience in making successful trade-offs that balance the short- and long-term product goals Partner with the engineering directors to build strong engineering teams Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred How You Will Lead As the Development leader of Intuit's Application Fabric, our Web and Mobile platform for the flagship products of Intuit, you will set the long-term vision for Intuit’s high scale micro front-end offerings across the ecosystem and will be responsible for executing that vision. From ideation to development to adoption, you’ll lead an organization focused on accelerating development velocity through a unified web and mobile application development platform for delivering seamless customer experiences across all Intuit product lines and making a great impact on Intuit’s application developer community by providing end-to-end product solutions. The scope of the work covering Application Fabric is critical for Intuit to accelerate innovation and to realize our AI-driven expert platform strategy. The ideal candidate’s experience encompasses leadership in technical architecture and/or software development, business strategy, and people management experience. This leader will have the ability to leverage prior success building and rearchitecting products and platforms that run at scale. Essential Functions Drive end-to-end vision for the platform across Intuit’s product offerings Lead the technology evolution of the front end application framework, including data, analytics, productivity and tools across the web and mobile. Mentor others in development technologies, tools, and processes Present your own designs to internal and external groups, review designs of others Participates in industry conferences and public speaking opportunities at technology and business conferences Inspire innovation and deliver quality at speed across offerings and platform Partner with engineering leaders across Intuit to identify areas across people, process, and technology to dramatically improve velocity
