Mentor others in development technologies, tools, and processes Present your own designs to internal and external groups, review designs of others Participates in industry conferences and public speaking opportunities at technology and business conferences Inspire innovation and deliver quality at speed across offerings and platform Partner with engineering leaders across Intuit to identify areas across people, process, and technology to dramatically improve velocity

jobTitle: Principal Data Analytics Engineer, Data Products (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview The Data Engineering team at Mailchimp is seeking a Principal Data Analytics Engineer to lead vision and execution of our data pipelines, flows, governance and products for our internal business functions (Product, Marketing, and Customer) to enable them to make better decisions with data. What that actually looks like is working with folks from across the Product, Marketing, Customer departments to understand their needs and then surface data in a meaningful way within self-service data and analytics tools to help them drive the business forward. Day to day you’ll work closely with engineers from across the Data Engineering organization to build ETL pipelines, to model data that feed analytical reports and data science models, and to maintain production data flows and data sets. We have a lot of tools in our toolbelt, all with the main goal of helping Mailchimp to continue to use data more effectively. What You'll Bring You are an empathetic leader who values bringing diverse perspectives to the table You drive clarity when things are ambiguous and operate calmly under pressure You are patient, resilient, collaborative, persuasive and able to lead a team without resorting to authority even when it’s challenging, ambiguous, or intense You have experience delivering simple solutions to complex problems via consistent, iterative releases You have a commitment to increasing efficiency in the workplace by continuously reviewing and adjusting processes, org structure, tools, etc. You are able to effectively coach engineers ranging from highly experienced to entry level Strong system design skills and workflow optimization and a track record of delivering for your customers successfully Strong technical accomplishments in SQL and data analysis skills Strong business intuition and ability to understand complex business systems Strong experience with data transformation tools like dbt or Dataform Experience with ETL orchestration tools like Apache Airflow and Google Dataflow Experience with Python or other languages Experience with MPP databases such as BigQuery, Redshift, or Snowflake Expertise in visualization technologies like Looker, Tableau, or Qlik Sense Experience with GCP/AWS or other cloud providers Outstanding written communication skills How You Will Lead Implement the hardest part of a data analytics system or product and ship high-quality work with best practices, like proper testing, well-planned rollout, monitoring, and governance Lead the effort to set the technical strategy across multiple teams, working with other leaders to define data product and system roadmaps Identify the technical risks and opportunities of the system, product, or org and propose mitigations and solutions through your deep understanding of our business objectives Most importantly, in addition to demonstrating the capability to leverage cross functional colleagues (analytics, data science, product management, etc.), Principal Engineers also should be able to assess and validate their outputs

jobTitle: Principal Product Manager, Partner Sales Technology
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit’s Go To Market (GTM) Technology Team as a Principal Product Manager responsible for our Partner Sales Technology platforms and experiences that help us attract, grow, and retain a strong partner sales channel. This role will be integral to collaborating with our Partner sales teams and our external partners to identify needs, research industry solutions, and establish the vision and strategy to create an integrated and delightful partner experience. You will prioritize opportunities and develop strategic roadmaps that support Intuit’s shift to a mid-market, partner enabled, selling model. The Sale Product Management team owns and manages the Sales Platforms and capabilities that enable the E2E Sales Cycle for our direct and partner sales teams. Our team is responsible for all aspects of the Sales Agent and Partners experience, and partners closely with other technology teams that develop Intuit shared capabilities. We are seeking a product leader who can demonstrate strategic leadership and has a proven track record of delivering new technology and experiences at scale in a platform and services ecosystem that enable Partner to achieve success. As a Principal Product Manager, you will partner with stakeholders to identify opportunities, research industry solutions, and leverage data to gain deeper insights to enable you to create a vision and strategy for developing technology solutions. If you are passionate about the internal customer experience and working in a role where people/process/technology can fuel growth and innovation, then you are the right candidate for this job! What You'll Bring 6+ years designing and delivering world-class software products in a Product Management or business process, technology platform, or architecture role Deep experience in enterprise products/applications with an emphasis on Sales, Service, Support, and customer relationship management systems (Salesforce preferred) A self-motivated person who can influence and drive cross-functional, cross-geo teams, promoting timely and effective communication A strong leader, skilled at storytelling and communication with proven ability to credibly drive conversations with senior leaders Excels in driving cross-functional teams and leading initiatives across an organization involving multiple product teams Experience with Agile development and methodologies A strong sense of urgency to help customers through the ability to identify insights and deliver a quality, innovative experience quickly BA/BS in Computer Science or a similar technical degree preferred How You Will Lead Demonstrate thought leadership and drive strategic direction for Partner Technology capabilities Own the product planning, prioritization, and roadmap activities for your Domain Use data to drive decisions and define the metrics that measure and monitor your goals Establish mechanisms to gain deep understanding of sales needs, with direct interaction and prioritizing their feedback in the roadmap Drive and coordinate execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with dependent technology teams. Work with the Sales business owners to execute the strategy, vision, and prioritization of products / features across our Sales technology stack Ensure User Stories represent customer needs and define work in a meaningful way, which include clear acceptance criteria and consider dependencies on other stories and/or initiatives Able to engage with and influence Senior Leadership effectively Manage ISV and vendor relationships to influence product roadmaps across user group communities

jobTitle: Principal Product Manager, Sales Enablement Technology
jobDescription: Overview The Sale Product Management team owns and manages the Sales Platforms and capabilities that enable the E2E Sales Cycle for our direct and partner sales teams. . Our team is responsible for all aspects of the Sales Agent and Partners experience, and partners closely with other technology teams that develop Intuit shared capabilities. We are seeking a product leader who can demonstrate strategic leadership and has a proven track record of delivering new technology and experiences at scale in a platform and services ecosystem that enable Sales teams to achieve results. As a Principal Product Manager, you will partner with stakeholders to identify opportunities, research industry solutions, and leverage data to gain deeper insights to enable you to create a vision and strategy for developing technology solutions. If you are passionate about the internal customer experience and working in a role where people/process/technology can fuel growth and innovation, then you are the right candidate for this job! What You'll Bring 6+ years designing and delivering world-class software products in a Product Management or business process, technology platform, or architecture role. Deep experience in enterprise products/applications with an emphasis on Sales, Service, Support, and customer relationship management systems (Salesforce preferred). A self-motivated person who can influence and drive cross-functional, cross-geo teams, promoting timely and effective communication. A strong leader, skilled at storytelling and communication with proven ability to credibly drive conversations with senior leaders. Excels in driving cross-functional teams and leading initiatives across an organization involving multiple product teams. Experience with Agile development and methodologies. A strong sense of urgency to help customers through the ability to identify insights and deliver a quality, innovative experience quickly. BA/BS in Computer Science or a similar technical degree preferred. How You Will Lead Demonstrate thought leadership and drive strategic direction for Sales Technology capabilities. Own the product planning, prioritization, and roadmap activities. Use data to drive decisions and define the metrics that measure and monitor your goals. Establish mechanisms to gain deep understanding of sales needs, with direct interaction and prioritizing their feedback in the roadmap. Drive and coordinate execution against plan, anticipating risk, and leading discussion via frequent, clear communication, both internally and with dependent technology teams. Work with the Sales business owners to execute the strategy, vision, and prioritization of products / features across our Sales technology stack. Ensure User Stories represent customer needs and define work in a meaningful way, which include clear acceptance criteria and consider dependencies on other stories and/or initiatives. Able to engage with and influence Senior Leadership effectively. Manage ISV and vendor relationships to influence product roadmaps across user group communities.

jobTitle: Principal Product Manager, Spend Management
jobDescription: Overview People who work for themselves fuel our global economy. In the US, small businesses employ 60% of the workforce and create 80% of new jobs; internationally the stats are even more skewed. But the odds are stacked against them. One of two fails in the first five years, two of three before they can turn ten. The QuickBooks Online team is launching a series of exciting new initiatives to fuel the growth for Small and mid-market businesses by becoming their single source of truth for running their businesses and also managing their finances. As the Senior Product Manager for Spend Management, you will define and build the next generation of end to end Spend Management capabilities. These capabilities will enable businesses to not just optimize how and where they spend their money, but also enable them to realize efficiencies across their enter buying process. You’ll work closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists, designers, marketers, customer care, analysts and researchers to deliver best-in-class product experiences. What You'll Bring 5+ years designing and delivering world-class software products in a Product Management role, ideally with a SaaS based enterprise software company in the fintech space Strong analytical, prioritization, communication and negotiating skills are a must Experience serving as product owner for a scrum team, managing scrum ceremonies and constantly seeking to educate the team on product strategy and roadmap Passion for building great products, innovation and solving complex customer problems Superior communication and presentation skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical issues simply and convincingly to drive fast decisions Strong data literacy and ability to use data and analytics to back your strategic approach A bias for action and rapid experimentation with a proven track record of delivering results at scale that impact critical business metrics in the short and long Experience in matrixed organizations; ability to drive results through collaboration and influence Undergraduate degree required in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, Science or a related technical discipline (equivalent professional experience will be considered); advanced degree a plus How You Will Lead Drive results through close partnerships with core teams, cross-functional stakeholders, and cross-business unit partners to deliver customer impact and business objectives Lead the definition and execution of a product roadmap that supports the delivery of awesome end to end, mid-market-ready Financial Services capabilities (e.g. revenue recognition automation, spend management, fixed asset automation etc) Build and own a quarterly rolling 12-month roadmap to deliver on business objectives Engage with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure technology synergies are understood and leveraged Engage with multiple business stakeholders to ensure all product needs are captured, most importantly across the other scrum teams Write high quality user stories, using an agile approach, that represent a collaborative view on the direction for the technology platform as defined by development managers and architects Leverage deep analysis of customer and site analytics to understand behavior and platform performance, using data to identify opportunities for improvement.

jobTitle: Principal Security Engineer Adversary Management Threat Intelligence
jobDescription: Overview The Intuit Adversary Management team is looking for a security professional who has skills and familiarity of security frameworks, attack surfaces, big data, software development, and cloud environments. We’re using data in groundbreaking ways to uncover insights on how adversaries are emerging their techniques, tactics and procedures (TTP’s). This individual will help support their team in building technologies, collecting and storing data from various sources, correlating and analyzing data to understand adversaries motives and intent. This individual will closely work with their team to present requirements and drive solutions that align with Intuit Adversary Management team’s mission. What You'll Bring 10+ years of experience with adversary intel collection, data analysis, and \ or security testing BS/MS in computer science \ mathematics \ data science or equivalent work experience 1+ years of experience using scripting languages; preferably python 1+ years of experience with web services (consuming or creating) with REST or SOAP Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences 1+ years of experience with SQL, NoSQL, Graph data warehouses and analysis tools. Experience with network discovery and application fingerprinting Experience in researching, experimentation and innovation Experience with social, mobile, cloud/SaaS, big data, and Linux Experience with at least one scripting language, preferably python Experience with at least one cloud environment; AWS, GCP, etc Familiarity with BI and analytic tools, preferably Google Big Query and DataStudio Always Be Learning: Demonstrate advanced critical thinking and trouble-shooting capabilities to assess, prioritize, plan, and implement tasks and solutions effectively, including the ability to manage multiple projects at a time How You Will Lead Ability to lead and develop data models to derive adversary insights about the attack surface, and assist in identification using behaviors and characteristics Ability to develop data models around indicator patterns to identify undetected adversary activity. Understanding of moderate to advanced indicators from a given TTP's use. Ability to lead and the collection of adversary tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTP’s) across mobile, web, and cloud infrastructure Ability to lead and identify and categorize moderate to advanced TTPs to a given threat actor Ability to lead and automate identification, categorization and intent classification of moderate and advanced TTPs to a given adversary Demonstrated ability to iterate, create innovative solutions and get stakeholder investment. Use Big Data, AI & ML to automate threat prediction across all attack surfaces, predict adversary infrastructure, and identify and predict various adversaries and their intent Can discover and walk through abuse cases specific to the choice of technologies (internal or third party). Ability to lead, identify and mapping emerging threats to the attack surface and quantify risk. Ability to use active and passive reconnaissance techniques to find and enumerate networks, DNS and understand potential vulnerabilities Use Big Data, AI & ML to risks on the attack surface, identify threat actors, related basic indicators, related TTPs, and to make security decisions Advanced understanding of the data filter/preprocessing between non-security related data and security signals Ability to perform moderate to advanced data QA tasks as part of handling data feeds Familiarity with software development lifecycle and understanding of software design/architecture and fundamentals (algorithms and data structures). Strong understanding of the customer problem being solved, and experience defining and validating the customer problem. Moderate understanding of architecture patterns; DNS, Internet, AD, web, messaging, storage, containers Public Cloud: Fundamental knowledge of Cloud Networking, Cloud Computing, Cloud File Systems, Cloud Databases, and Storage. Proactively identifies slow performing code, understands the execution and works with the team to improve performance of slow performing code. Proficient at identifying required data to solve business problems Builds feature engineering pipelines for prototypes Ability to debug complex issues in data pipelines. Identifies opportunities to add resiliency to make data pipelines stable. Writes complex queries and can simply existing queries to increase runtime performance Takes a metric-driven and data-backed approach to evaluate the customer benefit of a solution delivery and pivots/iterates as necessary with full accountability and ownership Experience in building threat models and deep knowledge of potential vulnerabilities of the systems/design/code and working with a team to mitigate those vulnerabilities. Builds and enhances existing code standards, finds logic error and bad practices in code review and provides concrete and actionable feedback as a peer reviewer on code requests Understands and clearly articulates implications of architectural situations and understands impact of trade offs Experience working on highly complex technical challenges delivering durable capabilities that can be leveraged by other teams. Deep understanding of technology evaluation for build vs partner vs buy

jobTitle: Principal Technical Program Manager Enterprise Systems: Finance & Data Privacy
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit, we are committed to keeping our customers’ data safe and private. When customers use one of our many offerings—including TurboTax, Quickbooks, Mint—they trust us with their most sensitive personal and professional financial information. The Tech for Intuit (t4i) team is looking for a Principal Technical Program Manager to independently drive the execution of critical components of Intuit’s Enterprise Finance and Data Privacy vision and strategy—encompassing both capabilities and customer experiences. You will work with a high-performing cross-functional team—including lawyers, finance process architects, engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and business leaders. What You'll Bring 8+ years of Technical Program Management experience with exceptional ability to drive complex initiatives across organizational boundaries; self-motivation and ability to build and maintain momentum—both by having strong project management skills and with your natural leadership skills. Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery. Proven ability to engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship. You move seamlessly between high-level strategy and execution; you are confident giving a presentation to the CEO and running a SCRUM meeting with engineers and designers Solid technical and business background; an innate curiosity and willingness to dive deep into a complicated platform or business problem; academic concentration or equivalent experience in technical and business disciplines is highly preferred Domain knowledge in Enterprise Systems - Data Privacy, Enterprise Finance and Workforce Technologies—including technologies and experiences—as well as compliance, is highly desirable. Demonstrated curiosity and ability to learn multiple functional areas of a business is required. How You Will Lead Manage large scale system implementation including technology, process alignment, data quality, and change management while continually assessing project priority, resource availability, budgets, and risks. Drive for improvement by leveraging best practices and creating and documenting repeatable frameworks. Identify technical dependencies and any gaps, determine capabilities needed and engage the proper technical experts to solve the problem; and determine a solution. Develop end-to-end plans and apply the right program management methodologies, tools, and skills to develop a detailed execution approach that is the right fit for the program across all phases of planning, development, and production readiness and launch. Ensure continued alignment of program scope, status, risks, and dependencies through effective communication across the organization and at all levels. Quickly and effectively identify critical issues and dependencies that need action and personally drive them through to closure. Balance business needs and technical constraints in resolving issues. Anticipate, recognize, and work through resistance or setbacks independently, work well with others when conflicts arise: see opportunities, ensure alignment with objectives, find common ground and promote understanding of alternative viewpoints before driving for closure and cooperation Lead program management for cross-functional Intuit-wide program, working closely in concert with technical leads on deﬁning and rolling out a program plan and executing the overall strategy across Intuit Drive and provide data driven recommendations to execute, monitor and communicate progress, trade-offs or decisions needed Managing contract based on agreed scope as defined in Statement of Work. Manage scope creep, ensure Change Requests are clearly called out, agreed and impacted against timeline Partner with Business PMO and transformational partner managing project delivery, monitoring tasks and progress of activities.

jobTitle: Principal Technical Program Manager Enterprise Systems: Finance & Data Privacy
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit, we are committed to keeping our customers’ data safe and private. When customers use one of our many offerings—including TurboTax, Quickbooks, Mint—they trust us with their most sensitive personal and professional financial information. The Tech for Intuit (t4i) team is looking for a Principal Technical Program Manager to independently drive the execution of critical components of Intuit’s Enterprise Finance and Data Privacy vision and strategy—encompassing both capabilities and customer experiences. You will work with a high-performing cross-functional team—including lawyers, finance process architects, engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and business leaders. What You'll Bring 8+ years of Technical Program Management experience with exceptional ability to drive complex initiatives across organizational boundaries; self-motivation and ability to build and maintain momentum—both by having strong project management skills and with your natural leadership skills. Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery. Proven ability to engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship. You move seamlessly between high-level strategy and execution; you are confident giving a presentation to the CEO and running a SCRUM meeting with engineers and designers Solid technical and business background; an innate curiosity and willingness to dive deep into a complicated platform or business problem; academic concentration or equivalent experience in technical and business disciplines is highly preferred Domain knowledge in Enterprise Systems - Data Privacy, Enterprise Finance and Workforce Technologies—including technologies and experiences—as well as compliance, is highly desirable. Demonstrated curiosity and ability to learn multiple functional areas of a business is required. How You Will Lead Manage large scale system implementation including technology, process alignment, data quality, and change management while continually assessing project priority, resource availability, budgets, and risks. Drive for improvement by leveraging best practices and creating and documenting repeatable frameworks. Identify technical dependencies and any gaps, determine capabilities needed and engage the proper technical experts to solve the problem; and determine a solution. Develop end-to-end plans and apply the right program management methodologies, tools, and skills to develop a detailed execution approach that is the right fit for the program across all phases of planning, development, and production readiness and launch. Ensure continued alignment of program scope, status, risks, and dependencies through effective communication across the organization and at all levels. Quickly and effectively identify critical issues and dependencies that need action and personally drive them through to closure. Balance business needs and technical constraints in resolving issues. Anticipate, recognize, and work through resistance or setbacks independently, work well with others when conflicts arise: see opportunities, ensure alignment with objectives, find common ground and promote understanding of alternative viewpoints before driving for closure and cooperation Lead program management for cross-functional Intuit-wide program, working closely in concert with technical leads on deﬁning and rolling out a program plan and executing the overall strategy across Intuit Drive and provide data driven recommendations to execute, monitor and communicate progress, trade-offs or decisions needed Managing contract based on agreed scope as defined in Statement of Work. Manage scope creep, ensure Change Requests are clearly called out, agreed and impacted against timeline Partner with Business PMO and transformational partner managing project delivery, monitoring tasks and progress of activities.

jobTitle: Principal WorkForce Planner
jobDescription: Overview Intuit's Customer Success team is transforming the industry with a suite of high-touch professional services powered by data-driven, technology-led operations and a distributed professional workforce. You will be the change agent to progressing Intuit’s journey from creator of best-in-class tax and accounting software to acknowledged leader in solving financial problems for customers and powering their prosperity by connecting people to virtual experts. This is a multi-billion-dollar opportunity to bring humanized experiences directly to people who seek professional service through an innovative AI platform As a Principal Workforce Planner within Intuit Customer Success you will have a key focus on quickly adapting to changing business environment, being agile in managing the change, and driving cross functional alignment on the plans while leveraging machine learning and data science principles to build efficient end to end Expert Planning Process processes and governance model that improves process efficiency to develop optimal plans. What You'll Bring Bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, statistics, supply chain management or related technical discipline 8+ plus years in related sales and operations planning with strong data and analytics skills; Dynamic workforce management (service planning) experience an advantage APICS or related certifications desired with broad end to end supply chain and operations process knowledge Experience in developing and deploying global S&OP Strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills. Ability to influence and manage in a matrix environment Persistence and focus to drive results and continuous improvement Intermediate to advanced working knowledge of scripting languages (Python, R) Fluent with Qliksense, Power BI and Tableau How You Will Lead Develop strategic vision for planning on capabilities needed for long term scaling for our global markets Define success criteria or critical measures for complex projects to drive multi-channel complex campaigns & experiments Lead initiatives from different functional domains and with multiple stakeholders to assess impact to forecast and capacity plans Self-starter in ambiguous environments to generate hypothesis via data & find analytical insights that move the needle for the BU Lead monthly lock reviews to drive alignment with stakeholders by delivering compelling storytelling on forecast and capacity plans Lead as SME to think end-to-end across both business and technical domains and connect the dots with non-technical process/tech/product efforts and drive cross-functional teams towards common goals Ability to partner cross functionally and influence project outcome leveraging data and analytics Ability to formulate business opportunity and communicate data analytics approach across a broad spectrum of audiences (eg data peers, non-tech project teams, Dir + etc.) Drive continuous improvement initiatives and deliver strategic recommendations based on best practices, lessons learned etc. Act as SME, proactively identifies roadblocks, mitigates them, and influences stakeholders to drive towards outcomes and manage change management aspects on project early on Ability to identify and exploit new business/customer opportunities using data to drive optimization, experimentation, and disruptive business models Ability to lead cross functional projects and drive tactical decision making across teams Continuously drive data rigor in decision making through building organizational data literacy and developing intuitive self-service solutions for stakeholders Drive insights and recommendations throughout the BU using analysis, visualizations, and compelling storytelling Extremely proficient in executive communications at various leadership levels starting with Directors Ability to develop products & scale for repeatable - adhocs/analysis done such as experimentation, forecasting, contact center analytics etc. Leads by owning the project outcomes, guiding, and directing wider project teams Ability to drive multi-channel complex campaigns & experiments Mentor junior team members in the analytics team to help them grow their skills and ability to influence business roadmaps Ability to manage E2E aspects of a complex analytics model/project build (i.e. scope requirements gathering, finalizing, stakeholder’s management, communication, project management) Advanced working knowledge of "big data" technologies eg. Redshift,Spark,Tidal,Hive, Big query and new & emerging analysis packages such as Tenser Flow, Keras etc.

jobTitle: Principal XD Researcher
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit, our mission is powering prosperity around the world. We build intuitive web, mobile, and cloud solutions that generate more money, more time, and more confidence for 46+ million people. Leveraging big data insights, machine learning, and powerful automation, we help consumers, small business owners, and the self-employed achieve their dreams of prosperity. The design research team in Intuit’s Consumer Group leverages qualitative and quantitative research methods to help teams gain a deep understanding of consumer attitudes, needs, and motivations to guide the development of innovative tax and financial experiences in TurboTax, TurboTaxLive. Our team of passionate design researchers is part of our larger internal design studio that includes visual designers, product designers, design technologists, design ops, and content designers. We pride ourselves on our collaborative and customer-obsessed culture where designers and researchers feel supported and inspired. We are looking for a curious and collaborative principal design researcher to join our team who is passionate about solving tough business and customer problems, and advocating for the delivery of awesome end to end experiences. This role requires a dynamic individual who is comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment, with strong ability to go deep into the details but also, step back and connect the dots for a more strategic point of view. What You'll Bring Master’s degree in Design, HCI, Human Factors, or a related field/equivalent preferred but open to candidates with various backgrounds Experience with Service Design methods, framing, and mapping holistic multi-actor experiences to identify dependencies and implications (including designing experiences for virtual workers) Systems thinker; you can think and organize for scale, re-usability and visual frameworks Experience or passion for behavioral science/behavioral design, design ethics, or design strategy a plus Along with your resume, we’d love to see work samples - especially examples of leading strategic research with significant business outcomes! How You Will LeadWhat You'll Bring Minimum of 7 years of UX/design research experience, working cross functionally with design, product, content, and analytics teams A track record of successfully scoping and managing research engagements throughout the human-centered design process in close collaboration with cross-functional stakeholders (marketing, design, product managers, customer success, etc.) Organized, self-directed, efficient and able to manage multiple complex projects in a timely manner Expertise and leadership in qualitative research craft: Deep research domain expertise including best practices and an expert in a broad range of methodologies including: ethnographic research, site visits, interviews, diary studies, usability testing, and putting together long-term research plans. Expertly skilled moderator who can improvise off script and leverage stimuli or participatory activities to gain clarity and get to the root cause of issues, understanding customer’s mental models through deep inquiry. Demonstrated leadership qualities that enable you to influence, coach, and lead cross-functional teams and third-party partners when needed Proficiency in using a wide range of digital UI research and mobile ethnography tools Value process and rigor but thrive in a fast paced environment and bring creative problem solving to research Excellent synthesis and communication skills: Applies rigor and speed to analyze and synthesize a broad range of information to develop deep, impactful insights with confidence. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills to tell a clear, concise and well-organized story of the research that brings insights to life. Comfortable presenting findings in front of leadership and large audiences of key stakeholders Contribute to a community of design research practice across Intuit and beyond Some experience with quantitative research a plus An appreciation for the value of hard data in complementing qualitative findings Some experience designing quant UX studies, experiments, and/or surveys and analyzing data How you will lead Leads strategic end to end research initiatives focused on solving complex problems and providing actionable insights that are critical for delivering against product goals, accelerate design and contribute to our foundational understanding of our customers (current and future). Leads cross-functional teams in applying insights to create delightful, innovative offerings. Coaches teams to think strategically about how research insights can drive product roadmaps and business goals, while guiding product, design, and marketing stakeholders in reframing their questions and assumptions into clear research goals, testable hypotheses, and learning plans. Clearly articulate methodology recommendations and industry best practices to educate teams on quality research. Synthesize data into clear insights and frameworks that align the team on the most important problems or opportunities to tackle. Turn insights into action through collaboration, immersion, recommendations, provocations, and/or facilitation of ideation sessions Partner with other data teams and bring in other data sources to develop a holistic data-backed perspective. Bring a positive, solution-centric and growth mindset.. Work independently across multiple stakeholders and workstreams, gaining alignment on priorities, timelines, and trade-offs as necessary. Contribute to the evolution and upleveling of the research team’s craft and culture. Mentor and coach more junior team members. Educates product teams and senior leaders and elevates/teaches the research community

jobTitle: Product Designer
jobDescription: Overview Come join the QuickBooks Digital Experiences team as a Conversation Designer. Intuit’s Digital Experiences organization works to provide customers with self-service opportunities that inspire confidence, create connections, and bolster business growth. As a Conversation Designer for both our text and voice Digital Assistants bots, you will work to design, build, deploy, and optimize delightful conversational AI-driven self-help solutions. If you have a commitment to excellence, a desire to delight customers and a passion for disruption and innovation, we’d love to hear from you! What You'll Bring We are looking for a full-stack conversation designer, who has proficiency in all elements of the conversation design and implementation process. As such, you should have: A passion for delivering incredible customer experiences. Exceptional design writing and editing skills. Proven ability to author supportive and engaging flows for conversational AI and voice channels, using conversational design best practices. Demonstrated experience in architecting intent structures, building and maintaining language models, measuring accuracy and performance of NLU mapping. Strong technical proficiency with ability to effectively diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve issues. Can build, test, deploy and monitor solutions in CUI authoring tools. Familiarity with API schema and integrating attributes into conversations. Can collaborate on data structure and requirements with engineers who own the data, are building the APIs, and are exposing the attributes to the authoring tool. Strong analytical skills with ability to synthesize multiple data sources, detect themes, and identify root causes. Translates findings into meaningful business opportunities. Strong ability to quantify the impact of proposed or implemented changes. Can effectively monitor and analyze performance trends over time. Effectively visualizes and communicates data with audiences at all levels of the organization. Strong business acumen with the ability to scope, organize, and manage work effectively. Can build and maintain partnerships with dependent teams and effectively navigate and influence across varied audiences. Strong storytelling, presentation, and communication skills. Ability to develop and communicate technical and business requirements, business cases and other findings at all levels within an organization. Specific experience with Conversation Designer, Salesforce, Amazon Connect, Dialogflow, Lex, LUIS, and other CUI authoring tools preferred. How You Will Lead Design, author, and build new conversations in Intuit’s Conversation Designer tool. Ensure conversations leverage consistent brand and voice & tone to inspire customer confidence. Source, verify, and integrate customer and business data into conversation designs, increasing the bots’ ability to be smart and automate more for the customer. Maintain and improve existing conversational experiences. Conduct user testing regularly to ensure conversations and platforms are performing as expected, and to uncover latent needs for conversational automation. Develop and maintain test cases and QA evaluations. Validate new conversational UI feature integrations. Leverage customer data to identify pain points and opportunities to improve experiences. Document consumable insights to influence change to experiences and socialize with key stakeholders and executive audiences. Define and track KPIs and derive insights from performance data. Identify and implement improvements to drive cost reduction, increased effectiveness, and business revenue growth. Design and implement experimentation plans. Measure performance of experiments, capture insights, and socialize with key stakeholders and executive audiences. Develop and maintain rich knowledge of customer needs and product workflows to inform conversation design and development. Develop and foster relationships across partnered teams to optimize delivery of solutions for customers.

Specific experience with Conversation Designer, Salesforce, Amazon Connect, Dialogflow, Lex, LUIS, and other CUI authoring tools preferred. How You Will Lead Design, author, and build new conversations in Intuit’s Conversation Designer tool. Ensure conversations leverage consistent brand and voice & tone to inspire customer confidence. Source, verify, and integrate customer and business data into conversation designs, increasing the bots’ ability to be smart and automate more for the customer. Maintain and improve existing conversational experiences. Conduct user testing regularly to ensure conversations and platforms are performing as expected, and to uncover latent needs for conversational automation. Develop and maintain test cases and QA evaluations. Validate new conversational UI feature integrations. Leverage customer data to identify pain points and opportunities to improve experiences. Document consumable insights to influence change to experiences and socialize with key stakeholders and executive audiences. Define and track KPIs and derive insights from performance data. Identify and implement improvements to drive cost reduction, increased effectiveness, and business revenue growth. Design and implement experimentation plans. Measure performance of experiments, capture insights, and socialize with key stakeholders and executive audiences. Develop and maintain rich knowledge of customer needs and product workflows to inform conversation design and development. Develop and foster relationships across partnered teams to optimize delivery of solutions for customers.

jobTitle: Quality Assurance Sanctions Compliance Analyst
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is seeking a Compliance Analyst as part of our growing Order to Cash Compliance team within the Finance organization. The Compliance Analyst role will focus primarily on overseeing Intuit’s sanctions screening program and will specifically act as a SME engaging and overseeing quality assurance (QA) processes. The Compliance Analyst will support critical operational initiatives and will assist with building and enhancing screening-related procedures that drive short and long term business outcomes. What You'll Bring 1+ years relevant experience with OFAC/Sanctions/List Screening/AML Demonstrated knowledge of OFAC compliance operations Ability to act as subject matter expert in the area of sanctions screening Knowledge and familiarity with Bridger screening tool and SQL builder preferred Experience with conducting and documenting open source investigations, including the use of LexisNexis search tools Knowledge of compliance program quality assurance processes and expectations Experience overseeing sanctions and/or BSA compliance programs, including building processes and procedures Experience with designing and hosting compliance-related trainings BS/BA degree or equivalent experience; advanced degree desirable CAMS, CGSS, and/or CRCM Certification desirable How You Will Lead Act as subject matter expert in the areas of sanctions screening alert review and screening tool capabilities Perform QA reviews of alerts decisioned by frontline analysts within the screening tool Document results of QA findings; maintain and enhance QA reporting to track areas of potential risk and present results to leadership Provide timely feedback to operations teams and leverage QA findings and observations to design appropriate training Apply sanctions compliance expertise to create and deploy screening-specific guidance to operations teams Partner with sanctions compliance program oversight peers to drive QA-informed updates to processes and procedures Design QA data-driven technology and reporting enhancements, and partner with technology team to lead resolution of production support issues Support the building and management of work queues within the screening tool Support customer care team by assisting with account status inquiries Develop and maintain reporting models to measure metrics including SLA compliance, case decisioning, productivity, escalation rates, system performance, etc. Develop and deploy forecast models to measure current and future department resource needs based upon business trends and seasonality Identify and implement data-driven recommendations for process improvement, resource efficiencies, and improved controls Support new offer onboarding, including test framework design and contributing to end-to-end testing prior to go-live Assist with special requests and data gathering for audit and/or regulatory purposes

jobTitle: Remote Tax Associate - Seasonal - 3+Yrs Paid Tax Experience Required
jobDescription: Overview Do you have a minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year? If you're a tax professional, we need you to help our customers complete their taxes using TurboTax. You’ll advance our goal of “Powering Prosperity Around the World” by providing expert guidance and explanations of tax and technical terms to our customers. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by delighting our customers and empowering them to prepare their taxes. What You'll Bring Minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year required. Prior tax preparation experience in a tax practice or retail setting required. College degree a plus. The ideal candidate will have a background in business, finance, accounting, or tax Knowledge of tax laws, tax concepts and familiarity with form 1040 and schedules PTIN required Ability/motivation to expand expertise and obtain a tax credential or certification - Intuit offers a program to obtain your EA Strong customer service skills with ability to empathize and instill confidence Ability to work within a team to assist in preparation of accurate tax returns in a timely manner Strong Research skills and the ability to quickly use online resources to find answers Critical thinking and problem solving Persistence and determination Willingness to utilize audio/visual tools to communicate with customers Comfortable interacting with customers through video, in a professional way that represents the Intuit TurboTax brand well Friendly and reassuring on camera Bilingual (English/Spanish) communication skills (written & spoken) a plus For internal use: tst assoc How You Will Lead This is a seasonal position providing assistance to customers both assisting them in preparing their own returns and/or fully preparing customer tax returns Compiling/preparing tax returns for TurboTax Customers Gathering/organizing and accurately entering customer data in the federal and state tax returns for review Communicate directly with the customer as needed Coordinate customer meetings and follow-up Communicate updates to credentialed tax experts on assigned customers Will help customers who are working on their tax return with both product/software inquiries, as well as with tax questions and calculations Apply defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot and resolve product and tax support customer inquiries Will interact with customers utilizing strong written and verbal skills as well as deep customer empathy Typical Deliverables Accurate and complete customer data entered in tax returns for credentialed tax expert review High quality customer interactions and experiences Application of defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot, resolve issues and address routine Tax Support customer questions Proficient with technology and solid knowledge of computer operations and software. Utilize and leverage government websites and toolkits to seek out and deliver the right answer to the customer Document customer interactions Represent the Intuit TurboTax brand and spirit by demonstrating empathy for the customer, empowering and partnering with the customer, personalizing the experience, and providing them the confidence that they can do their own taxes If you are a Colorado resident, visit intuit.com/careers/colorado-job-postings-information/

You’ll advance our goal of “Powering Prosperity Around the World” by providing expert guidance and explanations of tax and technical terms to our customers. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by delighting our customers and empowering them to prepare their taxes. What You'll Bring Minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year required. Prior tax preparation experience in a tax practice or retail setting required. College degree a plus. The ideal candidate will have a background in business, finance, accounting, or tax Knowledge of tax laws, tax concepts and familiarity with form 1040 and schedules PTIN required Ability/motivation to expand expertise and obtain a tax credential or certification - Intuit offers a program to obtain your EA Strong customer service skills with ability to empathize and instill confidence Ability to work within a team to assist in preparation of accurate tax returns in a timely manner Strong Research skills and the ability to quickly use online resources to find answers Critical thinking and problem solving Persistence and determination Willingness to utilize audio/visual tools to communicate with customers Comfortable interacting with customers through video, in a professional way that represents the Intuit TurboTax brand well Friendly and reassuring on camera Bilingual (English/Spanish) communication skills (written & spoken) a plus For internal use: tst assoc How You Will Lead This is a seasonal position providing assistance to customers both assisting them in preparing their own returns and/or fully preparing customer tax returns Compiling/preparing tax returns for TurboTax Customers Gathering/organizing and accurately entering customer data in the federal and state tax returns for review Communicate directly with the customer as needed Coordinate customer meetings and follow-up Communicate updates to credentialed tax experts on assigned customers Will help customers who are working on their tax return with both product/software inquiries, as well as with tax questions and calculations Apply defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot and resolve product and tax support customer inquiries Will interact with customers utilizing strong written and verbal skills as well as deep customer empathy Typical Deliverables Accurate and complete customer data entered in tax returns for credentialed tax expert review High quality customer interactions and experiences Application of defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot, resolve issues and address routine Tax Support customer questions Proficient with technology and solid knowledge of computer operations and software. Utilize and leverage government websites and toolkits to seek out and deliver the right answer to the customer Document customer interactions Represent the Intuit TurboTax brand and spirit by demonstrating empathy for the customer, empowering and partnering with the customer, personalizing the experience, and providing them the confidence that they can do their own taxes If you are a Colorado resident, visit intuit.com/careers/colorado-job-postings-information/

jobTitle: Senior Backend Software Engineer
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is the global leader in financial management software where we have pioneered the shift to Virtual Platforms, cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. Intuit acts as a 35 year old startup, and we are constantly disrupting ourselves as we identify major new technology and design trends that are needed to deliver our mission to power prosperity around the world. Our groups are fast-paced teams focused on delivering innovative capabilities, and having fun while doing it. Note: By applying to this position, your application will be automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, San Diego and the following teams at Intuit. Core Skills What you'll bring BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience 5+ years of experience developing systems/software for large business environments (Java/J2EE, Python, Go preferred) 5+ years of experience designing complex distributed systems, management products or business applications 5+ years of professional working experience delivering production-ready code Strong OOD and SOA principles, with ability to implement them in a language of choice Strong experience leading design and implementation of robust and highly scalable web services Skilled in software development lifecycle processes and experience with scrum, agile and iterative approaches Expertise with unit testing & Test Driven Development (TDD) Desired Skills Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos, etc. Strong experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics Prior working experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments (AWS highly desired) How You Will Lead Drive design and implementation of durable and software solutions that will solve critical customer problems, are scalable, secure, easy to maintain, and interact with numerous other services Provide recommendations and best practices for application development, platform development, and developer tools Capture requirements and use cases Actively stay abreast on industry best practices, share learnings, and experiment and apply cutting edge technologies Team/Leadership Characteristics Team player possessing strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills Strong mentoring skills with ability to provide technical guidance and review code Ability to work with global teams across time zones Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, complex technical environment with high adaptability and flexibility Experience working with cross-functional teams while maintaining effective working relationships Communicates clearly, succinctly and persuasively to all levels of employees, customers and management "Self-starter" attitude and the ability to make decisions independently

jobTitle: Senior Business Data Analyst, Services Analytics
jobDescription: Overview Do you have a passion for making huge business impacts by leveraging data-driven insights? Do you love working collaboratively in an innovative environment? Come join Intuit where you’ll be empowered to do the best work of your life! We are looking for a world class analyst to help transform and scale service experiences. We have an exciting opportunity to help shape how we use data and technology to reach our customers with personalized experiences across multiple marketing touch points. If you are an individual with excellent analytical skills and a passion for delivering data-driven insights, come join Intuit’s Service Analytics team! What You'll Bring 3+ years of experience working with service operations, e-commerce marketplace analytics, customer care analytics, or product analytics Advanced proficiency in SQL, A/B Testing, and Data Visualization. Experience in defining metrics and instrumenting data tracking Experience in programming languages and stats packages (e.g. Python, R); experience in developing and deploying machine learning models is a plus! Ability to simplify stories with data, and be concise in the insights and how they drive outcomes with leadership and stakeholders Excellent problem-solving skills and end-to-end quantitative thinking Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet objectives and key deadlines Outstanding communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues Proactive and inquisitive learner... seeks out and capitalizes on opportunities for change that enhance the business, rather than reacting to circumstances Strong organization, time management and task prioritization skills Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Data Analytics, Finance, Advanced Analytics, or related field. Master’s Degree preferred. How You Will Lead Driving business strategy: You will collaborate with campaign managers and design to ensure reporting solutions are scalable, repeatable, effective, and meet expectations of various stakeholders and leaders. In addition, provide ongoing recommendations to leadership utilizing complex data, business knowledge, and strategic assumptions when data doesn’t exist. Identifying opportunities and influence partners to act: You will partner with a cross-functional team to develop hypotheses and experiments to leverage data and technology to deliver better outcomes for customers through deeply personalized experiences. You will lead discussions on test strategies and marketing campaign effectiveness, as well as design and execute web experiences and marketing experiments through robust A/B testing. Driving self-serve and data literacy: You will create learning and measurement plans for experiments and campaigns, define requirements for instrumentation and data collection. You will build reports to drive discussions, facilitate decision making, and actionable insights by partnering with data engineering to scale and automate analytics on new products and initiatives.

jobTitle: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Automation
jobDescription: Overview The Intuit Customer Success (ICS) team seeks a highly skilled and engaged Analyst with a passion for Lean process excellence and a zeal for improving employee experiences. In this role, you will observe individual contributors and teams as they work with various business software applications. You will then: What You'll Bring 3-5 years of experience with Business Process Re-engineering, Continuous Improvement and using Lean methodologies to create value with fewer resources and less waste 3-5 years of experience identifying opportunities for software automation using UI Path RPA (Robotic Process Automation), Python, Workado, Selenium, Salesforce, or other automation Desired: Training/certification in RPA in an Analyst role and/or experience writing and deploying RPA bots Knowledge of how machine learning and rules-based engines can be used to automate decisioning in a workflow Proficient at developing intuitive from -> to process maps Previous experience using Aha, Jira, Confluence, Smartsheet, Lucidchart and gSuite to document requirements and manage work End-to-end mindset. Systemic thinker who works across boundaries Communicates equally well with leaders, front-line employees, and cross-functional groups Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent relevant experience. Master’s degree desired How You Will Lead Map current business processes Identify Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) and Automation opportunities Create new process maps that allow the work to be done in less time and with improved quality Use a data driven approach to prioritize process improvement work Find stakeholders, meet with them and secure alignment with your proposed solutions Write business case and requirements for your solutions Partner with Automation and Product Development teams to build, test and deliver solutions to your customers Write UAT plans Drive change management with customers Measure and report on the value of the solutions you delivered

jobTitle: Senior Communications Manager
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is looking for a senior manager to support its Corporate Communications team as an experienced content and channel strategist. In this role you will own and drive the strategy for Intuit’s largest internal channels and ensure smooth end-to-end operations, optimization, and governance. You’ll be a master dot-connector who partners across the organization to source, develop and review content aligned to our strategy, while leveraging contract resources to scale. You’ll be the subject matter expert on channel optimization, consulting the Global Employee Communications team as they look for ways to leverage channels to drive their outcomes. You’ll also partner closely with the Corporate External Communications team to grow and evolve our content planning process and storytelling across internal and external channels. You will be responsible for tracking content and channel performance, lead analysis and use these insights to evolve the strategy throughout the year. As we build the digital workplace of the future, you’ll partner with a cross-functional team driving an effort to modernize our intranet. You will work across multiple internal publishing platforms, so familiarity and comfort with various technologies and an eye for layout and visual design is critical. You must sweat the fine details to ensure you’re delivering a top-notch employee experience. Strong storytelling and written communications are crucial, and the ability to juggle multiple projects, stakeholders, and deadlines simultaneously. What You'll Bring Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or relevant field of study 10+ years of communications experience Experience developing and managing a channel strategy with proven results Ability to work independently and with minimal oversight or direction Proven ability to meet aggressive timelines and prioritize multiple projects Team player that enjoys building partnerships at all levels within an organization while also being able to deliver feedback. Exceptional written communications and storytelling. High attention to detail and ability to drive consistency across all communication formats Tool-based skills Familiarity with SharePoint, LumApps or comparable platform Experience with metrics reporting tools Knowledge of Smartsheet Basic Photoshop skills How You Will Lead Manage a multi-channel content strategy Drive day-to-day operations of content management Act as a strategic consultant to partners across the org Manage a small team of contractors to support editorial and creative development Analytics and share-out of best practices

jobTitle: Senior Compliance Testing Program Manager
jobDescription: Overview Come join our amazing team of leaders, learners and world-class compliance professionals. We're a high-performing team that enjoys working together to accelerate innovation across the Intuit ecosystem by delivering impactful business outcomes that strengthen the Intuit brand. Intuit’s Legal, Compliance & Policy Organization (LCPO) is seeking a Senior Compliance Testing Program Manager to deliver impactful business outcomes that meet our obligations to our customers, partners and regulators. This role will report to the Head of Compliance Assurance. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. This position is not fully remote. What You'll Bring Establishes trust and collaboration with cross-functional stakeholders and team members Leads by example, and establishes credibility of ‘trusted business partner’ to stakeholders Have 8+ years industry experience in compliance, internal audit and public accounting BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Information Technology or related field, or equivalent experience CISA, CIA, CPA, CAMS certification preferred Experience in Software and FinTech industry and knowledge of compliance standards in Sanctions, AML, Card Brand, MTL, and lending is a plus Demonstrated ability to navigate and thrive in a fast paced working environment and operates calmly through ambiguity and change Experience with business and compliance processes, and understanding of system and IT general controls Demonstrates strong project and time management skills with ability to lead, multi-task and prioritize multiple projects and supervise resources Demonstrates ability to think critically, solve problems, listen actively, and communicates with impact both written and verbal Drives results through use of data and risk-based approaches How You Will Lead Partners with program owners, subject matter experts and/or legal to understand requirements (e.g., laws, regulations, guidelines, policies) of compliance, enterprise programs and products Develops risk and control processes, understands requirements to develop test procedures, executes on testing and validates results, conducts root cause and impact analysis (where applicable), partners with the business to identify recommendations and writes executive reports Evaluates design and operating effectiveness of controls, and assigns a compliance maturity score for controls tested Documents test results, and reporting metrics in GRC Tool and/or central repository Drafts and finalizes executive reports with senior management and socializes with key stakeholders Collaborates with the business to prioritize implementation of recommendations to strengthen compliance maturity for programs and products Partners with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g., Internal Audit, Finance, Legal & Compliance, Business, Risk, Security and Technology teams) on reviews, remediation and process improvements Participates and leads special, ad-hoc projects, initiatives, input goals as required Keeps up-to-date on industry and regulatory changes

BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Information Technology or related fields, or equivalent experience CISA, CIA, CPA, CAMS certification preferred Knowledge in fraud, financial, and compliance risks and controls within money movement lifecycle Experience with testing application and IT general controls within enterprise compliance programs, global business processes, and Intuit’s products Demonstrates strong project and time management skills with ability to lead, multi-task and prioritize multiple projects and supervise resources Demonstrates ability to think critically, solve problems, listen actively, communicate both written and verbal Drives results through use of data and risk-based approaches How You Will Lead Partners with program owners, subject matter experts and/or legal to understand requirements (e.g. laws, regulations, guidelines, policies) of compliance, enterprise programs and products Leads or participates in projects, initiatives, input goals as required Develops risk and control processes, understands requirements to develop test procedures, executes on testing and validates results, conducts root cause and impact analysis (where applicable), partners with the business to identify recommendations and writes executive reports Evaluates design and operating effectiveness of controls, and assigns a compliance maturity score for controls tested Documents test results, and reporting metrics up to senior leaders and within GRC Tool and/or central repository Drafts and finalizes executive reports with senior management and socializes with key stakeholders Collaborates with the business to strengthen compliance maturity for programs and products Partners with cross-functional stakeholders (e.g. Internal Audit, Finance, Legal & Compliance, Business, Risk, Security and Technology teams) on reviews, remediation and process improvements Keeps up-to-date on industry and regulatory changes

jobTitle: Senior Corporate Counsel - Cybersecurity and Data Lifespan
jobDescription: Overview Come join our amazing team of leaders, learners, and world-class legal professionals accelerating Intuit’s mission of powering prosperity for consumers and small businesses all over the world. Our Data Privacy team works hand in hand with our business partners to develop cutting edge products that use technology to both add value to our customers and uphold Intuit’s Data Stewardship Principles. We’re seeking a Senior Corporate Counsel for Cybersecurity and Data Lifespan to partner closely with our Security Operations team and other cybersecurity and anti-fraud professionals across the Company in their day-to-day efforts to secure Intuit's systems and our customers' data. Reporting to the Director, Deputy General Counsel—Cybersecurity and Data Lifespan, this lawyer will make a meaningful contribution to strategic priorities related to cyberthreat preparedness, and to projects related to data lifecycle management across all of Intuit's products and services. The ideal candidate will have a technology background, true fluency in the legal and practical components of cybersecurity and fraud incident response gleaned from considerable experience at a major law firm, public company or relevant unit of government, and a demonstrable history of solving complex, time-sensitive problems in close partnership with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders. The selected candidate will be a part of the Data Privacy team within Intuit’s world-class Legal & Compliance Organization. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring Minimum Qualifications Eligible to practice law where located and to obtain any multi-jurisdictional license required to support in-house practice in California or state where role is ultimately located. 8+ years of experience working at a combination of major law firm, public technology/financial services company or division of federal or state government, with significant experience related to cybersecurity and data management—e.g., incident response and prevention, cybersecurity investigations and litigation, forensic review, data mapping, retention and lifecycle management. Experience advising on US and EU privacy notification and data protection frameworks. Demonstrable ability to work across teams to solve complex problems, to communicate for impact, and a drive to learn and grow in the role. Team mentality; high availability; able to respond quickly to urgent matters in a dynamic and complex environment. Preferred Qualifications Information security or other relevant technology background. CIPP or CIPT certifications considered an asset. Experience advising clients on and working with leading cybersecurity and data management frameworks including but not limited to CIS Framework, PCI DSS, SOC 2, NIST CSF and NIST SP 800-82, ISF SOGP 2020, ISO 27001, NCSC CAF (UK). How You Will Lead Lead attorney for day-to-day cybersecurity and fraud incident management, leveraging a privacy mindset to assess and advise on legal risk, and manage engagement with internal and external stakeholders as necessary and appropriate. Assist in the Company's response to litigation and/or external investigations related to cybersecurity or privacy topics. Assist with ongoing strategic assessment and improvement of Intuit's cyberthreat preparedness, and implementation of systems monitoring that both safeguards the Company’s resources and respects individuals’ privacy rights. Assist with the maturation and development of Data Governance at Intuit, including specifically supporting efforts to mature programs relating to data retention and deletion across the Enterprise.

jobTitle: Senior Counsel - Product
jobDescription: Overview Do you love finding creative ways to solve tough challenges? Do you have a passion for making complex things more simple? Come join Intuit as a Senior Product Counsel. Here at Intuit, we’re constantly working to reimagine and grow beloved products like TurboTax, Mint, and Credit Karma. We need razor-sharp legal partners to help deliver these and other delightful customer experiences. Working as a member of the Products Counseling & Compliance Team, you’ll partner with innovative product teams around the world to ensure we can achieve our business strategy and deliver amazing customer benefits while complying with applicable laws and regulations. You’ll apply your legal expertise in new and creative ways, partnering closely with product management, business development, engineering, design, marketing, and compliance and operations teams. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring At least 5-7 years of experience primarily advising technology companies either in-house or at a firm Significant breadth of knowledge in as many of the following areas as possible: financial services, advertising and marketing regulations, consumer protection laws, data privacy and protection, IP, and mobile and cloud computing Demonstrated ability to perform with minimal supervision Experience providing legal support on a global scale Ability to communicate with business partners about regulatory obligations and risk management processes Excellent drafting and negotiation skills Ability to produce clear and succinct written legal analysis and business communications, and counsel and manage clients, including senior management Excellent communication skills Ability to interact with and lead change with senior executive leaders Ability to effectively frame issues to drive strategic thinking and execution Comfortable and adept at balancing risk and opportunity, and thinking creatively to enable the business to make smart decisions Excellent teaching and training skills Excellent driver and project manager Excellent business acumen Experience in-house preferred JD and membership in good standing with at least one US State Bar How You Will Lead As you provide support for TurboTax, Credit Karma, and other cross-product Intuit initiatives, you’ll advise and counsel on a wide variety of matters, including data privacy and protection, mobile, product liability, intellectual property and regulatory compliance. You may structure, draft, negotiate and advise upon various complex transactions with minimal direction and supervision. You will also have significant responsibility for ensuring compliance with in-product marketing requirements so the ideal candidate should have experience advising on advertising and marketing.
