jobTitle: Senior Data Engineer (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small businesses. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaigns, CRM, and analytics tools. The Data Platform team at Mailchimp is responsible for creating and managing our BI platform that enables peeps from across the company to make better decisions with data. As a member of the Infra & Tooling group, you'll help build and support the data platform foundation that our analytical and data science teams use everyday. You’ll work with our Pipeline & Modeling group to make sure they have scalable pipeline solutions as well as other departments to provide the core data capabilities to leverage data throughout Mailchimp. You’ll also support some of our most critical core pipelines to ensure Mailchimp user data can be used effectively. What You'll Bring You have experience driving technical projects, prioritizing work, identifying dependencies, facilitating technical decisions and cross-functional team discussions. You have coding experience in Python, Go, or other languages that can be demonstrated through a portfolio of code You’re experienced in designing and implementing application architectures and code that are highly scalable, available, maintainable, and performant You have experience with GCP/AWS or other cloud environments You have experience with ETL orchestration tools like Apache Airflow You have experience building streaming jobs using Google Dataflow You have strong SQL and data analysis skills Experience with data transformation tools like dbt or Dataform Experience with MPP databases such as BigQuery, Redshift, or Snowflake. We use BigQuery here at Mailchimp Expertise in visualization technologies like Looker, Tableau, or Qlik Sense How You Will Lead Craft the engineering vision, and own the technical landscape, for our data platform Work closely with product managers, data science and analytics, and engineering to distill complex business problems into elegant technical solutions Build and help support robust batch and streaming pipelines Build tools and processes to help make the right data accessible to the right people Evolve the maturity of our monitoring systems and processes to improve visibility and failure detection in our infrastructure Become a subject matter expert on the various datasets and tools we have at Mailchimp Work with Data Stewards to ensure we govern data responsibly

jobTitle: Senior Data Scientist (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview The Data Science team drives user growth and retention using product insights and marketing optimization for Mailchimp’s customers. We are an exciting, growing and fun team that works with industry-leading tools, techniques and best practices. We analyze millions of data points a day to make predictions, recommendations, automations, and differentiated experiences for our customers. We use cutting-edge machine learning models, advanced natural language processing and image processing to solve customer problems. Our data-driven tools help small businesses improve targeting and boost marketing and revenue using smart recommendations , create on-brand content , reach the right audience , and improve campaign performance . We’re a close knit group of 20+ Data Scientists where you’ll be recognized for your individual contributions to innovation and creative solutions. Yet, we find the best solutions come when we collaborate to solve them together. We bring equal rigor to our algorithmic prowess as our pie baking, ping pong, or pool games. As a member of our team you will be encouraged to bring your whole self to work and we value every idea and opinion. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will dive deep into our customers marketing tactics to uncover actionable insights and make recommendations that will help our small business customers win. This position works alongside ML-Engineers, Product Management, Front-end Engineers, Analytics, and Strategy to deliver competitive business results and grow our customer base for our products. The Data Science team builds applications that make sense of the data created by Mailchimp’s millions of users. The ideal candidate is a self-directed, experienced data scientist who believes in demonstrating how data can be used to help our customers. What You'll Bring 3+ years experience working on data science projects or applications at scale Outstanding communication skills with the ability to influence decision makers and build consensus with teams Willingness and ability to adapt to the rapid business and organizational changes that accompany a high-growth environment Thrive on ambiguity and will enjoy frequent pivoting that is part of the exploration MSc or PhD in a relevant field (Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Econometrics, Operations Research), or equivalent research experience from the industry Expertise in Data Mining algorithms and Statistical Modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, genetic algorithms, anomaly detection, recommender systems, sequential pattern discovery, or text mining Well versed in Data Science languages, tools, and frameworks, including data processing platforms and distributed computing systems (for example Python, R, SQL, SkLearn, Numpy, Pandas, TensorFlow, Keras) Strong experience with Cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS...) Ability to communicate methods and results of analyses A unique background or expertise that gives you perspective into marketing, customer service, surveys, or design Experience with modeling in Ads Data Hub Experience with Twilio Segment How You Will Lead Lead and collaborate with multiple teams to accelerate model implementation driving product outcomes. Use Advanced Python skills to perform data segmentation and aggregation from scratch; leveraging relevant experience working with granular web clickstream data. Develop personalized customer recommendations driving models including marketing plan forecasting and optimization. Develop behavioral propensity models aimed at optimizing users journey toward optimum outcomes for their business and Mailchimp as a whole. Develop models to optimize the path to conversion for prospects taking into consideration the changing privacy landscape. Formulate revenue models to measure the impact of our efforts on revenue outcomes. Work to improve quality and mitigate bias in Mailchimp data systems Provide technical mentorship and guidance for team members.

jobTitle: Senior Data Scientist (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our team. The Data Science team works alongside Product, Engineering and Design to build features that help our millions of users engage with their customers more effectively and efficiently so they can grow their businesses and nonprofits. We use cutting-edge machine learning models, advanced natural language processing and image processing to solve customer problems. Our data-driven tools help small businesses improve targeting and boost marketing and revenue using smart recommendations , create on-brand content , reach the right audience , and improve campaign performance . The ideal candidate is a self-directed data scientist with experience in deploying models to production and a solid engineering toolkit. You enjoy building pipelines with your partners in ML Engineering, but you’re not afraid to put on your product hat and validate your solutions through lean prototypes and experiments. You aim to continually improve your models and monitor ongoing performance after deployment, including customer interactions and feedback. You’ve run analyses using various tools, but you're partial to Python. What You'll Bring 2+ years experience working on data science projects or applications Experience working with natural language processing models Strong programming background. Fluency in Python and shell scripting required Understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques Experience in database systems (SQL or NoSQL) Experience with Cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS...) Experience using Docker and container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes Ability to communicate methods and results of analyses Experience with anomaly detection and pattern prediction Experience with performance monitoring Bonus: An advanced degree in quantitative or technical field Bonus: A unique background or expertise that gives you perspective into marketing, E-commerce, entrepreneurship, small business operations, customer service, or design How You Will Lead Deploy data science models that help small businesses grow and succeed Learn about customer problems and prototype data science solutions Build predictive models to help users maximize engagement with their content Test your models using creative methods Work with our huge datasets to understand what makes effective marketing content for our users Use GPT-3 and other AI models to generate personalized and optimized content for users Collaborate with multiple teams to facilitate model implementation Improve quality and mitigate bias in Mailchimp data systems Provide technical mentorship and guidance to team members Embrace and demonstrate our values: humility, creativity, and independence

jobTitle: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobDescription: Overview We're looking for a talented individual to join our Security Engineering team working on Directory Services with expertise in AWS infrastructure as code. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a well-established company and be part of a highly progressive and transformative IT team. Overall, your responsibilities will be focused on the design, management, security, cloud build-out, and support aspects of the Linux and Windows Directory Services environment in the cloud. As Intuit’s Directory Services support the workforce and our mission critical production environment, it is essential that shared services be maintained at the highest levels. Ensuring the security, integrity, and availability of the Directory Services are key responsibilities for this role. What You'll Bring Deep AWS knowledge and experience. Experience and knowledge in Kubernetes and containerization. Strong experience in cloud technologies and automation (compute, security, networking) such as Kubernetes. Strong infrastructure design and engineering background. Strong background in enterprise hosting concepts. Proficiency in Linux/Windows technologies. Hands-on experience developing scripts using scripting languages such as Java/JavaScript, Linux shell, PowerShell, Python, Ansible, CloudFormation to deploy, manage, and automate device configurations and monitoring/reporting tools & alerting. Hands-on experience in monitoring and management of large scale, highly available infrastructures. Experience with monitoring tools such as Splunk, Telegraph, Wafefront, CloudWatch. Self-managed individual with solid communication and troubleshooting skills. Creates and executes against clear plans for personal and team deliverables. Passionate about customer success. B.S. /B.A. in related technology or equivalent experience. Team player with the ability to be successful in a fast-paced, always-on environment. Desired Knowledge and experience designing and implementing LDAP server and services. Ideally Ping Directory or Unbound. Microsoft Active Directory Experience. Experience in IT services such as: LDAP, DNS, SMTP, DHCP, AD Trust Relationships, and PKI Certificates and SSL. Familiarity with CICD solutions like Spinnaker, Code Pipeline. Experience and knowledge of IT security concepts, practices and implementation. Strong technical project management and documentation skills. Experience with Agile Development, SCRUM, or Extreme Programming methodologies. How You Will Lead Lead / drive / participate in the design, automation, management, security, cloud build-out, and support aspects of the current and next generation Directory Services environment in AWS (including Ping Directory on Linux and Windows Active Directory). Develop automation for always-on services leveraging leading cloud services and advanced concepts such as containerization, Kubernetes, and highly available architectures. Flexible and innovative to apply knowledge and experience to recommend custom solutions to business problems. Decisions can have enterprise-wide impact. Exercises discretion and judgment to ensure all Operational Service Levels are met. Understands how their services work with all other components of IT systems and partners with other teams for end-to-end solutions. Effectively influences others to ensure levels of quality and timelines are met during the service improvement and delivery process Diagnose and troubleshoot complex technical issues. Drive continuous improvement with focus on availability, usability, reusability, performance, maintainability, and cost. Ensure thorough testing of solutions for functionality and compatibility. Communicate, document, and distill technical information to team members and partner organizations. Provide support for end users, application, and administration teams, including critical incidents and on-call support. Coordinates and schedules service with customers Engages and escalates to vendors for service restitution

jobTitle: Senior Executive Assistant Business Partner
jobDescription: Overview We are searching for an experienced, reliable, detail-oriented Senior Executive Assistant Business Partner to be part of the team. The Senior EABP will support Intuit’s Chief Technology Officer. The Senior EABP will be responsible for performing a wide-variety of administrative duties. The ideal candidate is self-motivated, professional, proactive, collaborative, willing to learn, and capable of managing their workload as well as their executives’ workloads while prioritizing tasks in a fast-paced environment. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. What You'll Bring Minimum of 5+ years working at the Executive administrative level Advanced Outlook calendar management is critical Expert level knowledge of Windows desktop computer applications, Microsoft Office, Google Suite/Workspace, Box skills Strong organization, project management and problem-solving skills. Possess strong interpersonal skills, as well as a strong customer service perspective (internal, as well as external), and can handle issues with respect, dignity, sensitivity, and urgency. Friendly and professional demeanor, with a “can do” attitude Ability to act quickly from one task to another, seamlessly and professionally Proven time management skills with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and work in a fast paced environment with limited supervision Be highly proactive and take ownership to anticipate needs and adept at managing-up and downstream to ensure deliverables are met timely and accurately Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization Ability to identify business issues and coordinate an appropriate response with key stakeholders. Proven experience working in a fast-pace environment while providing superior service How You Will Lead Manage complex and detailed calendars Travel coordination and arrangements Partner across organizational boundaries to deliver outcomes with EABPs and others Plan and support events for meetings, off-sites and team motivation Ability to tame organized chaos while remaining calm and composed Possess a high degree of initiative to take independent action and be able to exercise proper judgment at all times Trustworthy and able to exhibit a high degree of confidentiality and integrity Ability to take on new challenges, to learn and grow Be the “eyes and ears” of the organization and be sensitive to the needs of employees Manage and reconcile expense reports on behalf of the leaders Maintain organizational charts and email distribution lists Have a keen understanding of the organization – the vision, business direction, and mission Be approachable and collaborative with team members/peers Take initiative on researching, implementing and improving systems and processes

jobTitle: Senior Financial Analyst
jobDescription: Overview Overview The Intuit Customer Success Ecosystem Finance team is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Financial Analyst. This role will partner with several senior leaders across Customer Success to lead forecasting, planning and analysis. In addition, this role will partner with a broad set of cross-functional teams across the organization to drive strategic initiatives, resource allocation and investment decisions. About The Team The Customer Success Ecosystem team oversees customer success investments of ~$xB across Intuit. The team is responsible for forecasting, planning and analyzing Customer Success spend across the company all while enabling the optimal experience for our customers. We also assist senior leaders in developing our 1 and 3-year strategic plans that ultimately manifest themselves in our financial commitments. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion for innovation to join our team and revolutionize the way the world does business. What You'll Bring 3+ years of FP&A experience or equivalent tenure from related positions in highly dynamic finance roles. Trusted business partner who delivers operational excellence by understanding the needs of the business and identifying opportunities to improve financial results Highly motivated, self-starter with a desire to quickly learn and excel. Simultaneously manage several priorities and operate in a cross-functional matrixed organization. Meet deadlines in a high-growth environment focused on driving business results Grace under pressure with a good sense of humor and dose of humility Advanced Excel financial modeling, analytical and problem-solving skills. Hyperion and GSuite experience a plus BS/BA in Finance or Business Management, or equivalent work experience How You Will Lead Assist in monthly financial reporting, quarterly forecasting and in 1 and 3 year planning across both Customer Success Platform and Ecosystem Act as the key FP&A business partner to the Expert Network, Digital Platform PMs and Design to drive growth, profitability and decision making Manage, track and prioritize headcount investments and other employee investments and resourcing across ICS Ecosystem Assist in driving and implementing standardization and automation in operational and financial processes to ensure we meet our financial commitments Drive various analyses that deliver data driven insights in a structured manner to promote business outcomes that accelerate our growth trajectory

jobTitle: Senior Financial Analyst - People (HR) FP&A
jobDescription: Overview Intuit’s mission is powering prosperity around the world. We do it by attracting the world’s top talent, bringing vital partners into our global platform, and leaving the world a better place through exceptional corporate citizenship. The Accelerating Functions Finance team at Intuit is responsible for strategic business partnership with finance and executive leaders across Intuit’s Accelerating Functions: People and Places, Marketing and Communications, Global Finance, Legal Compliance & Policy Org, and Corporate Strategy and Development. The FP&A team is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Financial Analyst to support headcount and expense planning and reporting for the People (HR) Organization. This individual will partner closely with senior leaders in the People Organization to lead forecasting, planning and analysis, as well to drive strategic initiatives, resource allocation and investment decisions. The ideal candidate will be an inquisitive self-starter with a proven financial and business acumen, strong analytical and modeling skills, and hands-on FP&A experience in a corporate environment. What You'll Bring 3-5 years of relevant work experience (experience in FP&A, consumer financing, or high growth companies preferred) Strong understanding of investment/expense management and resource planning Detail-oriented individual with deep experience in deriving insights from analysis, formulating those insights into concise story lines and delivering presentations to senior executives to influence decision making Self-starter with a desire to quickly learn and excel; willing and able to initiate, manage, and execute projects, with a track record of identifying and implementing creative solutions Trusted business partner who delivers operational excellence by understanding the needs of the business and identifying opportunities to improve processes Strong financial acumen and understanding key business drivers. Excellent problem-solving skills and end-to-end quantitative thinking Ability to work independently, deal with ambiguity, operate in a cross-functional organization, and meet deadlines in a high-growth environment focused on driving business results Grace under pressure with a good sense of humor and dose of humility Proficiency in MS Excel, Google Suite, and Hyperion and/or Oracle Cloud EPM; strong analytical and problem-solving skills Degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Management, or equivalent work experience How You Will Lead Develop and maintain expense budget forecasting and management models to enable effective decision support for the People Organization Manage daily FP&A processes including headcount and contingent workforce forecasting in partnership with cross-functional teams including business leaders; approve and track purchase orders; collaborate with accounting and other Finance teams across Intuit where necessary to manage expense flows Lead month-end close, and drive monthly/quarterly/annually planning processes to enable the People team to deliver against quarterly and annual financial targets Drive various ad hoc analyses that deliver data driven insights in a structured manner to promote business outcomes that accelerate our growth trajectory Support FP&A team to design, continuously improve, and implement new financial and operational processes to streamline, standardize and automate repeatable work. Communicate clearly and effectively in both verbal and written communication with senior leaders within the Finance and People organizations

jobTitle: Senior Fraud Policy Analyst
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit as a Senior Analyst for Fraud Policy! This role offers a unique opportunity to innovate, develop and manage strategies and policies that aim to mitigate fraud in leading applications with millions of users. These fraud prevention projects tend to improve the various Intuit’s fraud detection capabilities. What You'll Bring Data driven, great analytic skills Team player: Effectively drive decisions and delivery across organizational boundaries through collaboration and effective relationships A keen eye for detail, accuracy and strong critical thinking skills with advanced judgment capability Innovative and proactive, tech savvy Business oriented 3-4+ years’ experience in e-commerce, payments or financial services in Fraud Management SQL / analytical BI tools Proven project management capabilities App & API Risk experience - advantage Managing Fraud Policy or Strategy - advantage Python - advantage Machine Learning technologies - advantage How You Will Lead Manage and lead high scale Risk projects while using the most advanced analytical tools. Take E2E ownership on leading significant domains and projects, that include a tight collaboration with Product management, Product Development and Data Science, across the organization and external vendors. Be responsible for establishing fraud policies constant optimization while getting sound decisions that balance risk, cost of risk, user experience and financial performance. Be responsible for determining impact on customers, operations, financial results and future business growth when setting or revising risk management policies. Constantly analyze and research with multiple tools in order to optimize the various risk mitigation methods and mechanisms. Innovate by creating hypothesis and running experiments to prove their value while introducing new capabilities (internal & external). Be the go-to person for anything and everything regarding understanding the Fraud domain, its use cases, and supporting data.

jobTitle: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is the global leader in financial management software where we have pioneered the shift to Virtual Platforms, cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. Intuit acts as a 35 year old startup, and we are constantly disrupting ourselves as we identify major new technology and design trends that are needed to deliver our mission to power prosperity around the world. Our groups are fast-paced teams focused on delivering innovative capabilities, and having fun while doing it. Note: By applying to this position, your application will be automatically submitted for the following locations: Mountain View, San Diego and the following teams at Intuit. What You'll Bring Solid foundation in writing scalable application code, following best practices of accessibility, internationalization and instrumentation Experience with cross-browser, cross-platform, and design constraints on the web and mobile Strong OOD and SOA principles, with ability to implement them in a language of choice Solid knowledge of algorithms and design patterns 4+ years of JavaScript application design and testing experience 4+ Experience in mid-tier like Node and Java Experience with test automation: TDD, unit/integration/functional testing Experience with Relational Database Design and Implementation Experience in UI frameworks like React, Backbone, Angular Experience building CI/CD pipelines Desired Skills Practical experience in developing applications using microservices, container technologies, container management systems such as Kubernetes, Mesos, etc. Strong experience with Databases design (SQL, NoSQL) and analytics Prior working experience in utility computing and/or cloud computing domain Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments How You Will Lead Write scalable application code following best practices of accessibility, internationalization and instrumentation Hands-on development. Write highest quality code with utmost attention to scalability and performance Builds effective internal and external relationships that are essential to delivering a quality software product or service Stay aware of industry trends and make technology choices and strategic decisions Subject matter expert on technologies Ability to take a vague customer problem and solve it end to end with accountability Team/Leadership Characteristics Team player possessing strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills Strong mentoring skills with ability to provide technical guidance and review code Ability to work with global teams across time zones Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, complex technical environment with high adaptability and flexibility Experience working with cross-functional teams while maintaining effective working relationships Communicates clearly, succinctly and persuasively to all levels of employees, customers and management "Self-starter" attitude and the ability to make decisions independently

jobTitle: Senior Interaction Designer
jobDescription: Overview As Senior Interaction Designer, you’ll be joining a team consisting of cross-disciplinary creatives (visual, motion, experiential, and content designers) who raise the bar on end-to-end experiences across multiple disciplines. The Senior Designer reports to the Digital Design Lead. You’ll combine your love of design craft with expert collaboration through all phases of the design cycle. Come join us. Intuit’s Brand Storytelling and Experiences (BSX) team is looking for a Senior Interaction Designer that can innovate in the virtual, physical and hybrid events space. You’ll bring your skills in UX strategy, research, documentation, prototyping, educational design, design systems, user testing and analytics to improve the audience experience across a wide range of internal and external events at scale. Ultimately, you’ll be able to improve Intuit’s overall event experiences using technology, content and deep knowledge of human behavior and motivations by designing experiences where every touchpoint, large and small, are thoughtfully considered. What You'll Bring Deep knowledge of design principles and methods Ability to craft prototypes to test and validate hypotheses using qualitative and quantitative methods Curiosity and commitment to testing new ideas and innovating to drive business results Strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills Expertise conveying ideas and concepts through storyboarding, wireframing, and prototyping Mastery of industry-standard interaction design and productivity tools such as Figma, Sketch, mural, as well as knowledge of user testing and analytics tools A dazzling online portfolio demonstrating your strong craft and collaborative process 3+ years of experience in interaction design, product design, service design, and/or related field Bachelor’s degree in Product Design, Human-Computer Interaction Design, or other relevant field (Masters a plus) or work experience How You Will Lead Solve customer problems by synthesizing behavioral information and imagining things as they might be, not as they are Deliver user flow diagrams, interaction patterns, design specs, wireframes, information architecture, and prototypes Conceptualize a broad spectrum of ideas and then narrow based on experimentation and customer research Solicit feedback and contribute constructively to design reviews Advance a strong point of view, backed up by personal expertise, design rationale, customer data, and industry trends Work on multiple projects at one time, using strong communication skills to manage time and expectations appropriately Create a bold vision and propose game changing ideas in areas of ownership Influence cross-functional partners to focus efforts on strategic, customer-back innovations that have the largest business impact

jobTitle: Senior Manager, Compensation
jobDescription: Overview About Intuit: As members of the People and places team, we are stewards of Intuit’s greatest strategic asset: Our People. Our mission is to maximize the potential of our people to accelerate Intuit’s growth. Our vision is to inspire the world’s top talent to innovate and make a difference. About the role: Come join Intuit’s Total Rewards team as a Sr. Compensation Program manager. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion for data analytics to join our team and revolutionize the way we attract and motivate our people. As a Rewards Program Manager, you will support compensation initiatives by focusing on deep data analysis. You will be collaborating with team members to support compensation deliverables that could range from design, delivery and consulting with business leaders. What You'll Bring BA/BS degree, quantitative-focused major preferred, or equivalent work experience 7+ years of experience in compensation, preferably within the technology industry or HR consulting firm Experience in managing rewards cycles Experience with workday with deep knowledge of the system functionality Experience as a manager Attention to details Project management skills Comfortable with both working independently and collaboratively as needed Ability to prioritize competing demands and support multiple stakeholders Ability to come up to speed quickly on Intuit System (Mainly HR systems) Advanced data analysis skills (advanced Excel skills necessary, good to have a working knowledge of Tableau or other quantitative tools) How You Will Lead Overseeing the rewards cycle with the support of the different stakeholders Training Communications System: functionality, testing and reports Manage and administrate our recognition and retention cash plans, including governance matrix design, efficiency plans and documentation Provide support on compensation projects including but not limited to - compensation policies and practices, new hires/transfers compensation support, market benchmarking, compensation content delivery and refresh. Support compensation queries through our HR services model Support compensation training and communications efforts Analyze data sets to distill insights, convey findings and provide data-backed recommendations. Develop cost models, forecast analyses and plan design recommendations on a variety of global compensation programs, including, but not limited to, base pay, short-term incentives and retention. Build and design a governance matrix for the different rewards components and process Supporting the maintenance of the rewards site content, including documentation of Rewards policies and process

jobTitle: Senior Manager - Customer Success Retention Programs
jobDescription: Overview We are looking for a Senior Manager to oversee retention programs for Intuit’s Customer Success organization. Reporting to the Head of Growth and Retention – Customer Success, this position will be responsible for experience and service delivery of expert assisted retention programs within Customer Success in the US. The position will collaborate daily with peers in Marketing, Sales, Digital Delivery, Product Management, Finance, and Analytics. What You'll Bring 2+ years’ experience leading retention programs in a B2B or B2C environment 5+ years overall experience in Customer Success or sales management Demonstrated track record where he/she has operated independently and efficiently to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously, and to manage milestones and deadlines in a fast-paced environment Ability to define strategies based on business goals & customer insights, lead with a hypothesis, and translate them into actionable tests & implementation plans Passion for delighting customers & using customer insights to improve end-to-end experiences Demonstrated ability to drive performance through third party vendors and dotted line reporting relationships Clear track record of being accountable for making smart and fast decisions, partnering cross-functionally, delighting customers, and driving dramatic growth through successful marketing strategies and execution Innovative thinker with a passion for generating new ideas, nurturing a culture of creativity, & continuing to raise the bar on business performance Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with clear examples of using data actively for customer insights, measurement, ROI analysis and recommendations Bachelor’s degree in Business/Marketing preferred How You Will Lead Manage all expert assisted retention programs across Intuit’s Customer Success platforms in the US Service delivery - Be responsible for day-to-day performance management across multiple third-party vendors Have a passion for innovation, as well as tenacity for collaborating across multiple functions and driving business results for both the short and long term Experience delivery - Effectively partner with a broad array of cross-functional teams to ideate, test, develop, and scale performance and efficiency improvements to existing retention programs Be responsible for driving a positive customer experience and retention revenue Work with internal AI/ML teams to develop propensity models to improve revenue growth and retention across expert-assisted experiences Have a deep understanding of data to drive strategic direction

jobTitle: Senior Manager, Marketing Solutions (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview People who work for themselves fuel our economy. In the US, small businesses employ 60% of the workforce and create 80% of new jobs. Oftentimes the odds are stacked against them with 50% failing in the first 5 years. Intuit’s Small Business and Self-Employed Group (SBSEG) is devoted to creating solutions to meet the needs and improve the chances of success for these entrepreneurs with a portfolio of solutions from Mailchimp and QuickBooks. Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small businesses. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaigns, CRM, and analytics tools. We are seeking a Senior Manager, Marketing Solutions to join our growing Lifecycle Marketing and Operations team. In this role, you’ll seek to define and create best-in-class solutions to automate, optimize, and accelerate owned-channel marketing, leveraging an in-depth understanding of the complexities of omnichannel B2B marketing and the technology and data that powers it. You will understand the needs and vision of the business, and work closely with Lifecycle Marketing and Build & Implementation teams to deliver the best technology solutions to fulfill those needs. You will be a thought leader and SME in owned-channel MarTech, sharing your knowledge to mature and grow the Marketing Solutions team. What You'll Bring You have 8+ years of experience within marketing technology and operations, people management experience is highly valuable You have an expert-level knowledge of multiple MAPs (Eloqua/Marketo/Braze/etc) and CDPs (Segment/Adobe/etc), and experience across a broad range of martech / data solutions and tools You are extremely confident leveraging marketing data, and associated structures and systems, to define / measure / improve marketing solutions and processes You are hands-on and lead by example, using your extensive knowledge in the martech space to make an impact within the organization You have strong collaboration skills and ability to align efforts across multiple departments and cross-functional teams You are self-motivated to uncover and drive forward opportunities to continuously improve processes and solutions You are a “lifelong learner”, quickly adapting to new systems and processes, and comfortable operating in a fast-paced and rapidly-evolving environment Ideally, you have a working knowledge of SQL, JS, Velocity/AmpScript/etc, HTML/CSS and other common martech coding languages How You Will Lead You will translate Lifecycle Marketing plans to data and tech requirements You will serve as expert advisor & SME for Lifecycle Marketing to ensure strategy and plans are fully leveraging the functionality of our marketing tech stack You will partner closely with Operations, Analytics, GTM, and Engineering teams to define and deliver elegant, scalable solutions to complex cross-platform scenarios for Lifecycle Marketing You will enhance campaign features and capabilities to improve the customer experience You will leverage and expand cross-channel tools and utilization for personalized communication You will strategize technology opportunities for Lifecycle Marketing campaigns, from lead management through to retention and loyalty efforts You will partner with Sales Operations to define, deliver and optimize marketing solutions for lead capture, scoring, and lifecycle management You will partner with Acquisition team to identify and implement solutions for cross-channel marketing efforts across paid and social/earned channels You will support campaign Build & Implementation team with segmentation, audience definitions and data solutions to power Lifecycle Marketing campaigns You will understand the end-to-end production process and identify opportunities to solve for gaps and pain points You will stay current on industry trends and emerging technologies with an eye on continually improving Mailchimp’s owned-channel marketing and performance

jobTitle: Senior Manager of Marketing Science (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small business. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaign, CRM, and analytics tools. The Data Analytics & Science team at MailChimp drives user growth and retention using product insights and marketing channel optimization for the MailChimp. We are an exciting, growing and fun team that works with industry- leading analytics tools, techniques and best practices. As a Senior Manager Marketing Sciences, you will dive deep into our digital acquisition data and campaigns to uncover actionable insights and make recommendations that will influence the company’s strategic decisions. This position works alongside marketers, agency partners and finance team to deliver business results and grow our customer base for our MailChimp products. This position can be located in NY/NJ area or Atlanta, GA What You'll Bring We’d love to hear from you if: You have 8+ years of experience in customer marketing and analytics, 3+ years of team management experience You have experience building market mix models, MTA models ability to develop insights using these models You have rich digital media analytics experience, knowledge of experimentation design, A/B testing and paid media testing You have outstanding communication skills with the ability to influence decision makers and build consensus with teams You have the willingness and ability to adapt to the rapid business and organizational changes that accompany a high-growth environment You have an undergrad Degree in Quantitative Field (Masters preferred) or equivalent work experience At Mailchimp, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We don’t just accept differences, we celebrate them, support them, and hire peeps from a wide variety of backgrounds because it makes our company stronger. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience aligns with what we’re looking for (even if you don’t check every single box), please consider applying! How You Will Lead What you’ll do here: You will help build out of the marketing science discipline including establishing the methodologies, processes and internal and external partnership to measure and optimize marketing ROI You will establish strong partnerships between media analytics, marketing planning, advertising teams to develop and execute the learning roadmap and ensure analytics are effectively embedded in decision making You will lead the marketing mix modeling and multi-touch attribution analytic programs to create a unified platform to inform marketing planning and optimization You will lead the cross-channel campaign measurement program to assess impact on brand health and reputation KPI’s You will develop presentations and reports for senior management on key marketing analytics initiatives You will be a subject matter expert on the latest consumer, industry and competitive trends

jobTitle: Senior Manager, Security Development
jobDescription: Overview Come join one of the most dynamic DevSecOps teams in the industry! At Intuit, we work closely with security researchers and our development teams to protect our customers, products and services from the latest emerging threats. We are looking for a dynamic manager to work within our Adversary Management group. As the lead of our Automated Exploitation Team, you’ll ensure that our Adversary Emulation capability is able to continuously identify, assess, and exploit vulnerabilities on Intuit’s attack surface. Leading a team of exceptional security engineers and software developers, you will leverage your considerable leadership experience to drive the development of our Automated Emulation Platform, providing a force multiplier to both our manual and automated offensive security functions. What You'll Bring Passion for Information Security, especially Offensive Security. 3 years’ experience as a technical leader either in security or software development 6+ years of information security experience and/or development experience Demonstrated experience leading positive change, empowering people and running a high performing team. Ability to think and act strategically in consideration of all stakeholders. Ability to lead and direct programmers utilizing Agile methodologies. BS in Computer Science / or related degree / or equivalent work-related experience. Strong organizational and planning skills in a fast moving environment. Experience with and/or a passion for application security and solving for the highest risk, including security vulnerability detection capabilities such as static analysis, composition analysis, dynamic analysis, and interactive application security testing. How You Will Lead Build high performing teams by putting the right people in the right job at the right time. Create a culture of collaboration, fun, and solution mindsets where teams feel empowered to learn, test, and iterate. In this role, you will help to bring out the best ideas from the best security engineers and developers by empowering them and leading by example. Utilizing Agile methodologies your team will develop cloud based software products to automate and augment security testing. You will help create shared vision and build and maintain strong cross-functional relationships / alignment with partners across the Intuit security organization and business.

jobTitle: Senior Marketing Analyst (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview We’re looking for a Senior Analyst to join the Marketing Analytics team. You will be responsible for leading key analyses projects, reporting, and processes leading to insights that help drive Marketing decision making. This role is both data-driven and strategic, focused on improving paid media and web/owned channel efficiency through ongoing optimization and expanding measurement capabilities.The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in similar marketing analytics roles with strong technical and analytical abilities. As a part of the Marketing Analytics team, the work you do will have high visibility across Marketing and other departments as it is used for data-driven decision making guiding marketing investments and strategy. What You'll Bring Experience in media and advertising analytics Bachelor’s or Graduate degree (analytics, computer science, or mathematics a plus) 3-5 years experience in media analytics or advertising analytics preferred Fluency in media technology, ad serving platforms, and marketing data systems Expertise in reporting on media spend, efficiency, and optimization Experience with eCommerce and/or software-as-a-service (SaaS) business models Experience working with senior leadership at corporations An ability to translate business objectives into measurable goals and KPI Ability to translate technical data into a framework and language that internal clients can understand Expert working knowledge of SQL, R, and/or Python Expert at wrangling and transforming data Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving abilities Extensive experience with data visualization tools like Tableau and Looker Expertise in media reporting platforms like Campaign Manager, Facebook Ads, Search Ads 360 a plus Expert knowledge of web analytics and user behavior analysis (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.) Experience reporting on web, owned, social, and Organic Search using analytical tools Experience working with Google BigQuery a plus Experience with statistical methods such as regression and hypothesis testing Experience analyzing data from a variety of different sources (quantitative and qualitative), and presenting the data in a clear and concise manner What You’ll Do Here How you will lead Lead key exploratory analysis to understand new sources of data and new tools Develop new methods for analysis based on shifting media and web landscapes Own and build analytical tools and solutions addressing Marketing business needs and questions enabling better decisions by leadership Lead complex analytics requirements conversations, communicate with stakeholders to plan analysis approach, and guide key decisions Join paid and web data to create full funnel customer analytics across channels. Unify data and tell data stories using big data in new ways Translate complex business questions into sound data analysis using a hypothesis and solution process Develop analysis methodology, mine, and interpret data and offer recommendations and insight around specific questions Create new reporting and dashboards, data infrastructure, and queries to track key marketing metrics across multiple data sources leveraging SQL, R/Python and, Looker, Tableau, and other visualization tools; monitor for changes in trends, share insights and make recommendations Architect multi cell tests and test methodology for media performance studies and web testing Operate as a self-directed individual contributor and manage towards project timelines and dependencies.

jobTitle: Senior Marketing Program Manager
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is a mission-driven, global financial platform company that gives everyone the opportunity to prosper. We do this by using technology to solve our customers’ most important problems. We serve customers by finding more ways to put more money in their pockets, eliminating work and drudgery so they can focus on their lives and what matters to them, and ensuring that every financial decision that they make, they make it with confidence. Our flagship products – QuickBooks, TurboTax, Credit Karma and Mint – define the commitment to revolutionize the way people manage their personal finances, run small businesses and pay employees. Intuit has become a staple of American small business and personal finance, with a widespread and deep-rooted presence that's second to none. People who work for themselves fuel our economy. In the U.S., small businesses employ 60% of the workforce and create 80% of new jobs. Oftentimes the odds are stacked against them with 50% failing in the first 5 years. Intuit’s Small Business and Self-Employed Group (SBSEG) is devoted to creating a portfolio of solutions to meet the needs and improve the chances of success for these entrepreneurs. QuickBooks is traditionally known for accounting and bookkeeping products and services. Increasingly, following customer demand and market trends, we are investing in services that help small businesses run their business on the QuickBooks platform. This includes a number of money movement services, as well as employee management solutions. As a Senior Marketing Program Manager you will be responsible for driving cross functional initiatives that support the US Marketing organization and strategic annual goals that help accelerate growth of QuickBooks service offerings by partnering with sales, marketing, product, billing and our technology teams. You will be a crucial member of a newly formed team designed to build specialization and expertise in business analytics within a high growth portfolio. What You'll Bring Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with 5-7+ years of experience leading cross-functional or complex projects and programs, preferably in a Marketing or Operations role Proven ability to quickly earn the trust of sponsors and key stakeholders; mobilize and motivate teams; set direction and approach; resolve conflict; execute with limited information and ambiguity Strong organization, time management and task prioritization skills. Must be an exceptional planner who is highly organized with attention to detail, self-directed, efficient and able to manage complex programs in a timely manner Excellent verbal, written, visual/presentation and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to make decisions quickly & communicate effectively within a large and diverse organization is essential Ability to operate with minimal supervision and direction, and drive process using indirect authority Excellent leadership skills. Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment and ability to both influence and develop strong partnerships at all levels Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional virtual teams to deliver on key program objectives and understand impact to various stakeholders High intellectual curiosity and a growth mindset How You Will Lead Lead complex, cross-functional programs across all phases of planning and execution for key marketing strategies and capability building Partner with key business stakeholders to define the strategy and objective, initiatives and key outcomes for key marketing capabilities Use exceptional cross-functional partnering skills with ability to gain shared vision and "influence without authority" on challenging decisions and priority trade-offs Own the in-year planning process for each respective marketing goal (from initiative breakdown, quick base management, milestone setting) Create, optimize and drive structured schedules and project plans across cross-functional teams and partners. Set and meet deadlines with quality deliverables, effectively adapting and modifying plans based on changing conditions or data Define the initiative’s roles and responsibilities, DACI and key business processes with cross functional team Coordinate go-to-market (GTM) teams and programs in conjunction with Tech teams Coordinate with Technical Program Managers (TPMs) and tech dependencies across key initiatives to ensure timely delivery of business goals Serve as the central point of contact to coordinate across marketing teams (e.g., lifecycle marketers, audience marketers, solutions, build, capabilities / innovation) Balance changing priorities, while looking around corners to anticipate risks and proactively manage these risks before they become blockers Anticipate, recognize, and work through resistance or setbacks, work well with others when conflicts arise, ensure alignment with objectives, find common ground and promote understanding of alternative viewpoints before driving for closure and cooperation Own the recurring updates and escalation paths to leadership Create and finalize status & commentary for monthly leadership updates on the initiative’s progress, blockers, help needed

jobTitle: Senior Offering Program Manager - Senior Event Project Manager
jobDescription: Overview Intuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world for consumers, small businesses and the self-employed. The Brand Storytelling and Experiences (BSX) team brings that mission to life through high impact and transformative experiences designed to shape, display, and demonstrate the power and meaning behind the Intuit ecosystem. We inspire employees and customers with virtual, hybrid, and IRL experiences that galvanize our 14K+ employees around key initiatives, utilizing best-in-class storytelling. This cross-functional, high-performing team serves as a center of excellence for the company and includes experts across experience design, strategic content, experiential learning, event production, experiential marketing, and more. We are looking for a passionate Experiential Event Manager to oversee the strategy and execution of a portfolio of our most critical customer facing and strategic internal events. This is a high-visibility role, requiring you to collaborate and co-create experiences within the BSX team, and with teams in other business units as assigned, lead large project teams, and help develop and evangelize a rigorous event planning process that enables seamless execution of our event portfolio. This role reports to the GMM, Events. What You'll Bring Seven (7) or more years of experience in e2e event project management. Deep project management expertise. Proven ability to drive informed, context-based decisions. Proven expertise in leading complex, global programs, often with several (virtual) locations. Strategic thinker and creative problem-solver, ability to bring strategic objectives to life through event experiences. Deep knowledge around development of workback plans and timelines, budgets, briefs, e2e project plans, etc. Proven ability to drive collaborative teams to timely, data-driven, thoughtful decisions. Ability to demonstrate how events align with and make an impact on Intuit’s key business drivers. Demonstrated ability to lead in a highly matrixed environment and influence outcomes at all levels of the organization. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Must thrive in an environment of rapid change, moving targets, and cross-functional dependencies. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required. CMP preferred. Limited (15%) travel, post pandemic. How You Will Lead Drive innovative in-person, hybrid, and virtual events end to end (e2e) on a global scale. Foster a planning environment that enables rich co-creation and iteration on great ideas for best possible outcomes. Lead collaborative project teams to create and drive inspired e2e experiences including concept, vision, comms, web, registration, main stage and breakout programming, visual design, event tech, video content, and related logistics, working in partnership with BSX strategy, design, and content leads. Develop and manage work back plan and cross-functional timelines, detailed project plans, and workstream requirements, act as the single source of truth for all stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Develop, drive, and manage e2e logistics including budgeting and financial mgmt, venue, agency, calendaring/scheduling, speaker prep, contracts, vendors, deliverables tracking, delighters, food and beverage, etc. Drive all cross-functional project workstreams to successful execution, track cross-functional deliverables and escalate when necessary. Develop and foster stakeholder trust by initiating and nurturing partnerships and delivering consistent subject matter expertise. Effectively manage resources to deliver against competing projects. Identify and problem solve resourcing risks. Optimize the event infrastructure by designing and strengthening operational, analytical, and financial processes, in partnership with the BXS operations team. Demonstrate measurable business impact based on the goals outlined for each experience. Use post event analytics and data to inform recommendations for future events.

jobTitle: Senior Partnership Attorney
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit's Global Alliance Team as a Senior Partnership Attorney. Be Bold. Learn Fast. Win Together. @Intuit. These are just a few of the core values that Intuit personnel live and breathe during their career at Intuit. We are very excited to offer a growth position to a mid-level attorney in California. Intuit’s Senior Partnership Attorneys have an extremely broad level of responsibility and the opportunity to work on a great variety of matters, both in the marketing and in the contracting fields. As they become more experienced, the complexity and strategic impact of the matters that they work on will increase. Based upon the interests of the person in the position, there could be an opportunity to move to specialized areas within contracts and marketing or in related areas such as product or privacy. The successful applicant will directly interact with our senior leaders, learn and collaborate with our business partners, and leverage our processes all while making fast decisions, bringing your recommendations to life, and changing the trajectory of our business. “We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. We are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.” What You'll Bring Must have a J.D. degree from an ABA accredited law school or meet the requirements for legal education in a foreign country and membership in good standing with at least one US State Bar 6+ years experience in commercial/transactional areas of contract drafting, negotiation and deal management for larger business transactions Ability to think strategically and leverage strong analytical skills Strong ability to collaborate cross-functionally & build enduring partnerships Outstanding verbal & written communication skills High energy, positive mindset and "can do" attitude How You Will Lead Working with the legal department’s Global Alliances group, this individual will be responsible for drafting, negotiating and advising upon various U.S. and global partnership transactions, including in-bound and out-bound data licenses, SaaS, marketing, enterprise sales, sales channel, and other commercial contracts with minimal direction and supervision. The ideal candidate will have a strong desire to learn, a “can do” attitude, the willingness to work on a very large variety of tasks across business units, as well as manage and prioritize multiple concurrent activities. The successful candidate will understand the technical and business ramifications of the transactions the individual handles and also how to help the business intelligently manage both legal and business risks. Central to our group’s support model is constant effort to increase scalability / efficiency. The ideal candidate will be process-oriented and possess an ongoing desire to “never answer the same question twice” -- to ensure through training, guidelines and general processes that the right resource is doing the right work -- so they can focus on the most strategic, highest-valued work.

jobTitle: Senior Platform Engineer
jobDescription: Overview Come join the Cloud Engineering team as a Senior Software Engineer. We are looking for team members that love new challenges, cracking tough problems and working cross-functionally. Service oriented thinking along with excellent diagnostic and communication skills and a passion to resolve customer problems is a must have for this role. You will join an innovative and passionate team of engineers using cutting edge technologies like React, Go, Kubernetes, AWS Services, Karate, Observability tooling etc. We are looking for an engineer with a strong background in both front-end web technologies (React) and back-end leveraging (Go). You will be working on end-to-end features and services that enhance the product set and delight our customers. The engineer should have genuine interest in all software technology and will be directly responsible for design, development, testing, maintenance, and documentation of high quality software components. The successful candidate will have a history of implementing software for highly available and durable cloud native platforms. What You'll Bring BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience Self-starter with strong work ethic with a passion for problem-solving Strong abilities in sketching, mocking up (using moqups, sketch, Figma or similar tools) 5+ years of experience developing web applications 3+ years of experience with Go, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and React JS framework 3+ years of experience with REST (consuming and creating) Strong Experience with AWS Cloud services like S3, Lambda, EC2, Fargate, SQS, SNS etc Experience with monitoring and logging solutions like Splunk, Wavefront, Prometheus, Open telemetry etc Experience with unit testing & Test-Driven Development (TDD) Experience writing integration and functional tests using frameworks like Karate Mastery of collaborative software development using GitHub Experience with Agile Development, SCRUM, or Extreme Programming methodologies Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences Strong understanding of the software design/architecture process Experience with Devops practice and familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker Reviewable open-source contributions would be a plus Bonus points if you are currently contributing to / or have taken part in open-source projects Scripting experience in Python a plus Roughly 80-90% hands-on coding How You Will Lead Strong understanding of the Software design/architecture process Designing/developing web-based applications and backend services Gathering functional requirements, developing technical specifications, and project & test planning Experience with unit testing & Test-Driven Development (TDD) Demonstrate ownership and operational excellence mindset by being part of on-call rotation for incidents as well as participating in production incident and root cause analysis Work cross-functionally with various Intuit teams: Various product lines, or business units to drive forward results Stay aware of industry trends and make technology choices and strategic decisions Excellent documentation and communication skills.

jobTitle: Senior Product Analyst (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview Our Corporate Strategy team is a new and growing function here at Mailchimp to support our strategic initiatives, business operations and revenue management as Mailchimp continues to evolve. We are seeking a motivated and energetic data analyst to support the growth of the analytics function of this team. As a Senior Product Analyst on the Product Analytics team, you will help lead strategic, data-driven decision making at Mailchimp. In this role, you will apply a variety of analytical tools and techniques to conduct deep dive analysis to both help understand and better explain customer behavior and business trends as well as predict future business outcomes. You will partner with stakeholders across the company -- product, finance, marketing, legal, and others -- to support the business on strategic analytics requests and build cross-functional reporting to arm Mailchimp with insights that will help steer our future. Requirements What you'll bring Experience in an analytics-focused role, prior work experience within a technology (software) company is a plus Expertise in SQL Understanding of web analytics and user behavior analysis is a plus (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.) Experience working with cloud based data warehouses like Google BigQuery, Redshift, or Snowflake is a plus Demonstrated, hands-on experience with data visualization tools, e.g. Looker and Tableau Proven experience analyzing data from a variety of different sources (quantitative and qualitative), presenting the data in a clear and concise manner, and create actionable insights Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving abilities Experience working and presenting to leaders and building relationships with them Bachelor’s or Graduate degree (business, analytics, or mathematics a plus or equivalent work experience) How You Will Lead Job responsibilities Product Analytics Identify and synthesize both quantitative and qualitative research and trends related to the business to help teams make data-informed decisions Conduct targeted analyses on high-priority topics and provide subject matter expertise on business analytics topics Independently analyze multiple kinds of data sets that provide a complete picture of users behavior from attraction, awareness, conversion, usage, and retention. Lead the generation of insights through visualizations and advanced analytics Craft narratives and recommendations from analyses, build presentations, and present findings to business stakeholders Design experimentation initiatives, synthesize and present results Build relationships and provide analytical guidance to key business stakeholders and leaders Drive methodology iteration and build templates for common analysis projects Develop data infrastructure guidelines for new product / feature launches and partner with data teams to implement Build analysis plans and plan out analysis for individual or team analysis projects Cross-functional measurement and reporting Collate data from across Mailchimp to develop and maintain a set of clear, consistent, and comprehensive dashboards that track Mailchimp performance across functions on an on-going basis. Continuously improve scoreboard reporting and facilitate insight generation from scoreboard metrics – highlighting and decomposing trends and drilling down to identify underlying drivers Work closely with strategic initiative owners to develop, maintain, and automate reporting on impact and KPIs of cross-functional initiatives (e.g., revenue growth, upsell rates, cross sell rates, etc.)

jobTitle: Senior Product Counsel
jobDescription: Overview Come join our amazing team of leaders, learners and world-class legal professionals. Working as a member of the Products Counseling Team, you will be responsible for partnering with multiple innovative product teams around the world to power prosperity for consumers and small businesses. Your specific focus will be working with the Quickbooks Workforce Solutions suite of products. For these products, you will ensure that Intuit’s products are structured to achieve our strategy while complying with applicable laws and regulations in multiple jurisdictions. The ideal candidate should have knowledge of regulations in the financial services area, including FCRA, state lending and payments laws, TILA, and have experience advising on advertising and marketing. What You'll Bring At least 6-8+ years of experience primarily advising technology companies Significant breadth of knowledge in as many of the following areas as possible: data privacy and protection, IP, mobile and cloud computing, competition law, employment law, and technology licensing Experience navigating regulations related to financial services Experience with insurance products and related legal issues Demonstrated ability to perform with minimal supervision Experience providing legal support on a global scale Ability to communicate with business partners about regulatory obligations and risk management processes Excellent drafting and negotiation skills Ability to produce clear and succinct written legal analysis and business communications, and counsel and manage clients, including senior management Excellent communication skills Ability to interact with and lead change with senior executive leaders Ability to effectively frame issues to drive strategic thinking and execution Comfortable and adept at balancing risk and opportunity, and thinking creatively to enable the business to make smart decisions Excellent teaching and training skills Excellent business acumen JD and membership in good standing with at least one US State Bar How You Will Lead You will be the senior legal partner to the Workforce Solutions leadership team and partner closely with product management, business development, engineering, design, marketing, and compliance and operations teams. You will provide legal advice and counseling on a wide variety of cutting edge matters, including data privacy and protection, mobile, product liability, IP and regulatory compliance. Many of these matters will be in the FinTech and MarTech areas, including payroll, employee time tracking, and insurance products. You may structure, draft, negotiate and advise upon various complex transactions with minimal direction and supervision. You will also provide legal advice and counseling on a wide variety of matters. You should be comfortable with navigating through unknown/uncharted areas and seeking appropriate advice/guidance as well as ‘swim’ on your own in the ocean. You should be passionate and tech-savvy with a solid understanding of product compliance as well as fintech-innovation generally – all to provide support to various work streams enabling product offerings to delight small businesses.

jobTitle: Senior Product Designer (New York City or Atlanta)
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit, our mission is to power prosperity around the world. As the Virtual Expert Platform team, we design the end-to-end AI-driven expert platform that connects customers to live services and digital expertise with speed and accuracy. As a Sr. Product Designer, you will lead design for a core set of customer and expert Digital Expertise capabilities. This role requires a dynamic individual who is comfortable working in a highly collaborative environment, with a solid ability to go deep into end-user problems and then apply design thinking and design craft to solve them. What You'll Bring Bachelor's degree in Product Design, Human-Computer Interaction Design, another relevant field, or equivalent work experience. A graduate degree is a plus. 4+ years of experience in interaction design, product design, design strategy, or related field Strong knowledge of design principle, strategy, and methods Customer-centric design mindset Experience designing for and working with design systems and reusable component libraries Expertise in conveying ideas and concepts through storyboarding, wireframing, and prototyping Effective communicator, presenter, and negotiator Mastery of design tools such as Figma A well-presented online portfolio demonstrating your strong craft and collaborative process How You Will Lead Articulate complex visions through simple, elegant designs Participate in customer research with clear goals, a testable hypothesis, and a learning plan Contribute to shaping the evolution of our platform through strategic thinking and creating elegant, durable, and scalable design solutions Conceptualize a broad spectrum of ideas and then narrow it based on experimentation and customer research Engage with end-users and stakeholders frequently and learn quickly through iterative prototyping Apply learning and data insights to generate designs that deliver customer delight Collaborate effectively with other product designers, content strategists, researchers, product managers, developers, and business analysts Solicit feedback and contribute constructively to design reviews Advance a strong point of view, backed up by personal expertise, design rationale, customer data, and industry trends Work on multiple projects at one time, using strong communication skills to manage time and expectations appropriately Curiosity and commitment to testing new ideas and innovating to drive business results

jobTitle: Senior Product Designer - Visual
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit, our mission is to power prosperity around the world. Join the Virtual Expert Platform (VEP) team, where we aspire to transform the lives of our customers and the services industry through technology-powered, human-enabled platform solutions. As a Product Designer–Visual on the VEP team, you will help support the end-to-end visual design strategy across multiple capabilities, identifying gaps in the experience, and exploring opportunities to scale visual design across Intuit platform products. Our Visual Designers are involved in every step of a project—from gathering insights, brainstorming, prototyping, and experimenting to launching pixel-perfect designs. This role will work closely with product designers, content designers, and cross-functional teams to bring clarity and simplicity to every interaction. You will also get to partner with a large, established design team where we have expertise in branding, user experience, design systems, design technology, and motion design. What You'll Bring 3-4+ years of visual design experience with consumer applications. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience in a design-related field. An online portfolio demonstrating your craft and proven business impact. Ability to work with Art Directors, Project Managers, Engineers, and Senior Leaders. Solid understanding of interaction design, information architecture, and user interfaces. Deep knowledge of design principles, methods, and currency of design trends in mobile and web applications. Intimate knowledge of Figma, Adobe CC, and prototyping tools. Excellent communication, self-management, and organizational skills. An understanding of the relationship between visual, interaction, and content disciplines. Experience working with engineers to ensure fidelity of visual design decisions. Experience with QA and setting a high bar for experience delivery. Curiosity and commitment to testing new ideas. Additional experience in motion design and design systems is a plus. A strong passion for all things Visual Design and a deeply ingrained desire to make all design functional and beautiful. A collaborative nature and a positive mindset. How You Will Lead Have fun partnering closely with interaction and content designers at all stages to build easy-to-use products that solve real problems. Use a systematic design approach to conceptualize a broad spectrum of ideas and then narrow based on experimentation and customer research. Work on multiple projects at a time, using strong communication skills to manage time and expectations appropriately. You know where you can have the most impact, and you can explain why. Help scale the visual design craft with playbooks, resources, and self-help materials so that you can focus on exciting, high-priority projects. Be an advocate and representative for the Virtual Expert Platform needs among the Intuit Visual Design Community. Drive emotional design to deliver awesome product experiences with detailed execution via layout, typography, iconography, color theory, and composition. Collaborate effectively with other designers, engineers, product managers, marketers, and researchers. We are one big team, and we value everyone’s insights. Actively solicit feedback and contribute constructively to design reviews. Advance a strong point of view backed up by personal expertise, design rationale, customer data, and industry trends. Build upon and evolve existing design systems by collaborating with visual design peers. Be an advocate of Visual Design as a discipline and be unafraid to bring ideas to elevate it.
