Solid understanding of interaction design, information architecture, and user interfaces. Deep knowledge of design principles, methods, and currency of design trends in mobile and web applications. Intimate knowledge of Figma, Adobe CC, and prototyping tools. Excellent communication, self-management, and organizational skills. An understanding of the relationship between visual, interaction, and content disciplines. Experience working with engineers to ensure fidelity of visual design decisions. Experience with QA and setting a high bar for experience delivery. Curiosity and commitment to testing new ideas. Additional experience in motion design and design systems is a plus. A strong passion for all things Visual Design and a deeply ingrained desire to make all design functional and beautiful. A collaborative nature and a positive mindset. How You Will Lead Have fun partnering closely with interaction and content designers at all stages to build easy-to-use products that solve real problems. Use a systematic design approach to conceptualize a broad spectrum of ideas and then narrow based on experimentation and customer research. Work on multiple projects at a time, using strong communication skills to manage time and expectations appropriately. You know where you can have the most impact, and you can explain why. Help scale the visual design craft with playbooks, resources, and self-help materials so that you can focus on exciting, high-priority projects. Be an advocate and representative for the Virtual Expert Platform needs among the Intuit Visual Design Community. Drive emotional design to deliver awesome product experiences with detailed execution via layout, typography, iconography, color theory, and composition. Collaborate effectively with other designers, engineers, product managers, marketers, and researchers. We are one big team, and we value everyone’s insights. Actively solicit feedback and contribute constructively to design reviews. Advance a strong point of view backed up by personal expertise, design rationale, customer data, and industry trends. Build upon and evolve existing design systems by collaborating with visual design peers. Be an advocate of Visual Design as a discipline and be unafraid to bring ideas to elevate it.

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager, AI Feature Management Platform
jobDescription: Overview Be part of the Intuit AI PM team and help create an end-to-end AI platform vision that will democratize AI across Intuit. At Intuit, our mission is to create an AI-driven expert platform that powers prosperity around the world. Building AI enabled financial advice, insights, predictions, forecasts, etc are core capabilities to drive our mission, solve problems with speed, and automate processes for our small businesses and consumers alike. At Intuit, AI is defined as a combination of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and Knowledge Engineering (KE) to provide the best of breed capabilities to drive our AI vision. We’re looking for a creative problem solver, with deep technical knowledge of the AI/ML + ML Operations, and passion for innovation and collaboration, to join the Intuit AI team as a Product Manager. The product management team’s charter is to build a world class AI platform and enable durable, reusable AI services that will scale AI at Intuit. This key role will own the strategic direction, executable roadmap and measurable outcomes for building the foundations of Machine Learning Platform will enable all of our AI developers to power our cornerstone brands like Mint, QuickBooks, and TurboTax to deliver better AI driven products. The Intuit AI product team plays a foundational role in setting the vision, strategy, and platform capability to build an end-to-end capability that makes Machine Learning accessible to everyone, with core services as the foundational capabilities we are building to connect AI with Data. Your role will consist of managing the end to end core Machine Learning Platform capabilities, including the Feature Management Platform, the ML Core Pipeline, Inference Graph, & ML Deployment Services across two awesome engineering teams. What You'll Bring 7-10 years of combined Machine Learning and Technical Product Management experience. Experience researching AI/ML industry trends and applying to product strategy & roadmap. Proven ability to partner effectively across functions with the ability to gain shared vision on challenging decisions and priority trade-offs. A proven track record of successfully implementing and evaluating deep learning and machine learning models on real-world structured and unstructured data. Strong combination of theoretical knowledge and hands-on experience in data labeling, data mining, feature selection, dimensionality reduction, statistical techniques, regression analysis,and machine learning / deep learning algorithms. Solid fundamentals with knowledge of machine learning / deep learning algorithms, classification, clustering, regression, reinforcement learning, CNN, RNN, probability theory, and algorithm design. Solid foundation of natural language processing and text analytics (BERT, BiLSTM, LDA,word2vec, doc2vec, fast text, etc.). Familiarity with Big Data frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.) and Domain Driven Design approaches to data as a product. Desired: MS or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related technical field. How You Will Lead Own the key strategy and vision of our ML Core Services portfolio, understanding the broad needs of the PD teams across AI Platform and Applied AI teams to envision and execute the creation of a core services platform that powers the unified experience for our AI developers. Create delightful product experience alongside our data product teams to connect AI and Data together building capabilities to derive data easily for analysts and data scientists in real-time and add/improve features for Machine Learning in servicing our customers. Through the understanding of ML platform capabilities and understanding user needs, create AI enabled product experiences that will empower our business to create, discover, register reusable Machine Learning features, build Machine Learning pipeline quickly and easily, manage and govern ML models through their AI implementations. Establish and manage the roadmap for key Intuit AI capabilities such as reusable ML features, ML Pipeline, ML Deployment, Inference Graph, leading trade-offs among priorities, strategic bets, and other considerations. Establish strong partnerships with key partners across Intuit to enable a durable AI Platform and reusable AI powered products. Clearly articulate Intuit AI vision, strategies, priorities, and desired outcomes with key partners across Intuit. Leverage usability studies, business and product usage data, external industry trends, and metrics to create AI enabled experiences that businesses cannot live without.

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager
jobDescription: Overview The Platform Security Engineering (PSE) team at Intuit builds foundational security capabilities that developers across Intuit use for building and running Intuit’s flagship applications leveraging cloud-native technologies in a highly scalable, reliable, secure, and compliant manner. Ease of use along with scale, reliability, security, and compliance are some of the key attributes of the platforms that this organization is responsible for. Intuit is a big believer in open source both as a consumer and as a contributor and actively participates in many open source communities, including CNCF, Istio, and GraphQL. We are on a journey to enable hyper-scale on both our systems and our development processes and are making fundamental technological shifts that will enable this journey. As a product manager responsible for Platform Security, you will help shape our shift-left strategy to enable security and compliance by default by tightly integrating security and compliance into the development processes and enabling end-to-end automation across the full stack. We are looking for candidates who have extensive product management experience building platforms at scale and a deep technical understanding of those platforms balanced with customer empathy, strong execution capability, and a track record of building strong business partnerships and delivering impactful business results. You will work with other product managers on Intuit’s overall Development Platform strategy, emphasizing platform security and compliance. You will be responsible for integrated software development security, runtime security, logging, monitoring, and technical compliance product areas. You will also help drive Intuit’s contributions to open source projects in these areas. If you understand shaping the future of large-scale operational systems and appreciate delivering secure and compliant FinTech services, then this job is for you! What You'll Bring 8+ years of product management experience in delivering world-class platform products that solve big customer needs, specifically in large-scale distributed systems and platforms with a security and compliance focus Has experience with developer and security tools and technologies in the end-to-end software development lifecycle Has a good understanding and experience in SSDLC tools and technologies (software composition analysis, static and dynamic security testing, container security, etc.) and compliance (PCI, SOX, NIST, etc.). Has experience defining, building, and delivering products on public clouds – AWS, Azure, and GCP Has a good understanding of defining and building SaaS services, products, and infrastructure at scale Has a good understanding of defining and building user experiences and flows for managing complex infrastructure products Has worked in an Agile development setting and can drive backlog grooming and prioritization Product development and technical background, either as an engineer or in a previous technical role with prior hands-on development experience or developing and presenting technical demos Proven experience in defining the product vision and inspiring teams to deliver innovations and impactful products Ability to take end-to-end responsibility for the product’s success Ability to work closely with customers and partners listening and taking a customer-focused approach to defining strategy and setting priorities demonstrating a passion for the customer Excellent collaboration and communication skills - leading execution across teams, influencing across organizations in small teams, and larger group presentation formats Undergraduate degree in computer science, electrical engineering, or a related technical discipline required or equivalent relevant experience; MBA or advanced degree preferred How You Will Lead Define and lead the vision and strategy for end-to-end platform security and compliance. Provide product thought leadership in identifying critical customer requirements and use cases, understand business goals, and define product roadmaps and KPIs Work closely with product managers, security teams, compliance managers, and development teams across Intuit to identify and address gaps in raising Intuit’s security and compliance posture through products (vendor, homegrown, and open source) to help achieve Intuit’s business objectives Effectively manage dependencies, priorities, and plans across multiple groups at Intuit focused on security and compliance towards consistent product delivery aligned towards common Intuit platform goals Take a data-driven approach in prioritizing requirements, creating and communicating plans and roadmaps, defining success metrics to deliver impactful business results Demonstrate customer obsession by being a champion for the user experience with deep customer empathy Evangelize and create broad awareness for security and compliance, and seamlessly integrating those functions into the development cycle and ecosystem with technical talks internally and with external partners Serve as a product evangelist internally and bring external-in perspectives to how Intuit builds a highly scalable, reliable, secure, compliant, reliable, and high-performance platform Actively participate in the open-source community, specifically in security engineering projects Be part of the extended product management team to contribute across the Intuit platform Be customer-obsessed, acting as the voice of developers and Intuit’s customers in creating and operationalizing world-class secure and compliant SaaS platform

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager, Capital Lending
jobDescription: Overview QuickBooks proudly serves over 7 million small business and self-employed customers. While initially started as desktop and bookkeeping software, QuickBooks has grown to provide millions of businesses with payments, capital, banking, payroll, and other financial services - moving over $200 billion in and out of businesses every year. Small businesses fuel our global economy, but the odds are stacked against them. One of two businesses fails in the first five years, and two of three fails before they turn ten. Of the most severe challenges a small business faces are managing their cash flow: balancing inflows and outflows, late customer payments, funding growth, and making payroll all while hoping there is enough left over for profit or a rainy day. QuickBooks is on a mission to change the game by providing access to services that improve business’s prospects and increase their survival rate. This Sr Product Manager will lead teams of designers, engineers, and data scientists to build out a suite of line of credit-based products, such as our Get Paid Upfront invoice financing product. You will immerse yourself in the customer problem and create new opportunities to reduce the challenges of managing cash flow by connecting the business with lending solutions at the moment of need, and ultimately enabling business operators to stay focused on running and growing their business. What You'll Bring 5+ years designing and delivering world-class products in a Product Management role 3+ years of experience working in fintech products, with a portfolio of product and feature releases that demonstrate well-crafted customer experiences across mobile and web platforms Familiarity with other financial products used to manage cash flow: lending, merchant cash advances, factoring; basic knowledge of financial industry laws and regulations Track record of setting a product vision and translating it into a roadmap and end-to-end execution Passionate about solving customer problems (the big ones and the small ones) Strong communication skills with engineering, business, design, and executive stakeholders Develops and defends strong points of view with data and analytics; comfortable with statistical analysis, and not afraid to be wrong - but adjusts rapidly to new data Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, manage trade offs, and efficiently frame and evaluate new ideas High level of professionalism, passion and a sense of urgency to “make things happen”. Bachelor’s degree A major in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical discipline a plus How You Will Lead Inform the product vision with customer-centric research, an appreciation for the fintech ecosystem and business opportunity, and then drive awareness and support throughout the QuickBooks organization Be customer-obsessed and lead the team to build delightful and seamless customer experiences Partner with our Capital Lending Platform, Risk, Underwriting, Data Science, Legal, and Compliance teams to ensure our lending products are compliant, durable through credit cycles, and serve our customers’ needs while maintaining responsible lending practices Be the domain expert for your product and drive execution on the team’s roadmap through agile engineering sprints, prioritizing between new features and customer feedback, and partnering with design to execute on customer-driven solutions Work closely with other product managers, marketers, and designers to craft simple and impactful product experiences that mesh across web and mobile platforms Collaborate with other QuickBooks ecosystem partners (e.g., QuickBooks Checking, Payroll, Payments, and Accounting) to build end-to-end delightful experiences for the customer Encourage a culture of experimentation, learning, and a growth-mindset - never settling for the status quo and innovating on the bleeding edge of what is possible Be bold and be entrepreneurial; foster a culture of innovation and impact Manage the tensions between customer, partner, and business value creation to enable sustainable and best-in-class lending solutions for SMBs, while disrupting the status quo and generating excitement for the offering

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager, Instrumentation & User Behavior Tracking
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is a global technology platform that helps our customers and communities overcome their most important financial challenges. We help give over 50 million consumers, small business, and self-employed customers around the world the opportunity to prosper. Our A2D (AI, Analytics and Data) product management team is at the forefront of transforming Intuit into an AI-driven expert platform. Our team is building the products, workflows, and methodologies that will be used to profoundly change the way we all manage our financial lives. To tackle this momentous initiative and achieve our ambitious goals, we are looking for a stellar Senior Product Manager. Our new Senior Product Manager will focus on evolving our product instrumentation platform capabilities embedded into all of our product experiences, enabling us to deeply understand how users are using our products, how we can make them better, and solve our biggest customer problems while providing them with delightful experiences. What You'll Bring Experience with building user behavior data collection capabilities (realtime, clickstream) 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager in a modern, data-driven environment. Experience in building self-serve products from scratch. Specific experience with building products for data definition, SDKs and APIs for software developers Strong ability to think through unifying elements and common denominators; dream up user workflows & interfaces; translate it all into engineering-ready user stories; and work with product designers to create a self-serve products Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and Domain Driven Design approaches to data as a product. Data driven approach for everything you do, understanding your customers, roadmap prioritization and measuring success. Ability to work in an agile fashion with your teams; go broad to go narrow; build, test, iterate. Ability to nurture various projects in parallel, in different stages of maturity and velocity. Undergraduate degree required in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related technical discipline (equivalent professional experience will be considered); advanced degree a plus How You Will Lead Deeply understand customer problems and needs leveraging follow-me-home research, usability studies, first-hand interviews, customer feedback, experiments, and usage/adoption metrics. Demonstrate strong communication and leadership skills with engineering, architecture teams, and business stakeholders. Own your product. Set a clear vision, define your roadmap and share with cross functional teams Inspire and lead your team and others to execute and deliver your vision and solutions to solve customers’ biggest problems. Ruthlessly prioritize your team’s backlog to ensure your team is making maximum customer impact. Identify, design, experiment, and iterate on product capabilities leveraging customers/end users’ feedback, behavioral customer data, and market research. Define and analyze key success metrics to support and inform product decisions. Drive product development with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact customer experiences quickly.

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview As Senior Product Manager on Mailchimp’s Core Marketing team, you will be responsible for driving marketing automations strategy and executing on it in partnership with your peers. This includes identifying customer problems, creating short and long term roadmaps and consistently assessing business impact. You will provide thought leadership and direction that drives towards our company goals and strategy and does so in collaboration with engineering, design, research, analytics and marketing. What You'll Bring We'd love to hear from you if: You have experience delivering consumer based online or software as a service (SaaS) experiences in a SCRUM / Agile environment; specific experience in delivering value-driving recommendations and insights within the context of a SaaS product preferred You have experience building automations/workflow platforms or building integrations into an app You have experience building platforms or integrating operational and data systems You have experience analyzing product data and performance trends to develop insights and influence product direction You are comfortable with SaaS pricing strategies and related data dependencies You have the ability to communicate complex and detailed information in an organized and consumable format You have the ability to build relationships, be persuasive and influential within and across immediate working groups You are highly skilled at socializing business opportunity at all levels of the organization through both compelling storytelling and written presentation You have an understanding of how to read data to analyze the performance of digital features You are capable of and comfortable with working closely with Senior and C-level executives to develop product strategy You have a strong familiarity with web technologies (coding experience not required) You have bachelor’s Degree or relevant work experience How You Will Lead What you'll do here: As a key member of the Product team, you will own a specific problem space and work cross-functionally to take a customer opportunity/problem from concept to launch, ensuring the roadmap is aligned to company vision Partner with Research to validate or assess customer expectations and perceptions Collaborate with Data Research to define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products; regularly review metrics to ensure they are tracking to goal Communicate clearly defined and achievable product goals to Design and Engineering, negotiating trade-offs and adjusting scope as needed to hit major milestones Lead product team through planning activities to identify scope for sprints; identify opportunities to validate product direction through MVPs Work collaboratively with Product Marketing and Support to define release marketing reach, effort and support impact Build, edit and manage product backlog understanding the contributive value of each feature, the level of effort, risk and opportunity costs

jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - Virtual Expert Platform - Mobile
jobDescription: Overview Come join the Virtual Expert Platform as a Senior Product Manager, where you will foster an environment of technology innovation and customer obsession. In this role, you will be a part of a team of technically minded Product Managers, co-creating to build mobile experience to enable AI-powered connections and capabilities between customers to experts across all Intuit product lines. You’ll be a part of the Intuit Virtual Expert Platform, which delivers core common capabilities for all Intuit customers and products around the world, and play a key role in driving customer benefit, growth, and long-term differentiation for the company. In joining the Intuit Platform team, you will lead the product strategy for mobile collaboration experiences for Intuit and partner closely with product managers, architects, and designers across Intuit businesses to enable awesome platform capabilities. What You'll Bring 5+ years of experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver best-in-class virtual collaboration services for customers with experience in building and scaling mobile experiences Is data-driven with a proven track record identifying product experience success measures while working with analytics teams/tools to track KPIs Excellent communication skills – both oral and written and a track record of gaining the confidence executive management An exceptional drive - applying the nuances of influencing based on the situation, knowing when to push and when to ease, driving through designs, ideas, and roadmaps Has a 'can do' attitude with an entrepreneurial mindset and be comfortable working in a fast-paced, ambiguous environments A demonstrated passion for delivering superb customer experiences Learning mindset, curious, bold, self-aware and humble Experience developing and coaching high-performance teams Technical Product Management DNA and subject matter expertise in virtual collaboration; you have spent 8+ years building world-class SaaS-based products How You Will Lead Builds and drive a bold vision for collaboration experiences with customers with a platform mindset Identifies new opportunities based on customer and competitive research, industry trends and best practices Translates vision into strategy and an execution roadmap to deliver measurable outcomes aligned to objectives Understands how to deliver platform capabilities and experiences that will be shared across multiple personas and customer archetypes Builds strong working relationships with senior end executive leaders across Intuit teams to collaborate and co-create roadmaps Consistently works to optimize the broader organization operating model (process, people, structure, partnerships) and drives change to improve Creates and maintains momentum, helping teams move forward swiftly and with rigor, a learning mindset and a bias toward action Has experience in leveraging AI to enable personalized experiences which are contextually relevant Collaborates well with product management and design leaders in creating a vision and deliverables for Intuit ecosystem experiences

you have spent 8+ years building world-class SaaS-based products How You Will Lead Builds and drive a bold vision for collaboration experiences with customers with a platform mindset Identifies new opportunities based on customer and competitive research, industry trends and best practices Translates vision into strategy and an execution roadmap to deliver measurable outcomes aligned to objectives Understands how to deliver platform capabilities and experiences that will be shared across multiple personas and customer archetypes Builds strong working relationships with senior end executive leaders across Intuit teams to collaborate and co-create roadmaps Consistently works to optimize the broader organization operating model (process, people, structure, partnerships) and drives change to improve Creates and maintains momentum, helping teams move forward swiftly and with rigor, a learning mindset and a bias toward action Has experience in leveraging AI to enable personalized experiences which are contextually relevant Collaborates well with product management and design leaders in creating a vision and deliverables for Intuit ecosystem experiences

In this role, you will be a part of a team of technically minded Product Managers, co-creating to build mobile experience to enable AI-powered connections and capabilities between customers to experts across all Intuit product lines. jobTitle: Senior Program Manager- Corporate Responsibility
jobDescription: Overview As a Senior Offering Program Manager on our job readiness team this role will be responsible for owning signature programs. Responsibilities will include, but not limited to designing, delivering, and ultimately measuring the impact of our events and programs with school districts and partners to ensure every student has equitable opportunities to build & own their futures. What You'll Bring High accountability – Develop strategy for the programs they are responsible for, driving alignment around customer problems, program offering, implementation/adoptions, resources required, and success metrics. Operational excellence - ability to drive clarity, develop program and event plans while delivering quality work with high volume of detail. Strong process and project management skills - ability to lead and work effectively across multiple priorities, drive progress against Corporate Responsibility goals and manage stakeholders at varying levels of leadership. Strong interpersonal communication skills - Comfortable communicating and partnering effectively across global organizational boundaries through multiple mechanisms – email, verbal updates, presentations, zoom, etc. Highly capable of influencing across all levels in the organization. Ability to be personable yet persistent. Organizational resourcefulness – ability to navigate complexity and thrive in a fast paced and changing environment using strong judgment and decision-making skills. Strong analytical skills - with the ability to interpret data and translate into actionable insights, recommendations, and action plans. Ability to demonstrate awareness and understanding of multiple facets of our diverse student demographic: cultural, ethnic, racial, religious, gender, educational, age, sexual orientation, linguistic, professional, and other differences that make us unique. Education/Experience Minimum 5-7 years of work experience building programs with aggressive growth and impact goals & metrics. Project & program management skills required. Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required Education organization experience or related fields are preferred. How you will leadReporting to the Job Readiness Group Product Manager, the Senior Offering Program manager is responsible for owning our in-person and virtual programs and events which include: Ideation, program/event design & build, execution, measure and assess student impact and more. Specific role responsibilities include, but not limited to: Strategic thought partnership in developing program strategies that summarize customer problems, program solutions, implementation/adoption plan, resourcing requirements, and success metrics Develop and manage workback plan and cross-functional timelines, detailed project plans, and workstream requirements; act as the single source of truth for all stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle Demonstrate measurable impact metrics based on the goals outlined for each experience. Demonstrate alignment with overall business objectives. Use post-event analytics and data to inform recommendations for programs and events Optimize event infrastructure by designing event templates and playbooks to create scalable and repeatable processes to increase speed, efficiency and impact Effectively influence partners and vendors to deliver against competing event schedules/priorities and play a key role in day-to-day operations and execution Provide support and resources for employee volunteers, students, and educators Collaborate cross functionally with Talent Acquisition, Enterprise Resource Group leaders, Marketing, Communications, and Employee Volunteerism.

jobTitle: Senior Program Manager-Global Sustainability
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is a global technology platform that helps consumers and small businesses overcome their most important financial challenges. Serving more than 100 million customers worldwide, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to prosper. We never stop working to find new, innovative ways to make that possible. We believe diversity and inclusion among our teammates produces better results and is critical to our success as a global company. Intuit’s mission to power prosperity around the world includes taking care of our planet. In 2019, we set a decade-long goal to reduce global carbon emissions by 2 million metric tonnes (MT) by 2030. We’re working outside of our own operational footprint and using our scale and resources to empower our employees, customers, and communities to join us in our commitment. The Global Sustainability - Communities Lead will be responsible for developing and implementing the carbon reduction strategy for Intuit’s Communities program, including implementing initiatives, programs, and strategic partnerships to ensure both short-term and long-term goals are achieved, and tangible impact is generated. This position will report to Intuit’s Head of Global Sustainability. What You'll Bring Subject matter expert in the sustainability space with particular focus on carbon reduction strategies, industry trends, employee engagement, environmental justice and social impact Can develop strategy for the programs they are responsible for, driving alignment around program offering, implementation/adoptions, resources required, and success metrics. Able to navigate complexity and thrive in a fast paced and changing environment using strong judgment and decision-making skills. Accomplished partner and program management skills that ensure tangible outcomes Highly capable of influencing across all levels in the organization. Ability to be personable yet persistent. Can build trust across teams and generate broad support for programs and projects Exceptional analytical acumen, bias towards data-driven analysis and decision-making Open and highly collaborative, ability to partner well with multiple cross-functional teams and external partners in the corporate, nonprofit and government sectors Comfortable communicating effectively across global organizational boundaries through multiple mechanisms – email, verbal updates, presentations, zoom, etc. Education/Experience Minimum 5-7 years of work experience building and scaling sustainability programs with impact goals & metrics. Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required. How You Will Lead Ownership and execution of Intuit’s Climate Positive commitment - Communities Pillar strategy (short term and long term) including roadmaps, input goals, output metrics, prioritization, and impact. Supervise internal and external partners and other resources as needed. Analyze, establish, and prioritize partnership opportunities based on potential, relevance, impact, and ability to scale. Work to ensure opportunities for meaningful employee engagement with Climate Positive programs are evaluated and implemented frequently across the organization. Identify and influence relevant executives and decision-makers to achieve outcomes. Communicate Intuit’s sustainability efforts through high-impact, data-driven and inspirational narratives, and presentations.

jobTitle: Senior Risk & Security Analyst
jobDescription: Overview Come join the “Intuit Information Security Team” as a “Senior Security & Risk Analyst” for the Eco-system Fraud Prevention (EFP) Team. We are developing cutting edge data protection and fraud prevention capabilities. The security of Intuit’s operations, the trust and confidence instilled in Intuit’s stakeholders are of paramount importance to our customers and our organization. We are seeking a candidate who is a data-driven individual with excellent quantitative, and analytical skills, and a passion for delivering data-driven insights to manage and quantify risks. In this role, you will be primarily responsible for performing the security risk assessments within the EFP organization. You will apply and leverage security principles along with business processes to secure customer data and sensitive account information. In partnership with cross-functional teams including customer success, enterprise security, data science, compliance, legal and business unit product teams, you will synthesize business objectives and security data protection requirements to align on priorities across the Cybercraft portfolio and coordinate across organizations for execution. Strong risk management skills, security domain expertise, knowledge of data analytical skills. These capabilities are key for the EFP organization to partner effectively and efficiently in service of delivering on strategy, core priorities and annual goals. This position requires strong analysis, excellent communication, and the ability to manage high impact work on short deadlines. What You'll Bring Strong knowledge of risk management, information technology best practices, security/privacy/compliance requirements, standards, and frameworks/regulations such as NIST, ISO, FAIR, CCPA. Five or more years of experience in conducting security assessments in business process controls, fraud risks, IT risk management, and compliance related work. Professional certifications in one or more of the following areas required: CRISC, CISSP, CIPP, and/or SANS cyber risk management Experience in developing analysis and dashboards to identify and analyze risks using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Splunk, SQL, and enterprise risk management tools such as Service Now, Archer, etc. Develop and maintain security risk and response artifacts to produce metrics that can measure the overall risk management maturity and progress Strong team player with energy, enthusiasm, detail orientation to produce high quality deliverables and developing persuasive presentations in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to present complex ideas in clear concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences Master’s Degree in Computer Science / Information Security / Cybersecurity / Risk Management / Analytics, related field required, or equivalent work experience How You Will Lead Partner with Product Managers, Business System Analysts, Engineering and other groups in Enterprise Security and Customer Success organization to understand what products are being worked on, what risks are involved, and what security controls need to be implemented to detect or prevent security fraud Lead security risk assessments of Intuit's ecosystem, platforms, and products as it relates to data security, access management, fraud detection/prevention and recommend controls commensurate with the risks identified, develop mitigation plans, and work with internal stakeholders to mitigate the risks Demonstrate ability to balance between strategic initiatives and tactical activities required to run information risk response and remediation efforts. Create dashboards to quantify the impact of risks, monitor KRIs, and identify opportunities for improvement; Identify emerging security and fraud trends and design new security/fraud controls Responsible for providing data analysis that helps to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risks that surface Intuit’s ecosystem to resolution Strong knowledge of security controls for multiple security domains including access management, data loss prevention, encryption methods, network security, and endpoint security Build strong relationships and become a trusted advisor within BU and technology owners to influence change and drive ownership and accountability Support the design and implementation of risk management program

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer, ANDROID
jobDescription: Overview Our focus is all about building stuff and less on politics, barriers, and titles. We are a small passionate team but get the full benefits of the bigger Intuit. Intuit Teams Small Business and Self Employed Group: Our teams work with many of our small business products and we pride ourselves on being the champion of those who dare to dream. We believe in designing for delight, keeping our customer top of mind, and we aren't afraid to try and fail as long as it ends in success to our customers! Intuit Platform: We are the technology community that aims to delight customers through product & operational excellence, power our vision with One Intuit Services Platform and accelerate with One Intuit Developer Platform. Consumer Group: Is focused on innovation and impacting our customer’s financial lives so profoundly they would never go back to the old way. Key Platforms and product offerings: Virtual Expert Platforms ( QuickBooks Live, TurboTax Live and Mint Live), Core TurboTax Platform, Turbo & Mint Platforms, Go-To-Market & Experimentation Platforms Required Experience What you'll bring 5+ years experience developing web, software, or mobile applications 2+ years experience with Kotlin BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience 3+ years experience in the Software design/architecture process Strong experience with Android SDK Experience with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) 5+ years experience with web services (consuming or creating) with REST or SOAP Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences Experience with unit testing & Test Driven Development (TDD) Preferred Experience Experience developing, maintaining, and innovating large scale, consumer facing web or mobile applications Experience with social, mobile, cloud/SaaS, big data, or analytics Familiar with the development challenges inherent with highly scalable and available web applications Always Be Learning: Experience with open source technologies (if no practical work experience w/ Big Data, or cutting edge front-end technology—you’re prototyping and/or researching the up and coming technology and solutions Experience with various, modern web frameworks What We're Looking For How you will lead You take pride in creating Android magic Deep customer empathy and ability to quickly translate insights into mockups, wireframes, and working proof-of-concept code Expertise in quickly translating design (Adobe illustrator, Photoshop, PDF, PNGs) in to working Android code Ability to mock out server side dependencies to move fast. Knowledge of server side development processes, tools, and technology is a huge plus

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit’s CX3 Performance, Reliability and Optimization Engineering (PROE) team as a Sr Software Engineer. PROE works to ensure that TurboTax.com and other Intuit products are highly available, scale without bottlenecks, and offer world-class performance. The team is looking for “full cycle” Software Engineers with a passion for optimization and reliability work. If you want to learn how to solve enterprise-scale engineering problems, like automating everything and making systems that scale and never fail, come see us. What You'll Bring Excellent communication and presentation skills BS/MS in Computer Science; or equivalent work experience Experience coding in Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, or Kotlin Experience developing applications and services using Kubernetes, Docker, Spring, React, HTML/DOM, CSS, NoSQL Technologies like Cassandra, Dynamo, Redis Experience or interest in learning how to make services more robust through usage of Hystrix and circuit breaker patterns Experience creating applications that operate in AWS, utilizing native AWS services when appropriate, and building stacks using CloudFormation Experience with of collaborative software development using GitHub Knowledge of software development methodologies and practices such as Agile/Iterative development, test-driven development, and load testing Reviewable open-source contributions would be a plus How You Will Lead Designing and developing web applications and backend services in Java, Python, Go, or JavaScript Continuously working to improve the scalability and UI response times of TurboTax Owning the quality, reliability, and performance of our applications and services, including production on-call support shifts, construction of monitoring solutions, improving deployment automation, etc. Automating everything, then do whatever else it takes to make sure our systems are bulletproof and super-fast, such as upgrading existing services with Hystrix or building in canary release automation Creating reusable libraries and patterns in an open-source contribution model Supporting and coaching other engineers, pair programming or peer reviewing code, helping to ensure that all engineers are growing and part of a community Helping us with our mission of getting a pull request to production quickly and automatically while maintaining the highest operational standards Driving root cause analysis (RCA) and risk management processes Driving ongoing improvements and efficiencies in operational practices, tools & processes BU and Intuit-wide

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer, Big Data
jobDescription: Overview The Intuit Data Engineering team is looking for a Sr Software Engineer, Big Data with a winning track record in Big Data and Distributed Systems. We’re using data in groundbreaking ways to uncover customer insights, personalize customer experiences through AI/ML, and provide a unified customer view across all Intuit products. Note: By applying to this position, your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, Los Angeles, San Diego and the following teams at Intuit. What You'll Bring BS in Computer Science. MS Preferred. Strong CS fundamentals including data structures, algorithms and distributed systems. Strong database fundamentals including SQL, performance and schema design. 5+ years of strong Object Oriented Programming (Java, Scala, or Python) 5+ years of hands-on Software Engineering experience. 5+ years of experience integrating technical processes and business outcomes – specifically: data and process analysis, data quality metrics/monitoring, data architecture, developing policies/standards & supporting processes. Strong project leadership experience, including being a technical lead for multiple complex software development projects using agile methodologies. Experience in people management or interest in people management is a plus. Experience with Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, Kafka, Storm, Druid, Cassandra, Columnar Databases and Graph Databases. 1+ years working with Cloud Technologies. Experience with various offerings from AWS, including S3, EMR, Redshift, Data Pipeline, Athena and Kinesis is a plus. History of contributing to open source projects is a plus. Track record working with data from multiple sources – willingness to dig-in and understand the data and to leverage creative thinking and problem-solving. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including business writing and presentations. Ability to communicate objectives, plans, status and results clearly, focusing on critical few key points. Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment, ability to influence at all levels, and build strong relationships. Knowledge of enacting service level agreements and the appropriate escalation and communication plans to maintain them. How You Will Lead Design and develop big data and real-time analytics solutions using industry standard technologies. Develop web services that make big data available in real-time for in-product applications. Work with data architects to ensure that Big Data solutions are aligned with company-wide technology directions. Lead fast moving development teams using agile methodologies. Lead by example, demonstrating best practices for unit testing, CI/CD, performance testing, capacity planning, documentation, monitoring, alerting, and incident response. Communicate progress across organizations and levels from individual contributor to senior executive. Identify and clarify the critical few issues that need action and drive appropriate decisions and actions. Communicate results clearly and in actionable form. Serve as technical “go to” person for our core technologies – Hadoop, Spark, AWS, Vertica, Tableau, Cassandra, Graph Databases and others. Demonstrate strong implementation aptitude to translate objectives into a scalable solution to meet the needs of the end customer while meeting deadlines. Demonstrate commitment to your professional development by attending conferences, taking classes, giving technical presentations, and participating in developer communities inside and outside of Intuit.

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer - Front End
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is the global leader in financial management software where we have pioneered the shift to Virtual Platforms, cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. Intuit acts as a 35 year old startup, and we are constantly disrupting ourselves as we identify major new technology and design trends that are needed to deliver our mission to power prosperity around the world. Our groups are fast-paced teams focused on delivering innovative capabilities, and having fun while doing it. Note: By applying to this position, your application will be automatically submitted for the following locations: Mountain View, San Diego and the following teams at Intuit. What You'll Bring Required Experience: 5+ years professional experience developing web, software, or mobile applications 3+ years experience with JavaScript and React BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience 3+ years experience in the Software design/architecture process Strong experience with HTML and CSS Experience with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) 5+ years experience with web services (consuming or creating) with REST or SOAP Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences Strong understanding of the Software design/architecture process Experience with unit testing & Test Driven Development (TDD) Preferred Experience Experience developing, maintaining, and innovating large scale, consumer facing web or mobile applications Experience with social, mobile, cloud/SaaS, big data, or analytics Familiar with the development challenges inherent with highly scalable and available web applications Always Be Learning: Experience with open source technologies (if no practical work experience w/ Big Data, or cutting edge front-end technology—you’re prototyping and/or researching the up and coming technology and solutions Experience with various, modern web frameworks How You Will Lead What we're looking for: You take pride in creating Front End magic Deep customer empathy and ability to quickly translate insights into mockups, wireframes, and working proof-of-concept code Expertise in the successful delivery of high quality web application code (requirements, design, code, documentation, etc.) Contribute to overall site stability, including code reviews, writing unit and integration tests

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer- Frontend
jobDescription: Overview Intuit’s Adversary Management team is seeking a Senior Software Engineer that specializes in delivering web-based services. Our mission is to build multi-channel experiences that deliver insights about Intuit’s attack surface and how it is being attacked, to accelerate Intuit’s ability to make informed risk decisions that ensure we keep our customers data secure. The Ideal Candidate Is Strategic problem solver with a passion for solving customer needs through storytelling and design. Enjoys working in a fast paced and agile environment. Drives strategy and vision. Ability for Rapid experimentation, and cloud knowledge is a must. What You'll Bring 5+ years of hands-on full stack software engineering experience in a micro service architecture 5+ years of development experience with Python and React; JavaScript and Ruby are a plus. Hands-on experience with AWS (including CloudFormation, S3, CloudWatch, EC2, Lambda, Batch, Database services) Experience working in a container-based environment (EKS, Fargate, Kubernetes, etc.) 3+ years of API development experience Broad knowledge of web standards relating to APIs and webservices (REST, SOAP, XML, WSDL, HTTP, JSON, etc.) Strong understanding of both relational and NoSQL databases Experience researching, designing, implementing, and testing highly scalable, reusable UI components, web applications and web services Demonstrated familiarity with enterprise security integration (SSO, code-scanning, etc) Hands on experience with automation & pipeline implementation (Testing, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery pipeline) for enterprise applications Experience with GCP, including GCS, Big Query, Data Studio Experience with GraphDB and visualization is a plus Experience with Agile Development, SCRUM, GIST and/or Extreme Programming development methodologies is a plus BS/MS in Computer Science or verifiable equivalent experience is preferred. How You Will Lead Design/Develop custom services that deliver insights about adversary activity against Intuit’s ecosystem. Seamlessly weave large amounts of security data into an easy-to-understand story through design and data organization. Work with customers to understand their problems and gather requirements to develop technical solutions from prototype to implementation. Ability to properly level and clearly communicate a technical solution, architecture, or a plan. Help develop a long-term vision and strategy for experiences. Mentor junior members of the team through constructive feedback of code and service architecture. Strong implementation aptitude to translate objectives into a scalable solution to meet the needs of the end customer while meeting deadlines. Work cross-functionally within Adversary Management organization as well as teams across Intuit: Architecture, Product Management, product development, and business unit security teams to drive forward results. Roughly 70-85% hands-on coding.

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small businesses. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaign, CRM, and analytics tools. The Audience Infrastructure team is looking for experienced engineers to help us own user Audience data across Mailchimp. In 2023, the team is expanding to support a JVM-enabled project architecture (with an emphasis on Kotlin and Spring Boot). We’re looking for engineers who have a professional history with a related stack, experience with data modeling in a large application, and who can solve problems across legacy and net-new codebases. You can expect to own the implementation of the team’s technical vision and empower other engineers on the team. This role will have a strong focus on collaboration with other squads and teams throughout the company, and you will serve as a representative for our group in cross-departmental projects. Mailchimp has a flexible approach to work. We have offices in Atlanta, Brooklyn, and Oakland. This role would provide you with both in office and work from home opportunities. You should be comfortable with distributed teams (as you’ll work with folks in other locations), and excited about building a strong, inclusive environment for everyone who joins after you. At Mailchimp, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We don’t just accept differences, we celebrate them, support them, and hire peeps from a wide variety of backgrounds because it makes our company stronger. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience aligns with what we’re looking for (even if you don’t check every single box), please consider applying! What You'll Bring We'd love to hear from you if: You have 3 or more years of experience building and operating large web applications and extensive experience working within large-scale development environments You’re experienced in designing and implementing application architectures and code that are highly scalable, available, maintainable, and performant You’re as comfortable working with and improving upon legacy systems and code as you are building new features and microservices You’ve developed strong core programming skills in a language, but believe in identifying the right tool for the job, and are passionate about embracing new technologies when the opportunity arises You have significant experience writing and improving code in Kotlin, or another language that utilizes the JVM (Java or Scala, for instance), and have experience with Spring Boot You have working knowledge of cloud computing platforms, ideally Amazon Web Services (AWS) You have experience modeling data, and are thoughtful about the impacts of data design in a large application You have strong communication and collaboration skills Pluses, But Not Requirements, Include You have experience building in and working with modern, object-oriented PHP and/or Go What You'll Do How you will lead Help to set the technical direction to meet team needs, and own implementation and design of that vision Spearhead efforts to establish patterns and processes, and lead the team through examples in your own work Develop new and enhance existing features as well as investigate and resolve defects Empower team members by providing technical guidance and mentorship Remain up-to-date on evolving tools and patterns for managing infrastructure, guiding our implementation of them when necessary Help scope, estimate, and prioritize work Embrace and demonstrate our values: humility, creativity, and independence

What You'll Bring We'd love to hear from you if: You have 3 or more years of experience building and operating large web applications and extensive experience working within large-scale development environments You’re experienced in designing and implementing application architectures and code that are highly scalable, available, maintainable, and performant You’re as comfortable working with and improving upon legacy systems and code as you are building new features and microservices You’ve developed strong core programming skills in a language, but believe in identifying the right tool for the job, and are passionate about embracing new technologies when the opportunity arises You have significant experience writing and improving code in Kotlin, or another language that utilizes the JVM (Java or Scala, for instance), and have experience with Spring Boot You have working knowledge of cloud computing platforms, ideally Amazon Web Services (AWS) You have experience modeling data, and are thoughtful about the impacts of data design in a large application You have strong communication and collaboration skills Pluses, But Not Requirements, Include You have experience building in and working with modern, object-oriented PHP and/or Go What You'll Do How you will lead Help to set the technical direction to meet team needs, and own implementation and design of that vision Spearhead efforts to establish patterns and processes, and lead the team through examples in your own work Develop new and enhance existing features as well as investigate and resolve defects Empower team members by providing technical guidance and mentorship Remain up-to-date on evolving tools and patterns for managing infrastructure, guiding our implementation of them when necessary Help scope, estimate, and prioritize work Embrace and demonstrate our values: humility, creativity, and independence

jobTitle: Senior Software Engineer (Mailchimp)
jobDescription: Overview Mailchimp is a leading marketing platform for small businesses. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of marketing automation, multichannel campaigns, CRM, and analytics tools. Mailchimp Databridge is a new group at Mailchimp focused on building an inter-product bidirectional data exchange pipeline. Streaming data architecture, microservices and integrating functionality across multiple consumer platforms, cloud infrastructure, delivery pipeline automation, we are looking for a Senior level engineer to help us build it. You can expect to set the team’s technical direction, spearhead efforts to establish patterns and processes, and lead the team through examples in your own work. You will collaborate with teams throughout the company and represent our group in cross-departmental projects. At Mailchimp, we value learning, collaboration and clarity. You’ll find success here if you enjoy writing code, but you're aware that your job isn't only about shipping: you are a welcoming contributor who knows how to communicate with your team in order to build great software. You prefer using proven technologies to solve interesting new problems. You've broken production environments—and then buckled down, fixed them and maybe you held a blameless post-mortem about it! You should be comfortable with distributed teams (as you’ll work with many folks in other locations), and also excited about building a strong, inclusive environment for everyone who joins after you. As we have several openings across a few of our teams, if this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you! Mailchimp has a flexible approach to work. We have offices in Atlanta, Brooklyn, and Oakland. This role would provide you with both in office and work from home opportunities. What You'll Bring GCP and/or AWS Coding experience in Go, Java, JVM based languages that can be demonstrated through a portfolio of code Building, maintaining CI/CD pipeline including e2e flow Kafka, Pub/Sub messaging How You Will Lead Help to set the technical direction to meet Databridge messaging needs and challenges, and own implementation, and design of that vision Establish patterns and processes, and lead the team through examples in your own work Develop new and enhance existing features as well as investigate and resolve defects Empower team members by providing technical guidance and mentorship Help scope, estimate, and prioritize work Embrace and demonstrate our values: humility, creativity, and independence

jobTitle: Senior Support Operations Analyst
jobDescription: Overview Come join the Intuit Customer Success Real-Time Operations team. As a Seasonal Operations Analyst you will be supporting Intuit experiences by monitoring contact center service level performance across a geographically diverse workforce, responding quickly to correct performance issues, and working tactically to deliver awesome results for our experts and customers. What You'll Bring 3+ years contact center experience in a supervisory or operational role Working knowledge of contact center queue management systems (Amazon Connect, Avaya, Interactive Intelligence, etc.) Working knowledge of contact center workforce management systems (Aspect eWFM, Nice IEX, etc.) Industry knowledge and experience managing contact center KPI’s (AHT, ABN, ASA, etc.) Strong and demonstrated MS Excel experience (formulas, pivot tables/reporting, macros) Excellent attention to detail Solid, professional team player Flexibility with work schedule to cover business hours is a must Ability to think and act in a fast-paced environment with a bias for action Professional oral, written, and presentation communication skills How You Will Lead Monitor/manage real-time and intra-day customer contact queue performance (Service Levels, Contacts Offered/Handled, Average Handle Time, Average Speed of Answer, etc.) and agent performance (Occupancy, Shrinkage, Schedule Adherence) in a fast-paced, global Customer Success environment Assist in identifying issues that negatively impact customer/expert experiences, take corrective action, and work closely with partner teams to resolve Perform as part of a team to update/manage agent staffing, contact channels, queue performance, and other operational actions Work closely with Operations leadership and contact centers worldwide to drive business results Other duties as assigned

jobTitle: Senior Technical Compliance Analyst
jobDescription: Overview Come join the Intuit Information Security Organization at Intuit! We are looking for an innovative professional to join a world class team. The Intuit Information Security (IIS) organization is changing the way we look at security and compliance. As the compliance landscape expands with ISO 27001, GDPR, NIST, etc., our need to scale to demonstrate compliance is becoming more critical within our internal environment as well as with our third parties. We are looking for a motivated, passionate Senior Security Risk and Compliance Analyst who will be the central point of contact in ensuring all Third-Party Security requirements are met. The professional is responsible for TPRM risk and control processes that will enable and drive consistency in risk management across all business divisions and provide a consolidated view of third-party. In this role, the TPRA will be responsible of the execution of reviews for all aspects of the third-party risk management life cycle for new and existing vendors. This will include assessments, due diligence reviews, collecting required documentation, coordination of SLA monitoring, and tracking of issues. Intuit prides itself on being innovative, bold, and passionate. This is an exciting position supporting our most important regulatory compliance like GDPR, PCI, ISO and NIST company priorities as we transform to a cloud environment. This passionate Senior Security Risk and Compliance has the opportunity to innovate in a cloud environment and re-imagine the TPRM program by working across Intuit and with the business units as well as our functional group partners in IT, Legal, Privacy and Procurement. What You'll Bring Candidate must have 4+ years working in Governance, Risk and Compliance including a focus on Third Party Risk Management Knowledge of the third-party management lifecycle and its overall business processes, controls, and risk exposure (e.g., third party identification, selection, management, termination), and applicable laws and regulations Understanding of third-party risks and management practices at financial services institutions Strong knowledge and experience with operational risk management, covering the full lifecycle of activities, including risk identification, assessment, mitigation, monitoring, and reporting. Understanding of regulatory requirements and expectations related to third party risk management. Understanding AI Risk Assessment for 3rd Party Engagement for AI/ML Solutions Functional knowledge of security domains and information security industry standard and best practices Functional knowledge of security regulatory requirements (CCPA, GDPR, PCI, NIST SP 800-53, ISO 27001, SOC 1/2) Demonstrated experience with controls definition, development, implementation, and assessment Knowledge of Cloud security, Cloud Security certification is a plus Ability to identify and recommend tools, processes, and software to automate and continuously improve security and compliance practices A self-motivated person who can influence and drive cross-functional, cross-geo teams, promoting timely and effective communication Exceptional Program Management Skills: how to plan, set and manage to reasonable timelines, while delivering projects that align to the business strategy and priorities Provide the leadership and direction to create the environment that motivates a bright and technically diverse organization Ability to operate in a highly matrixed environment Drive, determination, and the ability to overcome roadblocks and initial objections. Ability to be flexible and adapt in a fast paced and frequently changing environment Proven analytical abilities and using data/facts for decision-making Third Party Risk Management certifications is a plus How You Will Lead Perform complex risk assessments of current and prospective third-party business to assess their control structure and alignment to regulatory, federal/state guidelines and bank requirements and partner with internal stakeholders to assess the residual risk the third party presents to the company Manage residual risk treatment and any identified security issues through the appropriate risk remediation or risk acceptance workflows Lead automation and drive end to end remediation of risk reported via existing operating procedures/metrics/dashboards to ensure compliance with corporate security policies and alignment to best practices across industry Determine how to leverage other third-party technology such as AWS Audit Manager to improve and scale risk assessment Act as Third-Party Security domain expert to support supplemental consulting and guidance for cross functional security team and business partners Continuously execute the vision and drive the maturation of the third-party risk program to support the Information Security Organization’s strategic objectives Participate in periodic Legal contract reviews as needed to assure that appropriate clauses exist that support the organization’s right to audit the security practices of its third parties Work with the Third-Party Risk Management team (TPRM) team to support continuous improvement of the entire vendor lifecycle Support the TPRM team and serve as a third-party security representative during vendor escalation. Collaborate with TPRM team, legal and security teams on vendor engagement requiring supplemental security assessment or requirements Manage deliverables incorporated into various Third-Party Security maturity initiatives and work with partners to implement program improvements Oversee continuous improvement of the vendor security risk assessment process in place to support informed decision making around current and prospective third-party suppliers Work cross-functionally with Privacy teams to align supplier security assessment efforts to meet regulatory requirements for the protection of Intuit employee and customer data accessed by third parties Develop and monitor KPIs, metrics, holistic reporting, and management dashboards Coordinate obtaining requested documentation and responding to requests during regulatory examinations of the assigned compliance focus areas(s) by federal regulators or other internal or external auditors Collaborate with teams to ensure compliance with audit standards, close audit finding Monitor changes to the regulatory frameworks and landscape and recommend policy changes that will help the business be proactive in maintaining compliance
