jobTitle: Staff Software Engineer - Front End
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is the global leader in financial management software where we have pioneered the shift to Virtual Platforms, cloud computing for consumers, small businesses and those that serve them. Intuit acts as a 35 year old startup, and we are constantly disrupting ourselves as we identify major new technology and design trends that are needed to deliver our mission to power prosperity around the world. Our groups are fast-paced teams focused on delivering innovative capabilities, and having fun while doing it. Note: By applying to this position, your application will be automatically submitted for the following locations: Mountain View, San Diego and the following teams at Intuit. What You'll Bring Required Experience: 8+ years experience developing web, software, or mobile applications 3+ years experience with JavaScript and React BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience Expertise with HTML and CSS 5+ years experience in the Software design/architecture process Experience with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) 5+ years experience with web services (consuming or creating) with REST or SOAP Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences Strong understanding of the Software design/architecture process Experience with unit testing & Test Driven Development (TDD) Preferred Experience Experience developing, maintaining, and innovating large scale, consumer facing web or mobile applications Experience with social, mobile, cloud/SaaS, big data, or analytics Familiar with the development challenges inherent with highly scalable and available web applications Always Be Learning: Experience with open source technologies (if no practical work experience w/ Big Data, or cutting edge front-end technology—you’re prototyping and/or researching the up and coming technology and solutions Experience with various, modern web frameworks How You Will Lead What we're looking for: You take pride in creating Front End magic Deep customer empathy and ability to quickly translate insights into mockups, wireframes, and working proof-of-concept code Expertise as the technical subject matter expert: Mentoring fellow engineers, demonstrating technical expertise, and leading a small team solving challenging programming and design problems Ability to Work cross-functionally with various Intuit teams including: product management, QA/QE, and business units to drive forward results

jobTitle: Staff Software Engineer Global Tax Development
jobDescription: Overview Come join the "Global Tax Development" team as a "Staff Engineer". IF you enjoy applying your problem solving and engineering techniques to unblock over 100 employees onto Global Tax Platform, this job is for you! What You'll Bring 6+ years’ experience designing and developing desktop and online applications BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience Expertise with any of the following Object-Oriented Languages (OOD): Java/J2EE, C#, VB.NET, Python, or sometimes C++ Strong leadership experience: Leading meetings, presenting, technical go to person, and cross-functional leader Expertise with the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Excellent communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences Expertise with unit testing & Test-Driven Development (TDD) Business Acumen - strategic thinking & strategy development Building strong teams - set and evangelize vision, facilitative leadership, attract and retain key talent How You Will Lead Strategic planning and orchestration of onboarding the GTD org to paved roads in service to accelerating the adoption of platform technologies Gain deep understanding of Tax Content requirements and blockers, and coordinate with tools engineering teams to unblock Tax Development teams in service to higher velocity and quality Acting as the technical subject matter expert: Mentoring fellow engineers, and tax developers with software best practices Generate technical documentation and PowerPoint presentations to communicate architectural and design options and educate Tax development teams Work cross-functionally with various Intuit teams including product management, QA/QE, various product lines, and/or business units to drive forward results Demonstrate a passion for developing well architected, elegant, web and/or mobile apps Experience with Agile Development, and SCRUM frameworks and methodologies

jobTitle: Staff Technical Compliance Manager
jobDescription: Overview We are looking for a Data Governance Lead to lead Intuit’s Data Engineering Data Governance program and manage all activities for data engineering including coordinating the protection, security, and compliance of sensitive data and information assets. The position will focus on establishing and ensuring adherence to Intuit’s enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards and practices to achieve the level of security and privacy required to meet our overall regulatory and business needs. What You'll Bring 6+ years in a technical role (software engineering, data architect, data engineering, technical analyst, etc.). 4+ years of data compliance, governance, and data privacy experience. Proven ability to work with business and analytics leaders to identify and align on workable business solutions to data privacy requirements and challenges. Ability to successfully champion the role of data governance in data privacy forums. A deep understanding of government regulatory requirements (e.g. GDPR,CCPA, CCPR, 7216) and emerging trends and issues. Knowledge of data governance practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets and approaches related to data protection. Acute attention to detail, a strong sense of accountability, collaboration and understanding of large scale cloud data platform infrastructure. Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and security concepts, including managing compliance requirements against distributed applications on cloud infrastructure. This role is remote with 10% travel expected. How You Will Lead Establish a clear and aligned roadmap across all aspects of Data Governance (DG) for data engineering by establishing a strong partnership with Legal, the Security office, and other DG teams to better anticipate upcoming plans and changes. Develop a holistic view of known Data Governance gaps with remediation plans by partnering with the Data Governance Architect and Engineering Development managers to understand current and target states. Serve as the face of compliance to data engineering, creating new engineering compliance frameworks when required. Deliver standardized and scalable solutions that identify and mitigate risks including data retention, data trust, privacy, security, access, use, and compliance in partnership with the Data Governance Architect. Collaborate with the security and compliance teams to ensure policies reflect feasible outcomes for the Data Engineering organization. Advise and guide data engineering teams on data policies and processes covering data usage, security, privacy, and compliance. Assist in compliance audits and identify and inventory issues, suggested improvements, and aid in tracking and implementing fixes. Create and implement compliance processes to ensure security controls are met with regards to user access management.

jobTitle: Staff Technical Program Manager
jobDescription: Overview Come join the Small Business Group - Product Development, as a Staff Technical Program Manager for QuickBooks Accountant. The SBG Product PMO’s Mission is to accelerate the outcomes of the SBG Product organizations by driving for clarity among chaos and uniting cross-functional teams to operate with velocity. What You'll Bring Strong Program Management team leadership experience, including 5 or more years leading multiple complex software-as-a-service (Saas) development projects. Excellent influencing skills. Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment and ability to influence at all levels and build strong partnerships across organizations in delivering the best outcome of complex programs. Outstanding communication skills appropriate for executive-level audiences visually communicating goals of program, relationship to business goals, and other relevant success criteria. Good understanding of SaaS technologies or demonstrated ability to collaborate with engineering teams on complex technology programs with Kanban, Agile and Scrum development methodologies. How You Will Lead Portfolio Connect the dots across various programs within a portfolio to simplify the ‘why/what/how’ Partner with the Portfolio Leadership Team to unblock/guide program teams’ delivery Identify and/or simplify portfolio level processes enabling the org to operate smoothly Program Develop a program structure and drive a program operating rhythm to bring together complex, cross-organizational teams. Drive creation of program roadmaps and execution plans across all phases of planning, development, and production readiness and launch. Collaborate with key stakeholders in executive teams, product management & engineering, and various cross-functional teams to effectively drive towards program outcomes. Quickly and effectively, identify and clarify the critical issues and dependencies that need action and drive them through to closure. Communicate results clearly and in actionable form. Effectively balance business needs versus technical constraints. Communicate progress across the organization and at all levels; includes program status, risks, dependencies and change control. General Thrive in establishing order and clarity amongst ambiguity and chaos. Work well with others when conflicts arise, with ability to influence others to work towards desired outcomes. Anticipate, recognize, and work through resistance or setbacks independently.

jobTitle: Strategic Partner Manager
jobDescription: Overview Intuit is a leading provider of business and financial management solutions for small and mid-sized businesses, self-employed entrepreneurs, consumers, and accounting professionals. You probably know us by our flagship products, QuickBooks, Credit Karma, TurboTax, and Mint, but that's just the start. We're taking on exciting challenges, and our strategy is to be an AI-driven expert platform to deliver personalized experiences to our customers to improve their financial lives. Over 50 million consumers and seven million small businesses depend on Intuit because we innovate at the crossroads of real customer problems and breakthrough technology. Partner Manager Intuit is looking for someone to be part of a team that is redefining partner management. Your responsibilities will include building strong relationships with our named strategic Financial Institution partners, Inuit data team, product engineering, security and risk teams and sales and finance teams ensuring holistic alignment of the Intuit wide strategy and vision for our key FI partners. You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions. Your broad responsibilities will include executing Partner activities that accelerate Intuit Big Bets, establishing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these organizations to mitigate partner risk, build resiliency and scalability and drive partner fueled innovation and value opportunities. You will be expected to have a holistic view of the Partner ecosystem and a deep understanding of the partner portfolio, capabilities, and solutions. What You'll Bring Strategic Problem Solving Problem solving ability and experience in aligning cross-functional teams toward common objectives to increase program ROI. Comfortable with ambiguity, ability to quickly analyze and execute in a rapidly changing environment, take charge, and make things happen. Operational Excellence Has used an understanding of strategy, business, and operational performance to improve operations in a way that delivers program innovation and scalability. Ability to generate innovative insights, ideas, and opportunities that help advance the business and the program. Lead a diverse team of stakeholders while remaining organized and productive in a fast-paced environment. Ownership and Influence Highly independent and self-motivated with the ability to proactively seek out solutions and opportunities. Strong ability to influence and collaborate, as success will be measured by ability to influence situations where no prior formal authority existed, balancing empathy for different voices and pushing teams beyond their comfort zone to drive step change in performance and execution rigor. Track record of taking extreme ownership in driving to decisions and outcomes. Change Leadership Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as experience working across internal and external organizations. Exceptional analytical, organizational, project management, and communication skills, with ability to craft and deliver C-level presentations and captivate an audience. Ability to lead across boundaries by defining shared outcomes, framing the work to be done and organizing the team to deliver, defining trade-off principles, and establishing operating mechanisms. Experience with leading significant change at scale across a large organization. Well-rounded interpersonal skill set with the capacity to build strong, trusted relationships across a team to achieve a shared goal. Learning and Expertise 5-7 years ty program management with experience in working with FinTech’s, FIs, technology partner sales or business development. Experience working with partners through solution alignment, account management, product management, program management and business development engagements. Ability to lead with data driven insights, analyzing existing tools, databases, market research and partner data and present in a way that will help develop strategy and accelerate outcomes. How You Will Lead Ensure aligned Intuit-wide vision and strategy for key FI partnerships. Responsible for standards and best practices across key FI partner contracts, performance, resiliency, and innovation. Provide centralized visibility and tracking of product, feature, and opportunity requests from the business that pertain to FI partners. Responsible for business and technical enablement of key FI partners, including understanding current technical capabilities of the partner product portfolio and developing strategies to align Intuit’s goals and priorities with partner needs. Responsible for managing collaboration and centralized communication between Intuit teams and key FI partners. Monitors partner health and tracks progress against strategy and priorities. This includes setting team direction and expectations, inspiring employees, and instilling accountability. Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources and dashboarding. In partnership with supporting teams, develop scalable, repeatable playbooks for managing FI contractual requirements like audit rights, security and risk assessments etc. Orchestrate development of executive-level presentations and content.

jobTitle: Supportability Specialist
jobDescription: Overview Come join our team as a seasonal employee! We are developing cutting edge data protection and financial fraud prevention services that are central to all Intuit offerings. Our Investigators support the business by maintaining data security standards. What You'll Bring Associates Degree in related areas: fraud, investigation, law enforcement, IT Network/Cyber Security, audit, accounting, tax preparation, banking/financial institutions, process improvement practices OR a combination of high school diploma (GED) with at least two (2) years of related work experience Be team-oriented, self-motivated, and take initiative to make creative contributions to continuous improvement of processes Critical thinking and problem-solving skills Ability to derive sound, data-based theories for what is driving trends and insights Ability to multitask and adapt to a rapidly changing environment Proficiency in both Microsoft Office, particularly with an emphasis on Excel, and with G-Suite for Business Ideal candidate will have experience using case management systems such as Salesforce and various data loss prevention tools Moderate to advanced computer proficiency How You Will Lead Input needed data in case fields and ensure all data is accurate Investigate possible violations of established processes and procedures as it relates to data security Collaborate with other Risk Ops team members on both unconfirmed and confirmed findings Identify, track and report anomalies using defined processes Recommend actions and process changes to drive solutions for negative outliers or trends Meets deadlines and commitments Responds quickly to communications Be punctual and reliably show up to work/meetings Give and accept feedback from peers and supervisor(s) Available for weekends and overtime as needed Take ownership, act on fact and hold oneself accountable Strong attention to detail Able to follow documented processes and procedures

jobTitle: Tax Advisor: Product Manager 2
jobDescription: Overview Are you an expert of execution who leads with a clear product vision? Do you have a track record of solving big customer problems? Do you have experience advising clients to optimize their tax situation? We are looking for a strategic and creative problem solver with a passion for innovation to join our team as Product Manager 2 and revolutionize the way the world does taxes. Intuit Tax Advisor is a new product line that provides the ability for professional tax preparers to automate tax saving strategies that align to their clients short and long term goals. This new product will revolutionize tax preparation, enabling tax professionals to have a wealth of data analyzed to uncover opportunities to maximize their client’s tax situation and will help them advise their clients like they have never been able to before. What You'll Bring 3+ years designing and delivering world-class software products Demonstrated experience shipping end-to-end customer experiences The ability to understand and communicate technical concepts, manage tradeoffs and make fast decisions in the face of ambiguity Effective influencer and communicator across multiple teams The ability to turn data and customer insights into product strategy The desire and curiosity to understand and to solve a problem end-to-end Strong execution and ability to drive work to completion 3-7 years income tax planning/tax reduction and/or analysis experience Strong understanding of federal and state taxation, preferably in multiple tax categories: Individual, business, non-profit, estates and trusts, etc. Continuously develops research and analysis skills for federal tax legislation, code, regulations Previous in-depth utilization of tax preparation software is highly preferred How You Will Lead Deeply understand the customer with customer research, usability studies, experiments, and talking to customers Identify market opportunities through customer research and insights Prioritize customer needs and develop product roadmaps to deliver on meeting customer expectations Leverage data to ruthlessly prioritize a product backlog to focus on the most impactful customer problems Own the product lifecycle from requirements gathering through production and release Design and bring to market revenue generating, customer-driven software products Partner and collaborate cross-functionally with sales, marketing, engineering, user experience, analytics, and support to design, build, and launch features that deliver value to our customers and partners Build products that deliver great customer experiences Analyze and interpret tax law, especially its impact on tax planning and tax minimization strategies Develop business rules to ensure compliance with requirements Create and validate tax scenarios for completeness and accuracy focusing on the entire product experience. Analyze tax data to determine customer usage and impact, assess risks to tax scope and help develop risk mitigation strategies Builds and maintains relationships with internal groups that require tax expertise

jobTitle: Tax Associate – Seasonal, Remote - 3+Yrs Paid Tax Experience Required
jobDescription: Overview Do you have a minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year? If you're a tax professional, we need you to help our customers complete their taxes using TurboTax. You’ll advance our goal of “Powering Prosperity Around the World” by providing expert guidance and explanations of tax and technical terms to our customers. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by delighting our customers and empowering them to prepare their taxes. What You'll Bring Minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year required. If you're a tax professional, we need you to help our customers complete their taxes using TurboTax. You’ll advance our goal of “Powering Prosperity Around the World” by providing expert guidance and explanations of tax and technical terms to our customers. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by delighting our customers and empowering them to prepare their taxes. What You'll Bring Minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year required. Prior tax preparation experience in a tax practice or retail setting required. College degree a plus. The ideal candidate will have a background in business, finance, accounting, or tax Knowledge of tax laws, tax concepts and familiarity with form 1040 and schedules PTIN required Ability/motivation to expand expertise and obtain a tax credential or certification - Intuit offers a program to obtain your EA Strong customer service skills with ability to empathize and instill confidence Ability to work within a team to assist in preparation of accurate tax returns in a timely manner Strong Research skills and the ability to quickly use online resources to find answers Critical thinking and problem solving Persistence and determination Willingness to utilize audio/visual tools to communicate with customers Comfortable interacting with customers through video, in a professional way that represents the Intuit TurboTax brand well Friendly and reassuring on camera Bilingual (English/Spanish) communication skills (written & spoken) a plus For internal use: tst assoc How You Will Lead This is a seasonal position providing assistance to customers both assisting them in preparing their own returns and/or fully preparing customer tax returns Compiling/preparing tax returns for TurboTax Customers Gathering/organizing and accurately entering customer data in the federal and state tax returns for review Communicate directly with the customer as needed Coordinate customer meetings and follow-up Communicate updates to credentialed tax experts on assigned customers Will help customers who are working on their tax return with both product/software inquiries, as well as with tax questions and calculations Apply defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot and resolve product and tax support customer inquiries Will interact with customers utilizing strong written and verbal skills as well as deep customer empathy Typical Deliverables Accurate and complete customer data entered in tax returns for credentialed tax expert review High quality customer interactions and experiences Application of defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot, resolve issues and address routine Tax Support customer questions Proficient with technology and solid knowledge of computer operations and software. Utilize and leverage government websites and toolkits to seek out and deliver the right answer to the customer Document customer interactions Represent the Intuit TurboTax brand and spirit by demonstrating empathy for the customer, empowering and partnering with the customer, personalizing the experience, and providing them the confidence that they can do their own taxes If you are a Colorado resident, visit intuit.com/careers/colorado-job-postings-information/

jobDescription: Overview Are you a credentialed CPA, EA, or practicing attorney? And do you have a minimum 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year? What You'll Bring Must possess active unrestricted credential: EA (Enrolled Agent), CPA (Certified Public Accountant), or Practicing Attorney with strong tax preparation experience and extensive knowledge of tax laws Must possess or be able to obtain any related State licenses, certificates, permits or bonds Must possess active PTIN (Preparer Tax Identification Number) 3 or more years of recent experience preparing federal and state individual 1040 tax returns for clients/customers, using commercial tax preparation software Working knowledge of Circular 230 Audit experience a plus (IRS and state tax authorities) Proficient with technology; solid knowledge of computer operations and software Must have (or be willing to obtain) a dedicated hardwired internet connection Strong customer service skills - ability to interact with customers through video and audio tools in a way that is professional, friendly and reassuring Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision Critical thinking, problem solving, research skills and determination Bilingual (English/Spanish) communication skills (written & spoken) a plus For internal use: tst How You Will Lead This is a seasonal, virtual, customer-facing role; you will be using our state of the art video communication software (SmartLook) to interact with customers Help TurboTax customers who are working on their tax return with 1) Tax advice, including return preparation and signature when required; 2) Product/software inquiries, and 3) Tax calculations Create high quality customer interactions and experiences that instill confidence using deep customer empathy, and your deep knowledge and expertise in the field of tax preparation Utilize and leverage government websites, professional resources, and team expertise to seek out and deliver the right answer to the customer using everyday language Apply defined practices, procedures, and company policies to troubleshoot and resolve tax advice and preparation customer inquiries Document customer interactions If you are a Colorado resident, visit intuit.com/careers/colorado-job-postings-information/

jobTitle: Tax Payroll Operations Associate
jobDescription: Overview We are in search of a Payroll Tax Processor in our Reno, NV office & US Remote. To be successful you should bring with you an analytical mindset with strong critical thinking skills. You must have an aptitude to seamlessly flex between multiple payroll processes. You will be part of an operation that is customer-obsessed. You will be responsible for solving complex payroll tax issues accurately and timely for Federal, State, and Local tax agencies while effectively supporting a critical function for our payroll business. What You'll Bring Knowledge of general tax regulations, compliance, and tax payments. Knowledge of government agency filing systems. Financial, analytical and computer skills required Outstanding Customer Services skills. Mentor & Teacher mindset along with strong written and oral communication skills Ability to identify and improve processes Proactive problem solving skills High school, GED is required. Higher level education or is preferred. How You Will Lead Provide World Class customer service for established clients, answering questions related to payroll, tax filing and associated processes. Work with moderate supervision using detailed instructions on assignments, which require research and analysis to resolve any and all applicable issues, escalating issues when necessary to the next level of support. Communicate with clients, customers and upper level management utilizing provided software. Process documents and assignments efficiently. Maintain performance results and support strong communication skills in a virtual environment

jobTitle: Technical Accounting and Close Principal
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit's Accounting organization as a Technical Accounting Leader. We are looking for creative problem solvers with a passion for innovation to join our team and revolutionize the way the world does business. What You'll Bring Ability to research and understand technical details with ability to interpret and present in lay terms to non-technical finance and other business partners Confidence, good judgment, energy and personality to work in a dynamic, multi-business unit environment across all levels of management and across business units and functions Strong end-to-end process orientation with demonstrated analytical thinking, project management, and problem-solving skills Ability to influence people indirectly and work with people in multi-functional roles Excellent analytical and organizational skills, time prioritization and risk assessment Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting with minimum of 10+ years post-graduate experience; CPA/MBA highly desirable Professional skepticism and a testing/validation mindset. Background in public accounting or internal audit is a plus Strong PC, worksheet and word processing skills, including Microsoft Office and Google Suite. Excellent written and verbal communications, presentation and influencing skills, including the ability to elevate issues to the right level internally and externally to resolve How You Will Lead This is an accounting role as a Technical Accounting Leader within the Accounting organization. Position is located in San Diego, CA. As an individual contributor, responsibilities include identification, analysis of accounting issues, drafting of accounting positions and development of relevant processes and policies to enable timely, and accurate accounting. In the close, this role will also drive oversight of accounting processes including the closure of contract and issue analysis, and assist in the monitoring of key operating metrics for a timely and accurate close and reporting cycle. Overall responsibilities also include maintenance and cohesion of accounting policies across the organization. The ideal candidate must have a strong technical accounting, financial and SEC reporting background, be comfortable and confident navigating through new and complex matters and products, have outstanding communication and writing skills, and be attentive to details. Further, the ideal candidate will have the ability to collaborate and lead across multiple functions and roles, ability to translate, communicate and execute on technical literature and accounting/company policy, possess strong change management and communication skills, exhibiting the ability to drive issues through to resolution by prioritizing and managing multiple tasks while working with multiple teams. The candidate will develop strong working relationships with cross-functional partners and various levels of management. This Individual Will Primarily Be Responsible For Responsibilities include critically evaluating applicability of new accounting literature, preparing quarterly and ad-hoc technical accounting memos, maintaining effective internal controls and ensuring accounting activities are both regulatory and U.S. GAAP compliant. Research authoritative literature and provide technical accounting guidance on complex transactions such as acquisitions/divestitures, legal transactions, impairment, investments, including other non-routine complex business transactions. Providing accounting guidance for complex or unusual transactions such as acquisitions/divestitures, legal transactions, impairment, investments, and other non-routine complex business transactions. Review and monitor SAB99 analysis to evaluate errors in financial statements using both the "iron curtain" method and "rollover" method. Preparation or assistance in preparing the segment analysis to ensure compliance with requirements regarding consistency between internal and external reporting of reportable operating segments. Prepare timely, high quality technical accounting memos on all key technical accounting matters, including executive level summaries for leadership in addition to detailed analyses and conclusions for submission to the independent auditor. Review significant contracts and issues, and provide oversight across functional groups for the closure of issues, monitoring key operating metrics for a timely and accurate close and reporting cycle. Manage and act as liaison in Company-wide initiatives and cross-functional projects that directly impact accounting areas to ensure U.S. GAAP compliance. Examples include implementation of new accounting policies, due diligence and PPA entries on acquisitions and other significant business transactions such as divestitures, Company spin-offs, restructuring, debt offerings, complex capitalization projects, and other significant complex transactions Assist external reporting team with complex regulatory reporting matters. Providing detail support to the outside auditors and other consultants Manage multiple tasks under tight deadlines with strong attention to detail and accuracy Review accounting conventions to ensure the Company’s non-GAAP policies would not have a significant effect to any one period on a quantitative basis. To deliver on these responsibilities, this individual will be required to: Work cross functionally with different teams including corporate counsel, finance and strategy and various product teams in the process; Be a key part of the annual audit and quarterly reviews with external auditors, the corporate accounting team, finance and strategy and executive management; Research, evaluate and document technical accounting conclusions and reporting implications of complex and non-standard transactions, as well as general corporate accounting matters; Be flexible and a team player; and Lead or participate in special projects as needed.

jobTitle: Technology Manager - Talent Acquisition
jobDescription: Overview At Intuit, Technology (t4i) and Business (P&P) work together as One Team to deliver scalable and delightful technology solutions that deliver value, great customer experience and support the business growth. In this model, the Business defines What and Why, Technology determines the How. People & Places Technology Partner Manager plays a critical role in design & delivery of our global P&P systems. P&P Tech Partner Manager understands deeply the business of Talent Acquisition, the pain points and business priorities. You work very closely with the business, COE teams and leadership to create a Vision and Strategy for technology and data enablement. To deliver on this vision, you will partner with t4i to translate this vision into a Technology Roadmap and ultimately ensure the successful delivery of working products that are scalable and sustainable long-term. This role requires both strategic thinking as well as the ability to galvanize the team for the shared outcome, align resources and skills and see the work through successful delivery. In this demanding and fast-paced role, you represent the COE and through deep understanding of the business needs prioritize the work that is needed to enable the P&P services. Portfolio of work includes large cross-functional initiatives as well as All Other Work - systems and process enhancements and business critical changes to P&P systems. What You'll Bring Minimum of 6 years of progressive experience in Talent Acquisition and/ or leading Talent Acquisition technology Track record of driving vision and strategy for Talent Acquisition, experience working with SaaS platforms as well as internally built platforms, as well as understanding interdependencies with other capability areas Proven leader with ability to engage and motivate direct and indirect reports, 2+ years of experience managing teams Skilled in facilitating difficult prioritization discussions, with clear options and tradeoffs for the path forward Ability to manage project timelines across multiple work streams, as well as task assignments to ensure successful completion of the project within scope and on schedule. Experience with driving end-user experiences and needs, business process design and frameworks for business requirements & robust documentation A passion for developing solutions that deliver outstanding experiences Effective communicator - ability to simplify and communicate complex concepts and articulate clear messages to team members, stakeholders, and vendors Skilled at managing various internal and external stakeholders during complex implementation initiatives. Agile and able to work in ambiguous situations Possess an orientation for results and excellence, demonstrating conceptual and analytical thinking, initiative, and flexibility Business Process Analysis, Design Thinking practices Bachelor’s degree required; equivalent professional experience will be considered How You Will Lead Deeply understand the Talent Acquisition domain at Intuit and the short and long term priorities. Based on this understanding, define a technology vision through strong collaboration, relationship building, strategic partnerships, influence, and both internal/external best-practices. Partner with TA and the business to build strong technology foundation and drive change across all levels of stakeholders Build a high performing team of highly talented and engaged professionals, lead, coach, and develop team to continue raise the bar on partnering with P&P and t4i and delivering value for Intuit Build strong and trusting partnership with key partners in t4i organization, work to build One-Team culture. Galvanize team and lead highly complex initiatives with accountability/ responsibility that transcends multiple teams and projects across HR and IT organizations Define business processes and cross-functional connection points to ensure delivering the right outcomes for Intuit Manage business stakeholder relationships and governance structure. Manage strategic partnerships with key partners and vendors, ensuring they understand project deliverables, meet timing and cost deadlines, and collaborate with internal project stakeholders while augmenting internal team resources Ensure clear communication of project scopes, timing, and progress on an ongoing basis Be bold about the customer problem to solve, driving deep empathy and data-driven decision, with continuous experimentation to deliver for the customer. Ensure complete and full understanding and documentation of user stories and business requirements to enable technical solution designs, test cases, test evidence approval. Own and drive strategy for User Acceptance Testing (UAT) which includes creating, maintaining, and executing UAT scripts including regression testing the new functionality before deployment. Understand technology trends and practical application of existing, new and emerging technologies to enable evolving P&P business needs. Drive and implement best practices across all platforms, digital innovation, process automation.

jobTitle: VP Business Operations & Enterprise Planning
jobDescription: Overview Intuit’s mission is powering prosperity around the world. We do it by attracting the world’s top talent, bringing vital partners into our global platform, and leaving the world a better place through exceptional corporate citizenship. For our customers, we deliver more money, more time and more confidence. Every day we innovate with our flagship products: TurboTax, QuickBooks, Mint, Credit Karma and Mailchimp. The Vice President of Business Operations and Enterprise Planning will lead the Intuit-level Business Operations team, which is part of the Finance organization and will be instrumental in shaping Intuit’s journey to plan and operate effectively as a world-class SaaS and platform company. In this role, you will have the opportunity to manage and transform how Intuit operates. This includes the annual 3&1-year planning and continuous in-year planning processes, regular goal reviews, company-level key performance indicators (KPIs), and advancing the Business Operations craft across the company. This role will require a strong understanding of Intuit’s mission as well as business priorities across customer and product segments. You will partner closely with leaders to help create the vision, strategies and priorities for our team and the company overall. You will lead, grow, empower and inspire a team of seasoned Business Operations professionals, and work across the broader Business Operations, Program Management, Finance and Technology communities to help deliver Intuit’s strategic and financial goals. What You'll Bring 10+ years’ experience in senior operational or strategy leadership roles, ideally in Fintech, SaaS or platform companies, partnering with officers and executives across all functions and leading diverse teams Customer focus and empathy with track record of providing business operations services that deliver high quality user experiences Strong analytical and quantitative skills, and an ability to use data and metrics to support assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses Expertise in process design and scaled agile methodologies that help align entire organizations on a shared set of execution priorities and operationalize them Bias for action, ability to deal with ambiguity, and natural perseverance to overcome obstacles and deliver outcomes when leading change Ability to successfully manage c-level relationships, effectively partnering on financial planning, strategy development and execution, and collaborating in cross-functional environments Excellent at communicating complex ideas in a way that resonates across diverse groups of stakeholders, shapes strategic decisions, and generates momentum for meaningful change Track record of building, leading and inspiring high-performing teams Commitment to diversity and inclusion and a belief that diverse teams bring better business and customer outcomes BS/BA required, or equivalent experience; MBA or MS in Operations Management preferred How You Will Lead Lead the Intuit-level Business Operations team consisting of approximately 15 professionals and promote a positive, high-performing, innovative, growth-oriented, diverse and inclusive environment that consistently delivers results Develop and own an end-to-end planning and resource allocation approach grounded in agile best practices that bridges seamlessly from strategy to execution throughout the year and is integrated with our financial planning process Assess the quality and feasibility of Intuit’s plan and goals, surfacing areas of opportunity or misalignment and drive actions to address them with the executive leadership team Manage critical elements of Intuit’s overall operating rhythm including monthly goal reviews with all Vice Presidents and above across the company Maintain and enhance the company-level key performance indicator framework (“True North”) and ensure metrics are accessible in online dashboards in partnership with analytics teams Manage Intuit’s Net Promoter Score (NPS) measurement program, which conducts regular net promoter studies across all of Intuit’s major products Proactively identify opportunities to improve how Intuit operates as a platform company and lead cross-functional teams to deliver strategic operational initiatives with extreme ownership, for example identifying opportunities to automate or streamline processes Build and maintain strong relationships across the Intuit leadership team with a focus on Business Operations, Program Management, Finance and Technology to ensure that we are thinking holistically across multiple business segments and functions in the context of shaping our overall approach to plan and operate as a platform company Co-lead the Business Operations opportunity across the company in partnership with Business Operations leaders in other functions

jobTitle: Wireless Engineer
jobDescription: Overview Seeking an experienced Wired and Wireless LAN Systems Engineer to perform network design, development, installation/configuration, packaging, testing, implementing, and Tier 3 level troubleshooting of multi-vendor network-related equipment, including Rukus, Aruba and Cisco. What You'll Bring This position will require frequent travel (50-75%). When not on site, Engineers will be assisting in the development of project plans, designs and documentation for future sites as well as providing technical reach back to deployed installation teams. Education: Bachelor’s Degree, or a AS/AA or two-year Tech School with 3 years of experience; or HS/GED with 5 years of experience A minimum 3 years of relevant experience in wireless and network communications industry is required Aruba Certified Mobility Expert Professional (ACMP) or Aruba Certified Design Professional (ACDP) Familiarity with Ekahau Survey analysis software or equivalent Proficiency with Aruba’s Airwave management platform Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word and Visio. Must be able to multi-task,required to provide daily status/updates to supervisors/ managers Candidate must be a self-starter and possess the ability to identify all subtasks, prioritize work, and determine the tools / material required to accomplish their assigned task within the allotted time. Candidate must have strong problem-solving, as well as the ability to interact well with both internal and external engineers, technicians, and customers. Preferred Experience/Qualifications Aruba Certified Switch Professional (ACSP) Aruba Certified ClearPass Professional (ACCP) Aruba Certified Mobility Expert (ACMX) (8.x Code Version) Aruba Certified Design Professional (ACDP) Certified Wireless Network Professional (CWNP) or equivalent Certified Cisco Networking Professional (CCNP) How You Will Lead Responsible for the research and development of existing and new wireless technologies used to optimize and maintain Intuit corporate networks. Which include the design, configuration, implementation, testing and troubleshooting of Wireless and LAN components and networks. Working with 3rd party and internal departments in integrating wireless equipment with current WAN and security infrastructure. Optimizing wireless performance while fulfilling security requirements for user/device authentication, encryption and intrusion detection, i.e. 802.1x RADIUS Authentication using EAP-TLS. Responsible for installation, configuration, troubleshooting, and modification of wireless network hardware and software. Which include: Network Switches - Aruba, Cisco, Brocade (Ruckus) Aruba / Cisco WAN architecture in both indoor and outdoor environment Outdoor Point to point and Mesh Architectures Aruba Central / ClearPass/ Airwave management Aruba 8.x Mobility Environment Configuration and testing of QoS for voice & video, VLANS, ACL’s, GRE tunnels, VRRP, etc. 1x RADIUS authentication using EAP-TLS Indoor and outdoor Site Surveys Provides tier 3 support with LAN/WLAN networks, client devices, including hand-held devices and associated LAN and WAN connectivity. Responsible for documentation of installed networks, to include systems design, operations and implementations guides, Visio design drawings, etc. Maintains the security and integrity of all wireless hardware and software. Knowledge of Windows Server 200x OS platforms; to include DNS & DHCP functions. Performs other related duties as assigned.

jobTitle: Work From Home Tax Professional - 3+Yrs Paid Tax Experience Required
jobDescription: Overview Do you have a minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year? If you're a tax professional, we need you to help our customers complete their taxes using TurboTax. You’ll advance our goal of “Powering Prosperity Around the World” by providing expert guidance and explanations of tax and technical terms to our customers. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by delighting our customers and empowering them to prepare their taxes. What You'll Bring Minimum of 3 seasons of paid Tax Preparation experience, with a minimum of 30 tax returns per tax year required. Prior tax preparation experience in a tax practice or retail setting required. College degree a plus. The ideal candidate will have a background in business, finance, accounting, or tax Knowledge of tax laws, tax concepts and familiarity with form 1040 and schedules PTIN required Ability/motivation to expand expertise and obtain a tax credential or certification - Intuit offers a program to obtain your EA Strong customer service skills with ability to empathize and instill confidence Ability to work within a team to assist in preparation of accurate tax returns in a timely manner Strong Research skills and the ability to quickly use online resources to find answers Critical thinking and problem solving Persistence and determination Willingness to utilize audio/visual tools to communicate with customers Comfortable interacting with customers through video, in a professional way that represents the Intuit TurboTax brand well Friendly and reassuring on camera Bilingual (English/Spanish) communication skills (written & spoken) a plus For internal use: tst assoc How You Will Lead This is a seasonal position providing assistance to customers both assisting them in preparing their own returns and/or fully preparing customer tax returns Compiling/preparing tax returns for TurboTax Customers Gathering/organizing and accurately entering customer data in the federal and state tax returns for review Communicate directly with the customer as needed Coordinate customer meetings and follow-up Communicate updates to credentialed tax experts on assigned customers Will help customers who are working on their tax return with both product/software inquiries, as well as with tax questions and calculations Apply defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot and resolve product and tax support customer inquiries Will interact with customers utilizing strong written and verbal skills as well as deep customer empathy Typical Deliverables Accurate and complete customer data entered in tax returns for credentialed tax expert review High quality customer interactions and experiences Application of defined practices, procedures and company policies to troubleshoot, resolve issues and address routine Tax Support customer questions Proficient with technology and solid knowledge of computer operations and software. Utilize and leverage government websites and toolkits to seek out and deliver the right answer to the customer Document customer interactions Represent the Intuit TurboTax brand and spirit by demonstrating empathy for the customer, empowering and partnering with the customer, personalizing the experience, and providing them the confidence that they can do their own taxes If you are a Colorado resident, visit intuit.com/careers/colorado-job-postings-information/

jobTitle: Workday Business Analyst
jobDescription: Overview Come join Intuit’s Tech for Intuit (T4I) team as a Business Analyst Systems dedicated to Workday HCM & Compensation. We are an intensely passionate group with a need for action and an expectation that we all are solving for the E2E experience. Your insight into customer needs combined with a natural curiosity, learning mindset and business acumen will be required to ensure that we build features and functionality that solve big problems. You will be part of the energized and committed T4I Product organization, partnering closely with the Business and Engineering leadership team. What You'll Bring 4+ years of hands-on Workday Implementation Experience (Full implementations) and familiarity with one or more of the modules – HCM, Time Tracking, Absence, Compensation, Advance compensation preferably 3 + years of experience in functional role: requirements gathering, systems and process analysis and conducting design workshops Prior experience in leading HR transformation projects preferred Implementation experience in Advance Compensation module preferred Strong project management skills, including the ability to think and lead complex projects simultaneously. Ability to prioritize between features and architectural improvements and establish the operational rigor for building and improving the existing portfolio. Must be data and metrics driven with a “win together” mindset and track record of performance excellence, i.e., consistently delivering exceptional results, exceeding targets, and objectives High energy, self-starter with a positive mindset and with a "can do" attitude. How You Will Lead Work on Intuit’s enterprise-scale HR Systems to identify gaps in process and system workflows and recommend enhancements to improve them. Create and maintain product and release requirements backlog. Work with the global process owners to negotiate and prioritize enhancements rolled out to the organization. Balance priorities between strategic new development against ongoing production support Triage, diagnose, and assign/resolve issues originating from end-users, business process events, etc. Serve as the product evangelist, advocating for the customer every step of the way. Design future state processes, dashboards, and reports in consultation with users. Do rapid experimentation and test potential solutions with end users to get to the desired experience prior to implementation.

jobTitle: Workplace Global Engineering Program Manager
jobDescription: Overview Intuit’s mission is powering prosperity around the world. We do it by attracting the world’s top talent, bringing vital partners into our global platform, and leaving the world a better place through exceptional corporate citizenship. If you're a customer obsessed, critical thinker with a passion for providing advanced building engineering systems that creates sustainable and healthier buildings for our users, come join us! Joining Intuit’s People & Places team the role will lead global hard services programs including various facilities technical programs (e.g. BOS) for the corporate portfolio composed of circa 3MM sq. ft. This role will also lead the Places energy management & strategy in alignment with Intuit sustainability targets, developing sustainability strategies, globalization and development of hard services programs. This role will report to the Global Director of Workplace Services & Programs. The role will require travel through the portfolio, site audits, vendor audits, construction project reviews and relationship management. What You'll Bring Lead and develop technical solutions or system strategies for traditional control systems all the way to digital building technologies. Create standards, processes, charters, procedures, and other documentation to implement digital buildings Attend and drive meetings, determine project requirements, define, manage, drive the delivery of programs, create detailed cost and staffing estimates to inform project funding decisions, and define processes to ensure efficient and consistent execution. Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 7+ years' professional experience in a related position 5+ years’ experience in a leadership role or have had similar responsibilities Master's degree in a related field preferred Experience in project/program management and vendor management and experience in Smart Buildings, Internet of Things (IoT), or control systems. Experience in Smart Buildings, IoT, or control systems. How You Will Lead The role will be charged with program strategy to establish high standards across the portfolio, provide expertise and requirements for reporting dashboards and implement continuous improvement reviews. Develop methodology, standards and mechanisms to monitor program quality through site inspections, audits and action plans, ensuring that Intuits’ expectations in terms of standards, consistency, compliance targets and objectives are being met Clearly define global elements and standards and develop global service programs for areas of responsibility Work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Development, defining and overseeing the performance to SLAs and KPIs applicable for hard services, energy management and sustainability by vendors executing onsite services. Maintain the quality and consistency of the program delivery, ensuring vendor service performance by the vendor partner meets and/or exceeds the current KPI's. Monitor developments in external regulatory environments and work with all teams and partners to flag and advise on any possible business impacts of statutory changes Reflect on whether due diligence for building acquisitions is needed for transactions -As part of due diligence process for real estate acquisitions, analyze critical system infrastructure and provide recommendations as needed. Build and directly manage a team of contractors (high performing team of contractors and partners) Create working relationship with all Intuit global and regional operations leaders
